title: Niger Delta communities in ‚Äògreat danger‚Äô as month-old oil spill continues
text:
This article originally appeared in Mongabay.

Featured image: Barge transporting oil drums in the Niger Delta. Image by Stakeholder Democracy via Flickr (CC BY-NC-ND 2.0).

Oil has been spilling from a wellhead in Nigeria‚Äôs Bayelsa state for a month now, with the local company responsible unable to contain it.

Experts say the scale and duration of the spill is so severe that it‚Äôs imperative that local communities be relocated for their safety.

Oil spills and other forms of pollution caused by the industry are common in Bayelsa, the heart of the oil-rich Niger Delta.

Companies, including foreign oil majors, are largely left to self-declare the spills that frequently occur, but face only token fines for failing to respond quickly.

Crude oil from a blowout has been pouring into creeks in the Niger Delta since Nov. 5, with the well‚Äôs owner, Nigerian energy firm Aiteo, unable to contain the spill and specialists called in to help.

The blowout, at a non-producing well in the Santa Barbara field in Bayelsa state, has caused extensive pollution of rivers and farmland in the Nembe local government area, according to the state governor, Douye Diri. According to the News Agency of Nigeria, he said Aiteo should not think that ‚Äúthis criminal neglect of its facilities and disregard for human life and the environment, as demonstrated by its conduct, will not be accounted for.‚Äù

In a statement released Nov. 22, the company blamed the incident on sabotage. ‚ÄúAiteo remains committed to ascertaining, immediately the well head is secure, the immediate and remote causes of the leak which will be driven by a [joint investigative visit] that will follow,‚Äù it said.

The oil industry in Nigeria attributes many oil spills to sabotage by people trying to steal crude. Nigeria‚Äôs National Oil Spill Detection and Response Agency (NOSDRA), which relies almost entirely on the industry itself for access to on- and offshore oil facilities, reports that around 75% of spills are caused by sabotage and theft.

The joint team initially despatched to the Nembe spill was unable to determine the cause of the spill, as the wellhead could not be accessed ‚Äúdue to hydrocarbon fumes that saturated the atmosphere in the area.‚Äù A video of the spill site, captured Nov. 29, showed a high-pressure stream of brownish liquid spraying through the creeks from a wellhead as technicians worked on the site.

The scale of the spill has overwhelmed local disaster response capabilities, and U.S.-headquartered oil-well control specialist Halliburton Boots and Coots has been drafted in to ‚Äúkill the well,‚Äù a process that involves injecting cement into the well to plug it.

‚ÄúWork is still ongoing at the site to stop the spill,‚Äù NOSDRA director-general Idris Musa told Mongabay last week, but all activities around the well were temporarily suspended Nov. 29 to allow the well-kill operation to proceed.

Decades of destruction

The Niger Delta is rich in biological diversity and natural resources. Its creeks, swamps and mangrove forests are home to fishing and farming communities as well as threatened species including manatees (Trichechus senegalensis), chimpanzees (Pan troglodytes ellioti), and the Niger Delta red colobus (Piliocolobus epieni).

But decades of oil production have made the region one of the most polluted places on Earth. NOSDRA recorded 639 oil spills in just the past two years, resulting in 28,003 barrels spewed into the environment, according to the agency‚Äôs data.

Bayelsa is where oil was first discovered in Nigeria, in 1956. In the decades since, oil spills from wells and pipelines have contaminated farmland and water bodies, and exposed residents to toxic chemicals. Flaring of gas has led to acid rain falling on the area, while contributing to making Nigeria the 17th largest producer of greenhouse gas emissions in the world.

This environmental destruction has been caused by oil majors including Shell, Chevron and Eni. The Nembe well was bought from Shell by Lagos-based Aiteo in 2015.

‚ÄúIt is extremely disturbing because the trend we are seeing now is that international oil companies know that their equipment are dilapidated, and to avoid responsibility, they move offshore and sell to gullible local companies who think they can make profit and are not ready or equipped to [deal with] this kind of emergencies,‚Äù said Nnimmo Bassey, an environmentalist and founder of the Health of Mother Earth Foundation (HOMEF), a prominent green NGO in Nigeria.

Dead and dying trees near the site of a previous Niger Delta oil spill in 2020. Image by Sosialistisk Ungdom (SU) via Flickr (CC BY-ND 2.0).

Consequences ‚Äî just not for oil companies

The impact of the Nembe spill on local communities and the environment is still to be determined, but Samuel Oburo, an environmental activist affiliated with Friends of the Earth, who lives about 50 kilometers (30 miles) from Nembe, says villagers in the area have been badly impacted.

‚ÄúI can tell you that the people there face great danger. They have started crying out. They have started experiencing strange illnesses due to the unfriendly atmosphere this spill has exposed the community to,‚Äù he told Mongabay over the phone.

But getting oil firms to clean up or pay for environmental crimes in Nigeria is difficult. Legal claims for compensation can take years, even decades, and companies are expected to pay relatively little in fines when they err.

NOSDRA‚ÄôS regulations say oil companies have 24 hours to respond to the discovery of a spill. A joint visit by government agencies, company officials and community representatives should take place as soon as possible. But a 2018 study by Amnesty International found frequent delays, with some spills continuing for months after they were reported.

Shell, one of the largest operators in the country, visited spill sites within 24 hours on just 26% of occasions, Amnesty said. The slowest response time recorded was when Eni took 430 days to respond to a spill in Bayelsa state. ‚ÄúThese delays point to serious negligence. Shell and Eni are wealthy, powerful multinationals: why can‚Äôt they act faster? Why can‚Äôt they do more?,‚Äù the report said.

But the penalties for noncompliance are negligible: 1 million naira ($2,400) for an initial default, and an additional 500,000 naira for every day after that.

‚ÄúHow much is N500,000 to an oil company?‚Äù NOSDRA‚Äôs Idris Musa said. An amendment increasing the fines is in progress.

Speaking to the ongoing spill at Nembe, HOMEF‚Äôs Bassey said that considering the apparent scale and duration of the latest spill, the safest option for residents of the area is to be relocated. ‚ÄúThis area does not have pipe-borne water, and when the river is covered with crude oil, it means they have to depend on imported water,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSome may drink from that river because these areas are permanently polluted and they have no option. Children will swim in that river and people will drink from that river.‚Äù

‚ÄúCrude oil contains very toxic heavy metals like lead; you know, lead affects a lot things concerning people, the nervous system, causes cancer. You have mercury in oil, you have cadmium, you have arsenic and benzene and many others,‚Äù he told Mongabay.

‚ÄúSo anybody eating fish from that river is in trouble already. So the relief that they are giving, I believe they should actually evacuate people from that territory at this time.‚Äù

Oburo agreed: ‚ÄúSo long as the spill continues, there is nothing that can be done to restore the air quality. The only solution is to evacuate those people from there because their lives are precious.‚Äù

Bayelsa government spokesperson Dan Alabrah said the state is providing relief materials to communities, but had no plans to relocate them.

title: We Were Featured In British Vogue | Little Miss Twiggie Twinkles
text:
Somebody pinch me I must be dreaming!

Our already very popular ‚Äî Christmas Selection Box ‚Äî was featured in British Vogue!

To appear in such a unique magazine truly is something special for any small business & we were absolutely delighted when first contacted by Vogue magazine.

So What Is Vogue Magazine?

Vogue is a monthly fashion and lifestyle magazine that covers many topics, including fashion, beauty, culture & living.

With some of the biggest celebrities in the world appearing on the Vogue magazine cover.

One of biggest British magazines with 861,000 monthly readers, In 2020 they hit there highest traffic month ever on Vogue.co.uk with more than 5 Million Readers and 44 Million Page Views. Vogue also has over 4 Million Instagram followers.

How Did We Get Featured In Vogue Magazine ?

Sat on the sofa late one night in September we received an email from a Associate Classified Sales Manager from British Vogue to say they had come across our brand online and that we would be the perfect fit to showcase on there upcoming luxury interiors advertorial that was being created for British Vogue.

To say we were shocked would be a understatement!!

We were then presented with the different options available to us about being featured in Vogue‚Äôs Grotto‚Äô a showcase that is designed to feature a varied range of premium interiors companies providing inspiration across all aspects of Vogue‚Äôs ideal home.

We chose to appear in the December, January and February issues of the magazine & also on there digital Interiors showcase, Vogue Retail which is a subsection on Vogue.co.uk.

On the January Issue of Vogues front cover is Kristen McMenamy, indisputably the model of the moment, from her high-profile campaign and catwalk work, to her impactful cult Instagram account.

Little Miss Twiggie Twinkles Christmas Gifts For Her featured on the pages of Vogue‚Äôs Health Kick in this issue.

Gaining this amazing exposure by featuring in this unique magazine has given Little Miss Twiggie Twinkles a amazing boost! Not every company in the world can say

‚Äú We Were Featured In Vogue ‚Äú

With the February edition still to be released & being contacted by many of the other Conde` Nast magazines related to British Vogue the future is looking bright for our wax melt & gift shop based in the stunning Lake District.

With our ever growing range of highly scented wax melts, gift sets for all occasions & home fragrance products Little Miss Twiggie Twinkles is the one stop shop for all things that smell amazing!

title: Kyber Ecosystem Report #28 (2021 Recap)
text:
Happy Holidays and Happy New Year! We are delighted to bring together the most exciting developments at Kyber Network in this year-end ecosystem report for 2021. It‚Äôs been a really eventful year for the Kyber community!

Among many updates, we successfully completed our Kyber 3.0 upgrade and the DMM has been rebranded as KyberSwap after requests from the community. Yes, KyberSwap is back, better than ever üòé

KyberSwap is on 6 chains now: Ethereum, Polygon, Binance Smart Chain, Avalanche, Fantom, and Cronos, with more on the way. On these networks, you can instantly swap tokens with the best rates via DEX aggregation, earn by adding liquidity, and participate in liquidity mining for bonus rewards.

Total Trade Volume: Over $4B

Over $20M in fees collected for 20,000+ liquidity providers

All-time-high TVL of ~$500M and $50B in Amplified Liquidity

Another highlight of the year: Backed by our strong community and various ecosystem activities and media coverage, Kyber recently crossed 200,000 Twitter followers! Huge thanks to our Kyber Network $KNC community for your strong support through these years!

Below we give a recap of what transpired this year and share our key focus for 2022.

KyberSwap

After months in beta, DMM was relaunched as KyberSwap with a seamless user interface to provide the best trading and earning experience in DeFi.

‚úÖTrade at the best rates via DEX aggregation

‚úÖLiquidity Providers earn more with dynamic fees and high capital efficiency

‚úÖAudited by ChainSecurity, Insured by Unslashed Finance for $20M

KyberSwap was recently deployed on Fantom and Cronos (first DEX aggregator to launch on the Cronos network), and now brings the best token rates to 6 supported blockchains: Ethereum, Polygon, BSC, Avalanche, Fantom, and Cronos (more networks like Aurora/NEAR coming soon!)

We look forward to providing the best token prices and enhanced liquidity for traders, liquidity providers, and Dapp developers on any network we are expanding to.

‚≠êÔ∏è You can easily use KyberSwap to swap tokens at the best rates on supported networks and farm bonus rewards! KyberSwap will improve the overall trading and liquidity provision experience for ecosystem users, Dapps and NFT games.

Dynamic Trade Routing (Aggregation) for the Best Rates

KyberSwap users can get the best rates due to DEX (decentralized exchange) aggregation via our novel dynamic trade routing algorithm. This saves users time and effort when swapping any token!

KyberSwap sources liquidity across these different DEXs to help achieve the best prices for any token swap, on any supported network. The optimal route is identified and trades split through 30 DEXs (over $26 Billion in combined liquidity catering to 20,000+ tokens), including KyberSwap‚Äôs own liquidity pools, to find the best rate on different chains ‚Äî Ethereum, Polygon, BSC, Avalanche, Fantom, and Cronos.

Popular decentralized exchanges such as Uniswap, Sushiswap, Curve, Balancer, QuickSwap, Pancakeswap, Traderjoe, Pangolin, SpookySwap, SpiritSwap, VVS Finance, and more have already been integrated.

Swap any token at the best rates on KyberSwap! Some of the popular tokens available at the best rates:

Single Token Deposit

Adding liquidity into a pool is a core function for thousands of liquidity providers. With our new Single Token Deposit feature, you can use just one token in the pair (e.g. ETH in an ETH-KNC pool) to deposit and add liquidity to the pool, and receive the corresponding liquidity provider (LP) tokens, all in one seamless transaction.

Single Token Deposit makes liquidity provision even easier, saving you time and effort!

Easily add liquidity into pools using either token in the pair, all in one seamless transaction.

When removing liquidity, you can also automatically convert it to your desired token (either token from the token pair) in a single transaction.

ZKyber: New L2 DEX Trading Experience based on ZK-Rollups

Building upon our past research into Rollup scaling solutions, we unveiled our ZKyber testnet on KyberSwap! ZKyber is an L2 scaling solution that provides a faster, cheaper, and fairer DeFi trading experience on Ethereum, with anti-frontrunning capabilities. This can potentially address issues of network congestion, high gas fees, and frontrunning on Ethereum. Test ZKyber for FREE and earn a share of $50,000! Learn more.

Partnerships, Collaborations, and Joint Liquidity Mining

Sipher Partnership and $50 Million Campaign on Ethereum

Sipher is a MOBA and Exploration Game with an end-game goal of creating an Open World Social Game.

üöÄWe have partnered with Sipher to run a $50M Liquidity Mining Campaign (ongoing) to provide the best liquidity and rates for the SIPHER token! Sipher has chosen the capital-efficient KyberSwap protocol and DEX Aggregator for enhanced token liquidity for SIPHER-ETH on Ethereum. Watch how to farm SIPHER here.

$1M Liquidity Mining with Unbound on Ethereum

Unbound Finance is a decentralized, cross-chain liquidity protocol that is building the next money lego by unlocking liquidity from AMMs.

üöÄ There are UND-USDC and UND-KNC pools on KyberSwap on Ethereum, and liquidity providers can earn a share of ~$1M in UNB and KNC liquidity mining rewards (ongoing)! Liquidity providers can add any amount of liquidity to the eligible UND-KNC and UND-USDC pools on the KyberSwap on Ethereum to farm and unlock their share of the rewards.

$1M+ Liquidity Mining Campaign with Pegaxy on Polygon

Pegaxy is a racing game with a futuristic mythological styling. In this game, players will participate in PvP format races with randomized elemental variables to win rewards.

üöÄPegaxy has set up a PGX-USDT pool on KyberSwap (Polygon). The PGX-USDT farm has been extended for one more month! Add liquidity and stake your LPs to earn your share of $1M+ in rewards (ongoing)!

$1M Liquidity Mining Campaign with Elpis Battle on BSC

Elpis Battle is an open-world RPG that features the play-to-earn model. Gamers can enjoy epic battles and earn sizable rewards at the same time.

üöÄElpis Battle has set up a EBA-BUSD pool on KyberSwap (BSC). EBA Yield Farming on KyberSwap (BSC) will distribute $1M+ in rewards to liquidity providers (ongoing)! Learn more.

Other Rainmaker Liquidity Mining Campaigns

Ethereum

BSC

Polygon

Avalanche

Visit KyberSwap‚Äôs Farm page to see all the active eligible pools and yield farms!

Krystal + Kyber Network Partnership

Kyber has partnered with Krystal DeFi to collaborate on their token sale launchpad KrystalGO as well as other DeFi initiatives!

KNC holders can enjoy better allocation for KrystalGO token sales if they stake KNC. Krystal will also have a KNC staking service to allow holders to earn rewards from KyberDAO.

Aside from those above, in 2021 Kyber also collaborated with Velo Labs, Mercurial Finance, Asia DeFi Network, DeFi Alliance, Ren Alliance, and Zcash Developer Alliance.

Integrations

Any Dapp or aggregator developer can integrate KyberSwap since the protocol is completely permissionless.

DEXTools

KyberSwap is integrated with leading trading analytics platform DEXTools! More than 30 Million users can now view and access KyberSwap‚Äôs token pairs and the best rates on Ethereum, BSC, and Polygon. DEXTools have also created a DEXT-KNC pool in which you can add liquidity to earn fees on pool trades! Learn more here. In addition, DEXTools has added liquidity to the DEXT-KNC pool on KyberSwap (BSC).

Rome Terminal

KyberSwap has been integrated by multi-blockchain network, multi-DEX, and multi-dApp trading interface Rome Terminal. DeFi users on Rome Terminal will enjoy very high capital efficiency as well as better token liquidity and rates. This also means a lot more volume will be generated through KyberSwap and in turn more fees for LPs and KNC voters.

Kattana Terminal

KyberSwap now provides amplified liquidity to Kattana‚Äôs Trading Terminal! This integration means the best token rates and high capital efficiency for thousands of Kattana users.

Coin98 Wallet

Coin98 Wallet integrated KyberSwap to provide highly capital efficient liquidity provision to hundreds of thousands of users around the world! Users can easily participate in the ongoing Rainmaker liquidity mining campaigns using Coin98.

DEX Aggregators

Since KyberSwap has very capital efficient pools, other top DEX aggregators such as 1inch, Paraswap, 0x API, Matcha and Slingshot have also integrated KyberSwap to provide competitive rates for their users.

KyberSwap Data Analytics

Top Dapps and data analytics sites such as CoinGecko, Coinmarketcap, DeFi Pulse, DeBank, DeFi Llama, vfat.tools, APY.vision, Token Terminal, The Graph, Zapper, and DEXTools are now tracking KyberSwap statistics.

KyberDAO and KIPs

KyberDAO is a decentralized community platform that allows KNC token holders to participate in governance. KNC holders can stake KNC to vote on important proposals.

Over $10M worth of rewards have been distributed to KyberDAO voters!

The Kyber community can propose and vote on Kyber Improvement Proposals (KIPs) through KyberDAO. Some of the recent KIP topics we covered:

KIP-18: Advance KNC Allocation for Small-Scale Liquidity Mining Activities

KIP-17: Joint LM with Unbound Finance, EvryNet and DeFi Yield Protocol

KIP-16: New joint liquidity mining campaigns with Jarvis Network, DeFi Warrior and Ape In on Polygon, BSC and Avalanche

KIP-15: Additional LM on ETH & Polygon

KIP-14: Allocate an additional 5M KNC from the ecosystem fund & transfer ~1.78M KNC for Avalanche LM

‚≠êÔ∏è Please visit the Kyber community forum to discuss how we can improve Kyber Network together! For example, we aim to improve our DAO design and lower gas costs for voters. Latest Kyber developments are discussed in our Community Calls on Discord. Follow KyberDAO twitter.

KNC (Kyber Network Crystal)

The KNC token will continue to exist and will play an increasingly important role on KyberSwap, incentivizing trading and liquidity, as well as enabling governance. KNC token holders will greatly benefit from the growth of KyberSwap. Apart from KyberSwap, the number of use cases and the support for KNC in the DeFi ecosystem continue to grow:

After the token migration earlier this year, new KNC is available on top centralized exchanges (we are working with Coinbase to support the migration as well). We aim to improve the utility and increase the use cases for KNC over time.

New KNC supported on Multichain (formerly AnySwap)

With the Multichain (formerly AnySwap) cross-chain router, KNC can now be easily routed across 5 different chains; Ethereum, BSC, Polygon, Fantom, and Avalanche!

Sharing about KyberSwap with the DeFi world

Given the offline restrictions caused by the pandemic, Kyber team members participated in multiple online events instead to complement our various marketing initiatives to spread awareness and educate users. Here are some highlights:

Kyber in the Media

The rebranding of DMM to KyberSwap and its new innovative features were covered by various media and news sites such as Coindesk, Cointelegraph, The Block, DefiantNews, Bankless, Decrypt, Defipulse, Defiprime, AltcoinBuzz, Dapp.com, and Crypto Briefing. News can be found in the Media sub-channel that we have created for you on our Discord.

Take a look at the Decrypt article on KyberSwap and the article on Forbes that mentioned Kyber Network‚Äôs rise.

KyberSwap‚Äôs growth in different networks was also highlighted by crypto media such as CryptoRank, Lunar Crush, and DeFi News and our yield farming opportunities covered by popular research reports such as those by Delphi Digital.

Defiprime also has an excellent article explaining what is KyberSwap and how it provides the best rates for users and higher earnings for liquidity providers.

To continue staying up to date, join our Discord here and follow Kyber on Twitter.

Looking ahead: 2022 and beyond

With its multiple benefits over other DEX platforms, KyberSwap is well positioned for growth. In the immediate future, we plan to raise greater awareness of the benefits of KyberSwap and aggressively drive user adoption.

More DEXs and networks: We will continue improving our DEX aggregation algorithm; deploying on many other networks beyond Ethereum, BSC, Polygon, Avalanche, Fantom, NEAR/Aurora, and Cronos, and integrating liquidity sources from all popular DEXs on each network in order to achieve the best swap rates.

More liquidity and token variety: Another key focus is working with top projects to increase the variety of token pairs and enhancing liquidity (and increasing TVL) in the liquidity pools. Given our high capital efficiency, projects like Pegaxy, Elpis Battle, ZukiMoba, Unbound, Evrynet, DeFi Warrior, Wanaka Farm, Creator, StepHero, Sipher, The Parallel, and many others have chosen KyberSwap to be their liquidity platform of choice right after their token sales.

In addition, we aim to quickly adapt to upcoming DeFi and GameFi trends by investing in and partnering with popular projects in the space, while continuing our research into Ethereum L2 scaling solutions such as ZKyber. We will share more details in 2022, stay tuned!

We continue to be committed to our vision to become the liquidity hub for the decentralized economy, where any user or application can easily access the required tokens for their liquidity needs at the best rates.

Kyber is a community-driven project and we always welcome more suggestions for improvement, be it in terms of the UI/UX, liquidity, integrations, or other areas. You can reach us through our social media channels and this contact us form.

We wish everyone happy holidays and a great year ahead. See you in 2022 as we carve new milestones together! ü§∂üéÑüéâ

Onward, Kyber Network!

title: PPC Management Services
text:
What is PPC marketing and what are it‚Äôs benefits?

Let‚Äôs begin with the fundamentals. What is PPC? PPC is a pay-per-click type of online advertising where the money is paid for each click to a landing page. Pay only for the action you want to target.

This kind of advertisement is considered to be the most effective and efficient method of driving quality traffic to your website in a short time. Promotions aren‚Äôt shown to people who are not your target audience. They are shown to people who have similar interests and searches. These are your potential clients if you‚Äôve set up your campaign correctly.

The term ‚Äúcontextual advertisement‚Äù is a reference to this particular fact. It is based on the user‚Äôs previous and current web searches. It is displayed in a specific context, such as search terms or content on the web page. When you launch the PPC campaign, the advertiser will specify exact keywords and set limitations on where it is, when, and in what order the advertisements should be displayed. Contextual advertisements can be a form of a text fragment, a graphic banner animation, or video.

Before we go on to the details for setting up context ads, be familiar with the fundamental definitions and be aware of the meaning behind PPC can mean in terms of marketing and the way it functions.

In contrast to SEO ( Search Engine Optimization ), it takes time for websites to rank organically on search results. PPC is an approach to online advertising that helps get your site to the top of search results. At the top of Google quickly. It‚Äôs a good strategy for companies seeking to boost traffic flow and convert SEO-related campaigns to gain traction or for businesses that don‚Äôt want to spend money on SEO.

Learn more about PPC and how it can improve your business growth with TBA.

Benefits of PPC for Small and New Businesses

The most efficient and cost-effective advertising method on the internet, PPC is a particularly crucial lead generation tool for smaller and newly-established companies that aren‚Äôt yet competing for organic search listings. It allows you to compete against large corporations to compete with the same audience, depending on your budget.

In addition to the obvious advantage of increased exposure on the web, PPC is also typically employed to increase sales and boost brand recognition. Since it is an effective form of advertising, it can reach people who are actively searching for your services or products and are more likely to buy.

Before you begin with your initial PPC advertising campaign, think about your budget, your advertising goals, and your risk tolerance. Would you be better off hiring an experienced PPC firm to oversee your campaigns to ensure that you are getting value out of your budget? If you‚Äôre confident in the decision to run your PPC campaign on your own, be sure to have clear goals for conversion in your mind and a realistic budget to begin. Remember that you can always get assistance by contacting experts like the PPC experts from TBA, regardless of whether you‚Äôre planning your first or your 100th PPC campaign.

title: Leverage AI to improve your ad targeting strategy
text:
Defining an ad-group targeting strategy for your PPC accounts is one of the most important aspects of running successful PPC campaigns. A poorly defined strategy can result in wasted spending on an audience. Luckily this doesn‚Äôt have to be the case; there are techniques you can use to reach your desired audience more efficiently than before. Today‚Äôs post is about leveraging machine learning to create ad groups that engage with customers based on their micro and niche interests.

While many of us are familiar with using ad groups based on site-search queries to simplify our Search Ads setup, another method can be rewarding. It‚Äôs called interest-based advertising, and it can help you target a particular group of people with high precision. Yeah, it may not be sound like a new thing for you. However, I‚Äôm telling you a completely new methodology powered by a sophisticated AI mechanism and strengthened by social media platforms.

There is not much left after completing the keyword studies about your brand, product, and service to reach and penetrate the target audience. You did not fully match your target audience yet; you‚Äôve only increased your visibility so far. You should reach your target audience and drive leads through the communities they are involved in, the content they consume, the trends they are interested in, and their researched topics.

Albus can analyze any audiences you want to reach, and it makes it through social media where everybody shares their opinions, emotions, affinity, and much more! With its sophisticated AI algorithm Albus finds niches and micro interests of any audience. And it doesn‚Äôt end here; Albus continuously segments that audience according to those interests and reveals what they are searching on Google.

Now you can target your audience and reach your true potential. You have keywords that are insights gained through superior machine learning for directly targeting search terms or creating custom audiences.

From now on, you can create your segmented interest-specific ad groups, review their search metrics, assign a budget separately and start driving a high amount of qualified traffic.

title: Main Guide for 10 Important Benefits of PPC Advertising
text:
Pay Per Click advertising is famous these days. It is a model of internet advertising. The advertiser has to pay each time his ad gets clicked. This is a process of making people visit your website. Every business aims to find a low-cost, high-impact marketing option. This trend has become more famous after the pandemics and lockdown. Customers do a lot of online shopping these days. This is the reason behind the excessive use of PPC by businesses. You pay a small amount every time someone clicks on your advertisement. Here you only have to pay for the traffic that these advertisements generate.

The most efficient PPC ads direct their users to perform a worthy task. And it can be of various types. Like it can be about buying your product or filling a form.

Skyscraper in this context is a famous search engine optimisation technique. This technique is discussed in this article as well. This article also provides the main guide for the ten important benefits of PPC advertising. Through these, you can buy essays online with ease these days.

Contribution of PPC in Business Goals

PPC advertising can aid you in getting a wide range of marketing and business goals. These goals can be of any time range. They can include high-level brand exposure or thought leadership. They can also include lead submission or e-commerce sales. Every type of goal can be tracked through this domain. This is because PCC is an effective tool for aligning website traffic drivers to end goals. This era is the one of thought leadership and content marketing. PPC can initiate nurturing the middle of the funnel by advertising content downloads in the present age. PPC also provides aid to various parts of the sales funnel. You can also buy essays online that relate to this topic and domain in this context.

PPC and Skyscraper Technique

Skyscraper is an effective and famous search engine optimisation technique. It is known that PPC can be made more effective by applying the skyscraper technique. This is because it lets you save time in content creation. It does so through crowd-sourcing of certain content. Outsourcing of content is done to express addressing and presenting content. A main component of skyscrapers is outdoing the present content. Another benefit of this is providing extreme values to your users. You can also earn search traffic by optimising the end search experiences of users. You can increase the overall authority of your site as well. This is because it makes you earn a high number of backlinks to your authoritative content.

Measurable

One of the major benefits of PPC advertising is that it is measurable and trackable. You can use Google Ads with Google Analytics. You can also assess the performance of PPC advertising easily. This is the most important benefit of PPC advertising.

Cost-Effective

You have complete control over budgeting, targeting, and placement using PPC advertisements. This is because you can easily define your spot between budget and result through this. You can easily buy essays online if you feel the need to write on this domain.

Instant Traffic

PPC advertising provides instant traffic. It helps in keeping your content on the first page of Google. This is one of the best content optimisation techniques. Because climbing through organic search ranking takes a lot of time. You can do this in no time through PPC advertising means.

Driving of Leads

PPC advertising helps you in driving leads. It makes it easy for customers to find you as well. It also makes sure that you reach the right audience. Apart from this, it ensures that people can reach you when you‚Äôre looking for a product or the best dissertation writing service you‚Äôre selling. In other words, your product will be placed in front of the people who‚Äôre looking for it. In this way, it aids in driving the leads.

Leads to Positive ROI

PPC advertising can be both measured and tracked. Since PPC advertising can be measured, it can be improved as well. You can improve PPC advertising until they improve and produce a positive ROI. These days you can easily buy essays online that relate to this aspect.

Aid in SEO Strategy

You can evaluate keyword strategy while using PPC advertising. It would help if you did this before adoptinga long strategy for advertising or marketing your product/service. You can acquire a complete overview of the keyword as well. There are no restrictions with PPC advertising as the keywords are not hidden due to any privacy reasons.

Independency on Algorithm Alterations

The most important advantage of PPC advertising is that it does not depend on the changes in search engine algorithms. PPC advertisement provides stability no matter what.

Easy Production

Another advantage of PPC advertisements is that they are easy to produce. You are not required to have special skills to produce these advertisements.

title: Bunker 2171 Labs in The Sandbox Game NFT Metaverse
text:
What is The Sandbox Game? The Sandbox is an open, decentralized metaverse that enables artists and consumers to create, build, and own digital assets secured on top of the Ethereum blockchain network. These digital assets or Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) are the items and project-specific avatars that players can earn and use for the wildly diverse gaming, entertainment, and social experiences being developed inside The Sandbox ecosystem. For those less familiar with this new ecosystem, the Sandbox Map proves to be an excellent tool to help visualize where individual experiences are being built by world-class artists.

The Sandbox Game Social Hub experience. Voxel human-like Sandbox avatar and a MutantKong 1:1 avatar from Bunker 2171 Labs, MutantKong #002.

Sandbox NFTs and their use cases are wide-ranging and are often a critical reward component for an emerging new gameplay model, play-to-earn (P2E). In contrast to older pay-to-play models, a P2E game rewards the gamer for participating in the experience, often with in-game items, NFTs, or tokens that the player now directly owns. These NFTs or tokens can be used within the game, sold on marketplaces, or potentially used in other Sandbox experiences. The Sandbox is also interesting in that the actual infrastructure itself is available to own. SAND, the native token of The Sandbox ecosystem, is used to purchase surprising large grids of virtual real estate via the frequent Sandbox land sales.

The Sandbox Game is currently in the Alpha stage of development, with the role out of the Sandbox DAO, virtual concerts, and over 1,000 games throughout 2022. Gaming veterans, world-class entertainers, and major brands building in The Sandbox include Atari, Roller Coaster Tycoon, The Walking Dead, Adidas, and Snoop Dogg. With The Sandbox raising more than $93 million from investors in 2021 alone, it‚Äôs a safe bet to think that the entire ecosystem is staged for significant developments in the future and will likely be positioned as one of the premier metaverse experiences in this new web3, blockchain-enabled internet of value.

Bunker 2171 Labs NFT Ecosystem

Being open and decentralized means that many individuals and projects are also building unique experiences in The Sandbox, including the ambitious ecosystem from Bunker 2171 Labs. Bunker 2171 was conceived by the founders and developers who go by the pseudonyms in the Bunker 2171 discord, John Kongor, and General Reese. Bunker 2171 is a continuously growing set of NFT collections; interconnected with utility elements to incentivize holding, maximize value return to their owners, and facilitate a rapidly growing ecosystem. The first collection, MutantKongz, was originally an homage to the CyberKongz project; however, the MutantKongz collection has rather distinguishing, mutated features that begin to tell the story of the post-apocalyptic, sci-fi themed world that these creatures inhabit.

MutantKong #481, the first collection from Bunker 2171 Labs, was originally minted on June 12th, 2021.

Discussions with the developers and supporting team paint an interesting picture that begins to illuminate the influences that are driving the creative engine of the Bunker 2171 ecosystem. The entire project is oozing with fandom and love, inspired by popular video games like Fallout, Metro, Half-Life, and The Last of Us. Additionally, each of the six interconnected collections and the main story often artistically incorporate pop-culture influences from blockbuster films, including The Terminator, Aliens, Predator, 28 Days Later, Dawn of the Dead, The Book of Eli, and The Road.

The Bunker refuge provides not only safety but also a place to relax and socialize with fellow MutantKong and Gorilla Nemesis avatars.

Enter the Bunker, a recently discovered refuge for the MutantKongz and allies. With power recently restored, the Bunker is shaping up with comfortable living spaces, an armory, and many additional rooms to accommodate an ever-growing group of survivors. In addition to MutantKongz the second collection, Gorilla Nemesis also contains incredible illustrations with the Predakongs, Deep Space Aliens, Terminators, and always intimidating, Immortals.

Bunker 2171, Gorilla Nemesis NFT collection teaser trailer.

Excellently capturing the collection tone, the Gorilla Nemesis teaser trailer provides a sense of the team's incredible artistic range and direction for each subsequent collection within the ecosystem. Excitingly, both MutantKongz and Gorilla Nemesis NFTs will have 1:1 avatars available for gaming and social experiences in The Sandbox. Each avatar will function not only as your vehicle to the Bunker 2171 gaming experience but will also serve as a 3D extension of personal identity for those who use them as their PFP, only now fully mobile in the broader Sandbox ecosystem.

The second collection from Bunker 2171 Labs, an Immortal Gorilla Nemesis #4711, and an early model of the 1:1 Gorilla Nemesis avatar for The Sandbox Game.

Diving further into the Bunker 2171 ecosystem, one discovers a variety of collections and creatures to explore and own. Collection #3, Bunker Chronicles, drives the evolving narrative of John Kongor, the resistance leader and guide for all survivors who discover the Bunker, told in a highly captivating comic book style format. Meanwhile, collection #4, Bunker Beasts, were made available for free plus gas for each Gorilla Nemesis NFT, with a claim window that will remain open indefinitely for Gorilla Nemesis that still have unclaimed Bunker Beasts. The Bunker Beasts are a wild combination of heavily mutated and accessory wielding animals, including Bats, Beatles, Flys, Mantis, Spiders, and Octopuses. With tech-enabled flying bats, backpack octopus explorers, and snapback hat-wearing flys, a unique world identity and sense of humor are interwoven and blended across each separate collection, mirroring that of the overall Bunker community.

Continuing their prolific collection release cadence, on November, 19th 2021, Bunker 2171 Labs simultaneously launched their 5th collection, DraGONS 2171, and initiated the $AMBER token yield system. The native token fueling the Bunker 2171 ecosystem, one $AMBER is generated per day for each DraGON. Furthermore, both Gorilla Nemesis and Bunker Beast each provide a one percent $AMBER bonus yield boost for each DraGON that you own. This unique incentivization model encourages holding the assets long term and is one of the numerous collection utilities, resulting in a significant cumulative $AMBER bonus yield as each DraGON will generate $AMBER for a total of 2,171 days. In total, there are approximately 3,700 DraGONS in the collection with surprising few available to purchase on the secondary market, signaling a pivotal collection in the Bunker ecosystem.

The 6th and most recent collection from Bunker 2171 Labs, the Alien Kimera Protocol (AKP), was activated on December 18th, 2021. With absolutely stunning artwork from Mvrk, the talented illustrator and 2D animator of the Gorilla Nemesis and subsequent Bunker 2171 collections, the Alien Kimera also provide a critical utility purpose as the Bunker team looks forward to expanding their presence and offerings in The Sandbox. While MutantKong owners will receive a free 1:1 avatar, the AKP will also enable Gorilla Nemesis holders to claim a 1:1 avatar if they also own an Alien Kimera and use 60 $AMBER for the claim. In total, the Bunker 2171 community will initially have 5,500 MutantKong and Gorilla Nemesis avatars available for their social and gaming experiences currently being developed in The Sandbox. The $AMBER token will also have several additional short to mid-term utilities, including use cases within the marketplace, loot boxes, rewards, a gaming experience access pass, and auctions.

Bunker 2171 in The Sandbox Game NFT Metaverse

The MutantKongz are nomadic apes, survivors of the nuclear war that left a once highly technologically advanced civilization in total ruin. This setting is where the Bunker 2171 story begins and sets the foundation for their P2E gaming experiences in The Sandbox, appropriately named Wasteland 2171. Harkening back to games like Fallout: New Vegas, Wasteland 2171‚Äôs thematic tone is one of mystery and danger. In a genre-blending world with advanced AI, genetic engineering, devastating weaponry, and terrifying monsters, the Bunker provides not only a dedicated in-game social hub but also serves as a refuge from the dangers lurking outside.

Legendary animated Alien Kimera #2862, the 6th collection from Bunker 2171 Labs.

Beyond a social hub, the Bunker is also one of the critical locations for players to explore within the upcoming P2E gaming experience. Wasteland 2171 will cover a 3x3 Sandbox land plot of the total 6x6 Bunker 2171 estate (Sandbox Location, 35, -204) currently being built. Bunker 2171 developers and internal Sandbox artists have teamed up with the incredibly talented Blaze Games Studio for the Wasteland 2171 gaming experience. Blaze Games is a highly-skilled group of artists and developers whose Sandbox work includes but is not limited to the RESP_WN game experience and the impressive Gutter Cat Gang, Gutter City.

Bunker 2171 MutantKongz 1:1 avatar trailer for use in their upcoming Wasteland 2171 game set in The Sandbox.

While 1:1 avatars are closer to completion, the proposed Wasteland 2171 assets and game design have recently been approved by The Sandbox, with all involved parties continuing development throughout 2022. There are numerous narrative-driven objectives or missions planned for the Wasteland 2171 game that offer a range of engaging gameplay experiences. These missions include restoring power and supplies to the Bunker, protecting each other from raiders, rescuing allies in trouble, and uncovering critical information that will piece together the overall Bunker 2171 story.

The teased overview map of the Bunker 2171 experience in The Sandbox.

Each mission will take you on an engaging journey across the Wasteland and aims to become a wild destination for gamers who are seeking a wide range of experiences, challenges, and rewards. Coupled with a dynamic crafting system, rewards for playing Wasteland 2171 include crafting weapons, armor, and consumables. Additionally, skins and exclusive loot boxes for MutantKong and Gorilla Nemesis holders will also be available.

All told, an exciting year lies ahead for the team and Bunker 2171 community. Not to be overlooked, the community is a core pillar of the Bunker ecosystem and the discord is where many initially find themselves when learning about the impressive level of existing project utilities and the upcoming estate in The Sandbox. Friendly team members are always vigilant at the Bunker doors, welcoming new survivors who make it in from the outside world and are commonly greeted by a hilarious barrage of cleverly crafted memes and gifs. The friendly and helpful nature of the community is why many choose to lend their expertise and skills to help build for long-term success. These Apes invite you into the Bunker 2171 discord to stay a while, have some laughs, learn about the ecosystem, discuss the upcoming Wasteland 2171 gaming experience, and prepare yourself for the next Sandbox adventure.

title: The Metaverse: An Introduction
text:
A computer is a window into a multiverse of possibilities. Software Engineering and Experiential Design are the tools that compile the DNA of this virtual world.

This statement has been the first thing people see on my LinkedIn profile for the past few years and it‚Äôs starting to take on a whole new meaning. We are about to head into 2022 (crazy right?!) and there is an overwhelming amount of information floating around the Internet on this thing called the Metaverse.

I‚Äôve been wanting to write something about the Metaverse for a while now but I wasn‚Äôt sure where to start. There are plenty of great breakdowns out there already (some of which are linked below) that provide a great picture of where we are now and what the future might bring. Let‚Äôs see if I can help educate some folks as well.

The goals of this article are:

Practice writing Introduce myself Write about my passion outside of my day job ‚Äî mixed reality and how it will change our lives

Feel free to skip ahead if you have no interest in the human being banging away on his keyboard to bring these words before your eyes (or ears if you‚Äôre using a screen reader).

In my day job I‚Äôm a Director of Engineering and Software Engineer at fuboTV. How I got there after a close shave with becoming a Physical Therapist is a whole other story that I will hopefully write in the future. Outside of fubo when I‚Äôm not playing video games as Jakonius (Jah-Koh-knee-us) or taking LinkedIn Learning courses, I am a technology and Metaverse fanatic. Learning is a central tenet of my life and always will be. The way I see it is if you were a video game character, wouldn‚Äôt you constantly be trying to level up? That endless learning and exploration has gotten me obsessed with the ideal version of Augmented and Virtual reality that is depicted in our favorite shows and movies.

User Interface while wearing AR glasses in Free Guy

Whether that is the Augmented Reality glasses put on display in Free Guy or the immersive cops and robbers depicted in the classic movie Virtuosity with Denzel and Russel Crowe. In fact, Justin Long‚Äôs role as a computer hacker in Live Free or Die Hard is one of the main reasons I wanted to get into computers and programming.

Although these technologies are not new, there is a convergence of factors that will bring these realities from the the movies to our real lives. That convergence is what we will get into here. That being said, I want to warn you that this article will not be very in depth.

There is a ton of information floating around out there and it‚Äôs tough to know how to organize it. That‚Äôs what I‚Äôm here for. To read what is the heck is going on out there and explain what it all means and what‚Äôs coming in the future. At least I‚Äôm going to try. So here we go.

Let‚Äôs break it down:

What is the Metaverse?

Who is trying to build the Metaverse?

How will we access the Metaverse?

Who knows what else? Probably a lot!

What is the Metaverse?

The phrase ‚ÄúMetaverse‚Äù was initially coined in a 1992 Science Fiction novel by Neal Stephenson called Snow Crash. A great book that I definitely recommend checking out. ‚ÄúMetaverse‚Äù is a combination of the prefix ‚Äúmeta,‚Äù which means beyond, and ‚Äúuniverse‚Äù. So, the Metaverse is a world beyond the real world or universe. (i)

That aligns with my thoughts on the Metaverse as an extension of our physical reality in its ideal state. It encompasses both augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) experiences. But I lean towards AR as the true victor of our attention. I guess my one liner at this point would be:

The Metaverse is a personalized multiversal experience accessed through technology where users can view and interact with 3-dimensional digital objects as if they were a part of our physical reality.

The definition of multiversal according to the Internet is a collection of parallel universes that comprise all of reality. Quite a fitting definition for everything we‚Äôve said so far about the Metaverse. You already know some of these parallel universes and they are hiding right in front of your eyes through the screens you use everyday. Think Instagram, Gmail, Netflix, TikTok, Call of Duty: Warzone, YouTube and Amazon.

Now you might be saying, how are those parallel universes? That‚Äôs where the fun begins. Right now each of those experiences is accessed through technology like a mobile device, tablet or computer as an App or Website. But in the future all of those experiences will be accessible through your AR glasses and associated haptic accessories rather than a multitude of other means and screens.

What will shopping on Amazon be like in 3 dimensions through your AR glasses? Do you think you‚Äôre ready to drop into Warzone while you‚Äôre wearing a haptic suit like Ready Player One and running on an omni-directional treadmill?

There are endless scenarios I could walk you through describing some of these experiences that are here now or on the horizon ‚Äî but we‚Äôll save those for a different day. Let‚Äôs move onto the myriad of companies trying to build these digital realities.

Who is trying to build the Metaverse?

Well the easy answer is everyone. You‚Äôd have to live under a rock to not know some of the biggest players entering the space - cough cough Facebook‚Ä¶I mean Innovative Online Industries (IOI)‚Ä¶I mean Meta. In addition to Meta here are some of the biggest companies that are making waves in the Metaverse.

Each of these companies are working day and night, spending millions if not billions of dollars to capture a piece of the next computing paradigm shift. Whether they are building the hardware to access the Metaverse, software that will be used within it ‚Äî or both ‚Äî they are all making some serious moves and have been for the last few years behind closed doors.

Here‚Äôs where things get interesting. I still haven‚Äôt mentioned blockchain, cryptocurrencies or non-fungible tokens (NFTs). In my mind there are two versions of the Metaverse ‚Äî centralized and decentralized. That‚Äôs a rabbit hole I‚Äôm not ready to dive into yet (common theme for this article but bear with me, I‚Äôm just getting started).

There are a few platforms in the crypto space worth mentioning that are either building a decentralized Metaverse owned by the people or a marketplace to buy and sell NFTs:

Metaverses:

NFT Marketplaces:

Wilder World and Zero.tech are well on their way to building a photorealistic Grand Theft Auto style universe powered by Unreal Engine 5. In this game users actually own their digital assets which are fully functional NFTs and can be used to make money in the form of $WILD or $ZERO tokens. Wilder World is the inaugural planet in Zero space. Think of the Oasis in Ready Player One as Zero space and Wilder World as the first of many planets. As this is a gross over simplification, for a full breakdown of Wilder World and Zero I encourage you to check out this wonderfully written article by @barthillerich.

Decentraland and Sandbox are similar platforms to Wilder World but look more like Minecraft rather than Grand Theft Auto. You can buy and sell digital assets including plots of land which have been selling for millions of dollars. Someone even spent $450,000 to be Snoop Dogg‚Äôs virtual neighbor! What a time to be alive.

More recently I discovered Metaclub Society. This one caught my eye because I do enjoy a good party. Metaclub Society is building a Metaverse focused on being the hub for the wildest parties, casinos and adult entertainment. Each NFT holder will gain access to these parties both in the Metaverse with their 3D avatars and in real life (IRL) places like Miami - which is quickly becoming a city of the future.

Opensea.io is a peer-to-peer marketplace for NFTs, rare digital items and crypto collectibles. This is actually where I purchased my first NFT a little while ago in Wilder World. Coinbase is another company actively working towards releasing their own marketplace for NFTs. Clearly the world is trending in this direction and we will see further development over the next few years as we move from early adopters to mass adoption.

Now that we‚Äôve explored a few of the companies and organizations building their small corner of the Metaverse, let‚Äôs dive into some of the technology that will allow us to enter it.

How will we access the Metaverse?

Technically we already can and do each and every day. Our mobile devices are an extension of ourselves and grant us access to all of the apps that our lives depend on. But what I‚Äôm talking about and what we‚Äôre all here for is the immersive, personalized and interactive AR/VR 3D Metaverse. Not some apps on a screen.

We‚Äôve seen some examples of this through Snapchat and their Spectacles, Microsoft releasing Mesh and Meta changing its name while simultaneously declaring themselves as a Metaverse company. All the while Apple has been watching from the sideline and rumors have been growing around their mixed reality ski goggles depicted above. As an Apple fanboy I eagerly await their ‚Äúone more thing‚Äù announcement that includes a mixed reality device.

Here are the pieces of hardware that allow us to enter the Metaverse.Some of them are either available now while others are predicted to become available in the next few years:

These are in no particular order but rather what I could think of and subsequently Google to find a link to match. There are plenty more out there which shows the space is growing rapidly. Their capabilities range from mirroring your laptop to provide extra screens to full fidelity AR with 3D models and occlusion. While the market is surely growing - unless someone else surprises me - I fully expect Apple to change the game once they bring their rumored devices to market.

There were touch screen smartphones before the iPhone and digital music players before the iPod - but we all know how both of those products released by Apple took over the world. I expect nothing but the same in the mixed reality industry. Keep an eye on Apple from now on if you hadn‚Äôt already. 2022 could be the year they actually reveal what they‚Äôve been cooking up and why Tim Cook touts AR like that‚Äôs his only job.

Who knows what else? Probably a lot!

There are so many other topics I could get into and a few rabbit holes I avoided above for the sake of releasing this initial article. I even stumbled upon the Metaverse 2030 story by Louis Rosenberg a few days before I planned on publishing this and almost rewrote the entire thing!

Trust me, I‚Äôll keep going. This is just a taste. A dabble, one might say. When I learn how to organize my erratic and excited thoughts about this area of technology I‚Äôll be back to walk us through the multitude of multiversal menagerie that awaits us in the 2020s and beyond!

While you wait for my return, check out some of these resources that have helped me understand the Metaverse and where we are headed:

title: The real reason Facebook is changing its name to Meta
text:
A bright future for investors, consumers, & developers alike.

To the ‚Äúuntrained eye‚Äù, you might find it interesting or unfathonmable that one of the only competitors Oculus currently thinks it has is ‚ÄúEpic games.‚Äù

To those unfamiliar with Epic games, they are the creators behind Unreal engine & the world's #1 battle royale game Fortnite. (You might have heard of Fortnite on the topics and recent lawsuits with Apple)

So shouldn't Oculus view maybe steam VR, HTC Vive, Google, or any other tech giant as their main competitor?

Wrong. Like I mentioned again and again in this article, one of the main audiences of this year's conference is investors. Zuckerberg wants to make a statement that they are so many years ahead of the competition and have already spent so much money in R&D of their VR products none of those companies can come close to competing with them. (Which I would argue probably is true, Facebook makes a lot of money) Facebook/Meta, in the foreseeable future, will probably still make a lot of money. Therefore it will be hard for any new VR headset start-up to keep up.

Fortnite itself generates revenue of around 7 billion USD yearly.

This is a lot since Fortnite is just one video game under Epic games. However, when compared to Facebook‚Äôs massive estimate of 85.6 billion revenue yearly is nothing.

So clearly they cant compete money-wise, why bring Epic games up then?

Epic games own Unreal engine which they are putting a lot of effort into giving VR development support. Their ultra-successful game Fortnite is built on this platform. Similar to how Epic games has the Epic games store to compete with Steam. If Epic tries to launch their own headset, they actually have a unique competitive advantage.

Don't believe me?

Here's why. Remember how in the first part of the article we mentioned Oculus kept emphasizing they are adding new games to attract their gaming customers? Well, Epic games own the unreal engine platform and a massively popular genre(Fortnite) which is a massive pre-established paying customer group. (7 billion revenue from a free-to-play video game remember?)

Perhaps with some speculation, you can conclude Epic games surely is working on VR projects, and if they were to launch something, there is definitely a huge competitive threat to Oculus.

However, everyone here over at our Sword Reverie team does not think Epic & Oculus bumping head to head is the most likely outcome.

What we would speculate is Epic probably has lots of high-level stakeholder meetings with Oculus where they talk more about collaboration, and how they can support each other to create a true metaverse with a Fortnite Creative in VR.

With VR growing in popularity Fortnite sure wouldn't want to lose out on a whole market of paying customers similar to what has happened with mobile on the Apple store.

One of our past Sword Reverie designers and current UX coaches I work with, Hannah, is currently working as a UX designer part of the Fortnite team. Although due to NDA she can‚Äôt share with us what she is working on, or confirm if my speculations of a top-secret VR Fortnite collaboration is coming soon.

But one thing is clear, Fortnite is becoming more of a social experience.

You see, Fortnite has been so successful because it has grown far beyond a simple battle royale game. It is a metaverse in itself. (Fortnite refers to itself now as the Fortnite Metaverse, see some similarities with Facebook calling itself Metaverse too?)

In Fortnite, you can watch live concerts from Ariana grande, be anyone you want to be (no seriously from DC to Marvel, Predator to the terminator, Anime(Naruto) to Will Smith, you really can be absolutely anything you want to be), hang out with friends, or build your own city.

Does all that sound familiar like I just mentioned it before? Does it almost sound exactly the same as the goals Oculus has? Well yes, it does, there is a lot of overlap.

So with my pure wild speculation, I will say a collaboration between Oculus and Epic is more than likely, both companies have a lot to gain from each other.

To me as both a designer and a serious Fortnite fan? Well, that is just great news. I would be so excited for a Ready player one style future built on the existing metaverse Fortnite and Oculus has been creating for us, and I can't wait to create new cutting edge designs in it!

title: NFT: If My Calculations Are Correct, When This Baby Hits Maturity, You‚Äôre Gonna See Some Serious Shit*
text:
Lionel Messi is 12 years old. He‚Äôs like a little foal that runs from here to there on an unpredictable mud plain playing soccer in a ‚Äòpotrero‚Äô (paddock). You are one of a couple of dozen viewers there. You notice that there is only one handheld camera filming the children‚Äôs game with a boring commentator. Some are already talking about that amazing kid. Those present are astonished at this skilled child. Suddenly for you the screaming of the people, the speed of the number 10 and the fervor stop. As a spectator you realize that you are witnessing the birth of one of the biggest stars that football will give birth to. What to do? With your iNeuron you take a snapshot of the moment, parading like an imaginary flash and‚Ä¶ Boom! You imprint that image on your memory with fire. The year 1999 is passing. You have a unique, own, unforgeable memory in your head. How do you turn it into a transmittable, exclusive, interchangeable, and collectible reality? How?

You still do not know the comments that Ray Hudson will make of Messi when he reaches the first team of Barcelona FC. You don‚Äôt even know who Ray Hudson is! Nobody in that place can project the trajectory that the little one will have. Many viewers cannot see beyond the reality of the pasture mud. But you smile, you see beyond that context. You do not listen to the naysayers, nor to the short-sighted, nor to the sheep of flocks that swing on their comforts without ever leaving the fold. You trust your intuition and listen carefully, scrutinize the signs. Something great will happen with that kid. But what can you do but be amazed and smile?

With your iNeuron you check the mementos you have. You notice that the same thing happens with them as with the incipient football that Messi scattered in front of you in 1999. You want to unite the two things and you comment on it with the spectators. Again, you hear the laughter and hordes of serial scoffers. They mock at your exaggeration and flatly deny that these worlds can ever intersect. Have a real and virtual memory on a card of that genius that you can save, exchange, and sell? Let there be! Their closure will be their downfall, their denial will be their problem.

This has probably been the case since the dawn of Humanity when the first men wanted to artistically express what they had inside, materializing stored memories. First with hands and animals drawn on the stone, then with clay crafts, with enzyme paint of flowers, oil, papyrus and tapestries. The reactions will have been one of mockery, surprise, indifference and admiration. With the ability to create came that of copying and falsifying.

What if‚Ä¶ while you were witnessing the birth of something new, you captured it in an artistic work? What if‚Ä¶ you would have asked that tiny Messi for a gift shirt? What if‚Ä¶ you would have bought the ‚ÄòLionel Messi‚Äô brand? What if‚Ä¶ you would have associated yourself with his image? That tricky but disturbing question: What if‚Ä¶? One possible answer is that to predict the future many times you must travel with your mind to the past. See the circumstances, trends, opportunities that have passed and seek to understand why and how it is that they were not taken advantage of. This is how you will define not to miss an opportunity today.

Today a memory can be forged, designed and cured, ready to be exchanged. You now have a virtual NFTs that could have a market value, unforgeable and transferable. As the artist‚Äôs art grows, the shared utility of your initial bet will grow. You can benefit directly from the success of your favorite athletes, stars, and emerging teams. You will sing a duet with Dwayne ‚ÄúThe Rock‚Äù Johnson to the rhythm of Face Off: It‚Äôs about drive, it‚Äôs about power, we stay hungry, we devour. Put in the work, put in the hours and take what‚Äôs ours.

You own a part of the story. Your memory can be captured in a virtual card with an album to view and share, with annotations and details, characteristics and data: NFT is the idea you dreamt in 1999 whose time has come. Now you can get there ahead of time. Now they‚Äôre a master of their art, but you can say they were apprentices when you‚Äôve reached them in the past.

title: Virtual Real Estate May Not Appreciate Like Physical Real Estate
text:
A realtor‚Äôs concerns regarding their potential as long-term investments

Image provided by user Benholfeld via Wikimedia Commons

Real estate is powerful. It‚Äôs one of the most reliable asset classes, and much multi-generational wealth has been built on top of it. People everywhere aspire to own some, and now that NFTs have enabled the ownership of digital parcels, the virtual landgrab is officially on. There are naysayers, of course. However, those who have made it their business to understand the implications of ‚ÄúWeb 3.0‚Äù are nearly unanimous in their excitement to claim some digital space for themselves. Some, like myself, are more hesitant. But they mostly make reference to the bubble-like nature of the current pricing trends. My own apprehension is more related to concerns about the long-term investment value of this whole asset class.

In short, I doubt that an investment in virtual real estate will perform like most investments in physical real estate do. They certainly have potential over the short term. We see that in the blooming resale market. They also have some capacity for generating revenue during their use. But, will they appreciate over the years like brick-and-mortar homes do? I‚Äôm dubious about that. Here‚Äôs why.

Population arcs

My first time spent in a beautifully crafted and open virtual world was with a game called EverQuest. I got into it around the year 2000, and it was probably the single most memorable gaming experience I have ever had. At that time, though, you couldn‚Äôt own anything in its world. You were merely a participant. I loved the game all the same, and I can only imagine my excitement if I could have bought my own treehouse in the city of Kelethin, or maybe opened up my own shop in Freeport. Regardless, I spent hours upon hours exploring the world of EverQuest, and thousands of people were along for the ride. It felt magical.

In 2004, word came down from Sony that EverQuest 2 was on its way. And in November, it was out. I recall how the talk in our guild during the run-up to its release was ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs sticking around?‚Äù, and the painful realization that ‚Äî despite all the hours and dollars we sunk into the first title ‚Äî more than half of us were on our way over to EQ2. On the day the sequel came out, the guild was rather suddenly gutted of members, and the whole world of Norrath did seem to be a bit emptier. But, it turned out that the blow we felt when EQ2 launched was really just a jab, and a right cross was following shortly behind. World of Warcraft landed later that month, and it was basically a wrap from then on. Everyone wanted to play WoW. As the new MMORPG‚Äôs population grew, it felt as if a hole had been punched in EverQuest‚Äôs bucket, and players were draining out of the game by the day.

This was to become the pattern across basically all open, multiplayer worlds. Even the mighty World of Warcraft wouldn‚Äôt be immune. Its user numbers would grow until about 2010, and then trend back down, ending with a sort of ‚Äúlong tail‚Äù pattern that continues playing out to this day. Among MMOs and other games, the population figures tend to operate according to the same dynamics: they increase alongside the excitement surrounding the latest virtual world, then flatten, and finally decrease as enthusiasm wanes and other options proliferate.

But, compare these virtual world population charts to the actual populations of countries and states. It‚Äôs a very different pattern, and this is critical for real estate. Real estate consistently appreciates over the long haul largely because human populations rise, but the amount of land stays the same. You can essentially count on a general increase in demand, without a corresponding increase in supply. Our experience with virtual worlds ‚Äîalthough admittedly they are not metaverses ‚Äî indicates that they do not behave in the same way. Their population grows, and then tapers off. Demand is not on a steady path upward when viewed in the long term.

Not enough scarcity

The supply side is also problematic. The constant innovation and iteration typical of digital life means there‚Äôs no shortage of virtual space for us. While many individual metaverses are governed by DAOs that make it difficult to arbitrarily increase the supply of parcels, there‚Äôs nothing inherent to the digital medium to stop land from being minted and driving down prices. So, even if weren‚Äôt possible to have more land minted on platform X, there‚Äôs always platform Y. As things stand in the real world, there is no alternative to our current platform: Planet Earth. Moreover, just like the old real estate chestnut goes, the thing about its land is ‚Äúthey‚Äôre not making any more of the stuff‚Äù.

Because we can mint new land or establish new metaverses altogether, virtual real estate has a potentially infinite supply. That doesn‚Äôt eliminate scarcity altogether, of course. A given metaverse may mint X number of parcels and that‚Äôs it. Or, there may be only a certain amount of land close to some desirable feature. That‚Äôs also scarcity. But, it‚Äôs of a different sort than the basic scarcity we experience with land in the real world.

It is true of physical real estate that it generally appreciates over time, but this is due to its particular supply and demand situation. Both of those forces get distorted significantly in the virtual realm. We see a bell-like arcs in the populations of people demanding the land, and there is always the possibility of creating more supply somewhere.

Volatility

I also believe virtual real estate is likely to remain somewhat volatile as an asset ‚Äî more so than its physical counterpart, anyway. The friction in the market is just so low. To illustrate what I mean by that, let‚Äôs imagine we live in a place on Earth called ‚ÄúFoolistan‚Äù. It‚Äôs a nice-enough country, Foolistan, but it‚Äôs run by idiots. We, its informed but helpless citizenry, are subject to their terrible policy decisions. And as a result, we feel a certain level of motivation to get ourselves out. Fortunately for the State, there is a lot of friction in the emigration process. We need passports and visas, we need to sell off our larger assets and find a way to transport the rest, we need to learn the new language and customs of whatever country we‚Äôre moving to, and so on. The fact of the matter is that most people will need to experience a rather high level of distress before they‚Äôre willing to go through the trouble of moving to new lands.

In the virtual environment, such barriers to entry and exit are quite a bit lower. We are capable of moving to a new metaverse rather quickly if it interests us. Our tokenized assets are quite liquid compared to physical real estate. And, to top it all off, new worlds are opening up all the time! This will likely make virtual real estate riskier and more volatile than its physical counterpart. The Internet is fickle, and even if you choose well and invest your time and money in a wonderful platform, there‚Äôs always the possibility that a better alternative (or a sequel) could arrive and crash your asset‚Äôs worth by making it ‚Äúyesterday‚Äôs meta‚Äù.

Finally, there‚Äôs the common practice of basing a virtual real estate economy on the platform‚Äôs native cryptocurrency. These are currently very unstable relative to most fiat currencies, and their swings in value are likely to affect the markets built on top of them. Even if things in your chosen metaverse are going great, if there‚Äôs a problem with Ethereum generally(or whatever its preferred currency may be), you can imagine that there will be repercussions in your investments.
