title: Top 10 Batsmen with Most Fifties in ODI cricket
text:
Over the years, the rise of the shortest format in cricket has almost added a necessity to still talk about the longer formats. However, the 50 over format (ODI) hasn‚Äôt lost its stature despite the prominence of shorter formats around the globe. The batsmen have been given more license and freedom, while the bowlers haven‚Äôt had many luxuries.

Modern-day cricket has evolved a lot, but there are still records that might be hard to break. One of those records will be to break into the batsmen list with most half-centuries in ODIs. A poor series might cost a batsmen‚Äôs career in the modern era. Let us look at the top 10 batsmen with the most half-centuries in ODI cricket.

1. Sachin Tendulkar ‚Äì 96

The Indian legend is portrayed as one of the greatest batsmen of all time, and his numbers tell the story as well. Undoubtedly, Sachin Tendulkar leads the chart for the most half-centuries in ODI cricket. He is the only cricketer to have scored 100 international centuries. Sachin finished his ODI career with 96 half-centuries to his name.

2. Kumar Sangakkara ‚Äì 93

Kumar Sangakkara had an excellent international career and is one of the most elegant left-handers in the game. The former Sri Lankan batter is the second most run-scorer in ODI history, with 14234 runs at an average of 41.99. His tally of 93 fifties is the second most in ODI cricket. He was one of the pillars of his country‚Äôs batting lineup.

3. Jacques Kallis ‚Äì 86

Jacques Kallis is, by far, the best all-rounder the world has seen in all the three formats combined, and he had an excellent career for South Africa. With 273 wickets and 11579 runs in ODI cricket, he is almost an indispensable asset in the format for any team. Kallis finished with 86 half-centuries to his name and is the third on the list.

4. Rahul Dravid ‚Äì 83

Rahul Dravid was often viewed as a player who wasn‚Äôt much suited to the 50 over format needs, but he did end up as one of the finest players. With 10889 runs at an average of 39.1, Dravid did go on to shut a lot of critics on his limited over‚Äôs abilities. He was the man for the crisis, and he scored 83 50+ scores which are the fourth most in ODIs. His stellar performances against multiple oppositions make him a player for every condition.

5. Inzamam-ul-Haq ‚Äì 83

Inzamam-ul-Haq is probably one of the best batsmen from the Pakistan side, and he had a significant impact on his captaincy. The right arm batter came into the international scene at a very young age, and he scored 11739 runs at an average of 39.53. His tally of 83 fifties is joint fourth on the list of batters with most half-centuries.

6. Ricky Ponting ‚Äì 82

Ricky Ponting is one of the game‚Äôs all-time greats and is the most successful captain. The former Australian batsman is the third-highest run-scorer in the ODI format, with 13704 runs at an average of 42.04. He was one of the best players of the pull shot and had a fabulous career. Ponting finished with 30 ODI centuries, and his 82 fifties are sixth on the list of batters with most half-centuries.

7. Mahela Jayawardene ‚Äì 77

Mahela Jayawardene had a lot of class associated with him, and his game was mainly based on his excellent touch. The former Sri Lankan captain played the second most number of ODI internationals, and he scored 12650 runs in 448 games. Jayawardene finished with 77 half-centuries to his name, the seventh most in ODI internationals.

8. MS Dhoni ‚Äì 73

MS Dhoni is one of the legends of the 50 over format and is referred to as the most terrific finisher of all time. Dhoni stayed unbeaten 84 times in 350 ODIs, and he had an average of above 50 with more than 10,000 runs. He was always willing to take responsibility for the side and has been a match-winner all his lifetime. He scored 73 half-centuries, the eight most among batters in ODI format.

9. Sourav Ganguly ‚Äì 72

Sourav Ganguly started the era for India‚Äôs dominance in every format, and his captaincy will always be remembered. He led India to the finals in the 2003 World cup and was one of the best Indian openers in 50 over format. Ganguly scored 11363 runs in 311 ODI games at an average of 41.02. He finished with 72 half-centuries in the 50 over structure, the ninth most.

10. Sanath Jayasuriya ‚Äì 68

Sanath Jayasuriya was one of the most aggressive batsmen in ODI cricket and can quickly change a game. The former Sri Lankan left-hander had a career of over two decades in international cricket and finished with 13430 runs under his belt. Jayasuriya‚Äôs tally of 68 half-centuries in 50 over format is the tenth most for any batsmen.

title: Finasteride or Minoxidil or Both for Hair Loss?
text:
When it comes to Male Pattern Baldness (MPB) or Androgenetic Alopecia both Finasteride (Topical and Oral Finasteride) and Minoxidil works well. Finasteride blocks DHT which shrinks hair shaft and Minoxidil nourishes with increased blood supply as it dilates blood vessels.

All types of hair loss will benefit from Minoxidil. Finasteride will work only on male pattern baldness and not on other types of hair loss.

Consider Minoxidil as a general OTC hair treatment applied to the scalp while Finasteride pill and topical is used to treat androgenetic alopecia which is genetic and the most common cause of hair loss.

Minoxidil is only topical application for hair loss since oral ingestion can cause hair to grow all over the body. Oral minoxidil is prescribed for hypertension and not hair loss.

Finasteride blocks DHT, a potent form of testosterone that shrinks the hair shaft and makes it fall out eventually. Such hair loss starts in the 20s accelerating as one ages. So both oral finasteride and topical treatment is ok.

Side Effects of Minoxidil and Finasteride

Side effects of both finasteride and minoxidil tend to be extremely rare and highly manageable.

Minoxidil has to be used lifelong. Stopping minoxidil will revert hair loss. Finasteride can be stopped for a while without hair loss.

Finasteride might affect fertility,(watery sperm, spermatogenesis) it can be stopped for a period of time to improve sperm quality and resume after the child is conceived, without any hair loss.

Dosage ‚Äî Finasteride and Minoxidil

Amount of topical finasteride is less than the oral finasteride. It is only .25mg, while oral finasteride ‚Äî 1 mg./day. Those concerned about fertility issues can only use topical finasteride with minoxidil.

Topical finasteride is yet to be approved by FDA, but in the process. Many long term studies have proved that topical finasteride is extremely safe and beneficial for MPB hair loss.

Read more

title: The Fellowship Whitepaper
text:
What is the Fellowship?

Our goal is to create a community of the best builders, artists, community builders, defi-degens, and more in the Solana ecosystem.

This is not just a PFP project, and we do not aim to compete with other projects. The Fellowship‚Äôs logo consists of three interlocking rings known as Borromean rings. The three rings are strong together, yet fall apart if one is removed and signifies strength in unity. WAGAMI is our vibe, WAGAMI is our ethos. We will build together with all other Solana communities.

The Fellowship logo ‚Äî Borromean Rings a symbol of strength in unity.

We aim to use the collective power of the Fellowship community, along with funds from the NFT sale, the Warchest, to build Web3 tooling that will accelerate the growth of the Solana NFT ecosystem.

The Fellowship community‚Äôs feedback will influence the Creator Machine roadmap and help our team decide which new platform features, partnerships and marketing we perform.

NFT Holders in addition to gaining access to the Fellowship community will receive a Launch Pass NFT with 1,000 Creator Machine credit. Creator Machine credits are used to pay for the usage of certain Creator Machine tools.

What is Creator Machine?

The Creator Machine team‚Äôs mission is to empower creators and community builders to achieve financial independence via the power of NFTs, DAOs, and other Web3 technologies.

We believe these new technologies enable creators and community builders the opportunity to organize groups of people and capital in an innovative manner, and that we‚Äôve only just breached the surface of what‚Äôs possible.

The first version of Creator Machine is a software platform that allows anyone to launch a Solana NFT project without a single line of code.

The Creator Machine team aims to continue developing no-code software that enables anyone regardless of their technical ability the opportunity to both launch their own Solana NFT project and manage an NFT-gated community.

Creator Machine aims to open-source portions of our software to the Solana community to ensure we provide a maximum positive impact to Solana.

Ideas for future Creator Machine features

The targeted functionalities of Creator Machine at launch will allow all users to generate NFT art, Solana metadata, launch a Candy Machine mint process, and create a mint web page, all without a line of code.

However, this is just the beginning. We plan to gather feedback from the Fellowship community to help guide our roadmap. We are not sure which direction the community and the market will take us, but some ideas we‚Äôve already received include:

Airdrops ‚Äî send an NFT airdrop to one or 10,000 community members in just a few clicks. Discord & Twitter Salesbot ‚Äî set up a bot to record the sales of your NFT on Discord and Twitter. Whitelisting for NFT drops ‚Äî create a presale that is only available to a list of wallets that you‚Äôve defined Credit Card purchase of NFTs ‚Äî allow buyers to purchase your NFT using a credit card Social Token creation and distribution ‚Äî launch your own social/meme token for your project. NFT Gated Community Forums & Websites ‚Äî create a website that only your token holders can access. Discord is great, but there exists an opportunity for new ways of communication and organization. Project treasury management & multi-signature wallets ‚Äî projects are run by multiple team members, and you want to ensure that funds earned from your NFT project are properly managed with multiple team members. Our goal is to reduce the risk of rugs.

To be clear, these are ideas, not a promise. We are not sure what direction the community and the market will take us. As we onboard this community to Creator Machine, it is very likely we may discover new ideas that have not even been thought of yet.

Who is the Creator Machine / Fellowship team?

We‚Äôre a doxxed team with 20+ years of experience developing software at companies like Microsoft, Boeing, Bridg, and ProducePay.

We‚Äôre members of the Monkedao, Thugdao, Pesky Penguins, Shadowy Super Coder DAO, Catalina Whales, and more. We‚Äôve contributed code to the Metaplex codebase and intend to continue to contribute to the Solana ecosystem.

We‚Äôre a battle-tested team, and our NFT launch skills have already been tested on many projects such as Joylina‚Äôs Cantina, Skollz, Graceful and more. We‚Äôre also partnering up with Solana influencer Rick Bakas on his upcoming Pin Club launch.

Stanley Yang / @stanleycyang

Shadowy Super Coder

Matt Landau / @dausays

Product & Marketing

What utility will Fellowship OG NFT holders get?

Access to the Fellowship community Discord.

Early access to the Creator Machine platform ahead of the general public. Fellowship NFT holders will get platform access before we open the platform up to the tool to non- Fellowship NFT holders.

For each Fellowship OG NFT that you purchase, you will receive two Fellowship Launch Pass NFTs which carry with them 1,000 Creator Machine platform credits. The first Launch Pass NFT will be airdropped to Fellowship OG NFT holders about three to four weeks post the initial Fellowship NFT sale, around Feb 28th-Mar 5th. The second Launch Pass will be airdropped to those who hole the Fellowship OG NFT between Aug 7th‚Äì13th, 2022. If you need platform access ahead of the airdrop, we can open it up to project teams upon request.

One Creator Machine platform credit = 1 free NFT created via the Creator Machine platform. Launching a project with 10,000 NFTs will cost 10,000 Creator Machine credits. Users will only pay rent fees that are required to interact with the Solana protocol.

NFT holders get unlimited use of the Creator Machine generative art and metadata generation tool. Our tool allows you to take art layers and create thousands of unique NFTs. You‚Äôll also get metadata files that enable you to seamlessly set up your NFT launch with the Candy Machine and in the Creator Machine platform.

The Warchest: How will the primary sale and royalty funds be used?

The proceeds, net of taxes, will be used to build the Creator Machine team and fund the development of new platform features, platform marketing, and more. This will enable the founding team to quit their day jobs and be able to focus 100% of their time on Creator Machine and the Fellowship.

Fellowship Launch Passes

Fellowship Launch Pass NFTs which carry with them 1,000 Creator Machine platform credits.

One Creator Machine platform credit = 1 free NFT created via the Creator Machine platform. Launching a project with 10,000 NFTs will cost 10,000 Creator Machine credits. Users will only pay rent fees that are required to interact with the Solana protocol.

A project launching a 6,000 NFT project will only need to purchase three Fellowship OG NFTs. That‚Äôs just 6 SOL to launch your collection. And Creator Machine credits enable you to launch without giving any cut of your primary sales or royalties to the Creator Machine platform.

If you compare that cost to the 20‚Äì50% of primary sales and royalties that other launchpads charge, you‚Äôre getting a serious deal by purchasing the Fellowship OG NFT.

The first Launch Pass NFT will be airdropped to Fellowship OG NFT holders about three to four weeks post the initial Fellowship NFT sale, around Feb 28th-Mar 5th. The second Launch Pass will be airdropped to those who hole the Fellowship OG NFT between Aug 7th‚Äì13th, 2022. If you need platform access ahead of the date Launch Passes are distributed, we are happy to grant you access upon request.

You will then be able to log in to your Creator Machine account, attach the Launch Pass NFT to your account, and redeem your 1,000 Creator Machine platform credits. You can use one credit or 1,000 at once, that is up to you. Once applied and added to your Creator Machine account you own the credits for life.

If you are a Creator with a project that needs to launch ahead of the Launch Pass NFT drop date, please complete our Creator Whitelist Application. We already have some exciting launches planned in the weeks after the Fellowship NFT drop.

Fellowship Key Milestones

Oct/Nov 2021

Build a bullet-proof NFT mint process and V1 of Creator Machine. Our previous projects such as Joylina‚Äôs Cantina, Hellcats, Skollz have proven our process is ready for primetime.

Dec 2021

Finish v2 of the Creator Machine Platform. This version will be capable of generating art, setting up a Candy Machine mint, launching a website. All without a single line of code.

Establish the Fellowship community and start building an ecosystem full of enthusiasts, developers, artists, and other people with a passion for Solana and NFTs.

Feb 1st & 2nd, 2022

Release the Fellowship NFTs to the community via an NFT sale.

~Three to four weeks after launch

First Airdrop of Fellowship Launch Pass to Fellowship OG NFT holders

Provide Creator Machine access to NFT holders.

Post-launch future

Continue to build and launch Solana tooling for the community based on the feedback from the Fellowship community.

title: Building a Gamified NFT Ecosystem
text:
PHASE 2: BUILDING USE CASE FOR $CLUB

MiniVerse Breeding Game

The MiniFrens Generations Collection will be the only breedable collection in the GameFi ecosystem after the land mint. MiniFrens Generations will have a hard capped supply at 8076 and 4 different generations. This will bring the total supply of MiniVerse NFTs to 10,000 + Land (max 200). We will also be adding new Mini animals to each generation. The possibilities are endless think about MiniTigers or MiniLions and much more!

MiniFrens Generations Breeding Breakdown

Gen 1: #1‚Äì#1924 250 $CLUB Mint Gen 2: #1925‚Äì#3848 500 $CLUB Mint Gen 3: #3849‚Äì#5772 750 $CLUB Mint Gen 4: #5773‚Äì#8076 1000 $CLUB Mint

How does the breeding work?

You will need any 2 MiniVerse NFT‚Äôs in your wallet to breed. You will then pick 1 of your MiniVerse NFT‚Äôs to ‚Äúbreed‚Äù. This is basically blacklisting one of your NFT‚Äôs from breeding again for the season. It will cost 250‚Äì1000 $CLUB depending on which generation we are in the game. You can still use the ‚Äúbred‚Äù NFT‚Äôs to breed other MiniVerse NFT‚Äôs because you need 2 in your wallet to breed 1. There will be seasons that last a number of days/weeks. There will be multiple seasons each generation and every MiniVerse NFT that has ‚Äúbred‚Äù will be reset each season allowing them to ‚Äúbreed‚Äù again. This allows for a dynamic breeding game where players have to make choices and manage their $CLUB to maximize their mints each season. Players will choose to !stake or !breed for the season and combined with the tax system it creates game theory and choices for the player. Each season will have a set number of rare 1/1 MiniFrens that players will have to a chance to breed. There will be holiday/event themed MiniFrens in certain seasons as well.

Incubation Periods

When you breed a MiniFrens Generation it will be hidden. This is to protect the breeding games NFT metadata from being sniped. Approximately every week a snapshot will be taken of newly bred hidden MiniFrens and they will be revealed.

Where does the $CLUB go from breeding cost?

70% gets burned. 20% goes to landowners. 10% goes back to staking contract.

Possible Wolf Game Like Stealing Mechanic

We are looking into adding Chainlink integration that will allow us to create randomness in the breeding contract. We could use this to add a ‚Äúwolf game like‚Äù stealing mechanic where newly bred MiniFrens have a chance to be stolen by landowners. This will mainly be determined if Chainlink VRF comes out for Fantom in time.

Fantom NFT Blue Chip Slot Machine/Promotion Launchpad

We are going to create the first web-based slot machine with NFT rewards on Fantom. Rewarding both blue chip and newly minting NFT‚Äôs on Fantom. This will be one of the flag ship products in the MiniVerse GameFi ecosystem we hope it attracts users from all around the Fantom community!

How will the slot machine work?

We are still developing the tokenomics behind the slot machine to make it sustainable. But you will need $CLUB to spin that's guaranteed.

What Fantom Blue Chip NFT‚Äôs can we win?

Ancestral Umans, 8bit Netizens, Cyber Nekos, Beardies, Bitkittens, Magicats. We hope that people from the FTM blue chip communities come and try to win! We will also vote on other FTM NFT‚Äôs to add.

Slot Machine Promotion Launchpad

We will form partnerships with newly minting FTM projects to add free mints/whitelists of their projects to our slot machine as minor jackpots. This will be beneficial for newly minting projects looking for help with promotion.

How will you fund and make the slot machine sustainable?

We are still deciding the tokenomics behind the slot machine but there will be some portion of the spin cost that goes to buying more NFT‚Äôs to load up the slot machine. We also have our development treasury as a defi treasury which is currently farming in TOMB finance ($TOMB/$FTM) giving our treasury a positive inflow of funds with minimal risk of impermanent loss. We are taking no cut from the MiniChillas mint at its all going into the $TOMB/$FTM LP for the further development.

A Web3 Integrated MiniGame

We plan to build a web3 integrated MiniGame where players need to be holding MiniVerse NFT‚Äôs to play. We will run special competitions in this game where players will be able to win $CLUB and will have an on-chain leaderboard where users will have to sign with meta-mask to submit their scores.

What is the game going to be?

We have many options, but it will be a simple web-based game. Examples, flappy birds, doodle jump, crossy road. But we will integrate MiniVerse NFT‚Äôs into the game.

title: What We Might Learn From the Controversy Surrounding NFTs for Artists
text:
By Mix.Mag

As both a music enthusiast and someone who works in tech, it‚Äôs fascinating to witness various artists either release NFTs or voice their opinions on why they refuse to ever. Though I happen to be quite bullish on web3 and all that it might do for the music industry, from enabling better fan engagement to securitizing IP to allowing artists (and fans) to cash in on their ability to be great tastemakers, the controversy surrounding NFTs is neither unsurprising nor unwarranted. I do believe that there is much to learn from creators‚Äô unease towards these things, as we attempt to ensure that the ‚Äúnew‚Äù music industry, powered by web3, is not only ambitious but rightfully so.

For some artists, an NFT release seems like a natural extension of their brand and thus may not elicit the kind of growing pains expected during the initial phases of any sort of tech adoption. I‚Äôd like to think of these artists as the early adopters.

In beginning with the mainstream (or those with hefty followings), artists like 3LAU and deadmau5 come to mind, both of whose brands are pivotally centered around technology itself. First and foremost, the art that each creates is powered by music technology in some of its rawest forms (i.e., a focus on synthesizers as opposed to other instruments, a propensity towards quantizing everything and eliminating much of a human feel, etc.)

Beyond that, tech as an ~idea~ bolsters the stage personas of these artist types; this includes the visualizations used during live performance, album art, and more. Therefore, it is no surprise that in addition to releasing NFT songs and collections, many of these ‚Äúearly adopters‚Äù are riding the waves that allow us to envision a future of the music industry in which web3 plays a major part. With deadmau5‚Äôs involvement in numerous VC-backed metaverse projects and even joining venture, in addition to 3LAU‚Äôs Royal which last raised a $55mm Series A led by a16z, these folks, in addition to others in a similar sphere, leverage and adopt web3-powered music technology seamlessly. With that, however, they seem to be driving everyone else towards a music industry that many artists don‚Äôt seem quite ready for.

Two artists, which happen to be amongst my favorites, illustrated this industrywide polarization back in March. Lane 8 tweeted that he would not be releasing NFTs nor would he be ‚Äúpandering to the ultra rich‚Äù ‚Äî rather, he‚Äôd release his music ‚Äúthe normal way.‚Äù Rufus Du Sol replied to this tweet:

Then came some child‚Äôs play, like Dillon Francis minting Lane 8‚Äôs initial tweet as an NFT, but that‚Äôs not worth getting far into. Now, what‚Äôs interesting about this particular example is that we‚Äôre discussing two artists who operate within a very particular niche of alternative house / electronic music ‚Äî their fanbases, I presume, are uniquely shared. It‚Äôs not unlikely that their shared fanbase was left confused about how to perceive NFTs following this dispute, which therefore puts a significant damper on visions of a world in which artists can be compensated via this type of asset. I think that this is objectively bad.

So let‚Äôs break down a few of the most likely concerns implicated within Lane 8‚Äôs initial tweet, which seem to need industrywide addressing for the marriage between web3 and music to have any hope:

NFTs are bad for the environment

2. They‚Äôre conducive to scams

3. They‚Äôre pointless

The first two points here require only brief addressing ‚Äî the nascent market for NFTs means that we just haven‚Äôt quite yet figured out all of the logistics. Environmental concerns surrounding minting NFTs and crypto are not new, as these concerns have driven the Ethereum blockchain to declare that they‚Äôd switch to proof-of-stake vs. proof-of-work block production. There are necessary improvements to come, though it should not be ignored that producing nearly anything that a fan might buy doesn‚Äôt exactly come energy-free. In terms of the scams associated with NFTs, the market‚Äôs unregulated IP environment, mixed with its speculative nature and a particular class of eager consumers, has caused tokens like Squid Game and influencer-pushed SaveTheKids to disappoint and establish less faith in a market with already-wavering uncertainty.

The last point, however, that NFTs are pointless is worth spending significant time on. The production logistics could be there ‚Äî NFTs could be carbon negative ‚Äî but if the product itself is pointless? Well, then, let‚Äôs not waste our time.

In stripping away any notion of web3 for web3‚Äôs sake, what‚Äôs left? The value proposition is either pure ownership of something worth owning (one of a kind or not and static or not), or it‚Äôs the potential cash flows associated with the future value of the digital asset (what Royal.io is aiming to accomplish). The ‚Äúpoint‚Äù of the latter seems self explanatory ‚Äîas a fan, I feel that I am being appropriately compensated for my taste in music and my propensity to tell my friends to stream this music.

But ownership as it relates to NFTs that artists might release as strictly collectibles (excluding IP rights here) is more nuanced. What‚Äôs the point? There doesn‚Äôt seem to really be one, or one worth selling to those who are not accustomed to ‚Äújust enjoying‚Äù a stamp collection in the solitude of their basements (aka the majority). I believe that collectible digital assets (in the form of audio or otherwise) which disclude IP ownership and its associated positive financial implications do have a place in this world. But if so, very few industry players seem to be focused on true value creation here.

Utility is subjective, but there are certain things that people generally agree are useful ‚Äî personalized content, 1‚Äì1 interactions with the people we look up to (artists), access to likeminded communities, etc. NFTs as collectibles have the potential to unlock these things that really mean something to fans and that fans are willing to pay for.

The true exclusivity factor of NFTs as collectibles is an interesting topic of debate, as the creation of often false scarcity is off-putting to fans and artists who view these things as tools for ‚Äúpandering to the ultra-wealthy.‚Äù I will not dive deeply into this here, however it‚Äôs important to note that time and energy is scarce ‚Äî there are human limitations to just how much good content an artist might release via their NFT-locked Discord server, etc.

I‚Äôve seen companies which make NFT release processes easier for artists or NFT exchanges between fans swifter and better. But I‚Äôve only seen a few companies focused around strictly the utility piece of the NFT ‚Äî or stop and truly think about why it might be valuable to create this sort of collectible / undergo this endeavor anyway.

I believe that there are incredible opportunities here ‚Äî but players in the ecosystem (artists, fans, founders, and VCs) must have open conversations and address many of these (warranted) concerns. Only then might we reach an industry-wide consensus on what is and isn‚Äôt worth minting and subsequently enable better ways for artists to be appropriately compensated for their work.

title: A Look at the PUNKS Comic NFT
text:
This is an excerpt of my bi-weekly newsletter. Read the whole thing, sub here!

One of the first NFT comics in the market (Matt Kindt made the first one, and that was an actual 1:1 NFT comic) ‚Äî but PUNKS by Pixel Vault is definitely the most famous one, and is not just purely a comic book but a whole ecosystem.

ICYMI: a great recap of the Punks NFT history is here by NFT NOW.

TL:DR version:

Pixel Vault, a company that owns 16 CryptoPunks (the floor as of this writing is 53 ETH) decided instead of leaving them in a wallet doing nothing, gave these NFTs personalities and characters and thus the PUNKS comic was born.

Went live in May 2021 for .2ETH and with 10,000 copes of the first issue of Punks.

If you held, and you were one of the first 5000 holders ‚Äî you would get Punks #2 for free (available in December 2021).

It gets complicated from here ‚Äî but owners could HOLD, BURN or STAKE their comic for rewards ‚Äî so it‚Äôs become more of a rewards game than actual comic publishing project.

I didn‚Äôt get the Punks comic NFT, too slow on the mint and too expensive now, but I found the comic via a friendly NFT holder and read it to get an idea of what they were doing. And you might be surprised to learn that the comic is the least interesting thing about the Punks comic.

What‚Äôs it about? ‚Äúa comic that chronicles Beanie‚Äôs journey ‚Äî from humble auction house busboy to digital art kingpin ‚Äî to capitalize on the digital revolution in the Metaverse (enduring kidnappings, clowns, anons, and the mysterious Elvis Punksley, all as part of his quest). The story pays homage to NFT influencer Beanie‚Äôs obsession with Robbie Barrat‚Äôs work, while bringing CryptoPunks to life in a whimsical and creative way.‚Äù

After reading it, it feels like the Adult Swim show The Venture Brothers crossed with Lock Stock and Barrel but about crypto. It‚Äôs a very slick indie comic and I‚Äôm sure there are a lot of inside jokes here from Beanie‚Äôs life and his friends.

It‚Äôs written by Richard Galbraith with art by Australian Chris Wahl who has drawn Tank Girl and done commercial work for Marvel, DC and Hasbro.

Apparently the comic will see print and made available to those that still own the NFT and did not burn it. What is the value on the paper version as opposed to the NFT remains to be seen but you can see the allure for people that didn‚Äôt get the NFT to at least get the comic itself.

I feel the comic is just the starting point and the Tokenomics is the real mission on fractional ownership of a bunch of CryptoPunks. It makes my head hurt to understand all this, but wow what a long way to go to basically create a new DAO.

To try and sum it up, this first issue is tied to ownership of EITHER:

50% of the 16 CryptoPunks represented by $PUNKS token holders.

OR

Partnership in the Founder‚Äôs DAO, composed of 25% of the 16 CryptoPunks represented by $PUNKS token holders PLUS collective ownership of the other works in the Founder‚Äôs DAO.

The interesting note is that Pixel Vault will create and sell PUNKS Merchandise, with the profits (100%) of which will be distributed to $PUNKS Token holders. The second issue of Punks is out now.

You can track all of it here.

UPDATE: January 2, 2022

I got a hold of PUNKS #2 and so here are a few pages from it featuring the Bored Apes that will lead into my next post on the Adidas crossover with Punks.

Stay updated on pop culture NFT info and news by subscribing to my Thndr Frens newsletter here.

title: Generate NFT Images and Metadata in Bulk With Python
text:
Generate NFT Images and Metadata in Bulk With Python

When I wrote the first article, I was just exploring the process of generating NFT images. As I learned more, I realized it‚Äôs not just about generating images, but also generating metadata, as well as storing the images in the cloud. You can think of this article as an improved version of the first article. Also, after writing this article and learning more, I went ahead and built a small website using the same concept to let users generate their collection. For now, I have limited it to 1000 images, but hoping to continue to work on it if there are enough visits. Please do check it out!

This code has some improvements compared to the previous one. The main ones are as follow:

The user can add as many layers as they want, the only thing they have to specify in the code is the name of the layers.

The number of variations in each layer doesn‚Äôt have to be the same, the code will just load a list of files in each folder representing a layer using them.

The code also generates a .json file containing the metadata of the image generated.

Once again, I am not a professional programmer and my code will likely not be the best way to accomplish a task but hey, it works!

Directory Structure:

The following image shows the directory structure:

The directory structure for our code

The root folder contains subfolders, with each representing a layer. Each subfolder representing a layer has to be numbered in the sequence they want the layers to be picked and merged. So the lowest layer of the image, which is the background, will be named as ‚Äú1‚Äù, the next layer ‚Äú2‚Äù, and so on. In an image with 5 layers, the background would be 1 and the topmost layer would be 5.

Each layer subfolder contains image files representing each variation of that layer. They don‚Äôt have to be numbered as our updated code loads the filenames. However, you should name each file appropriately as this name will be used in the metadata of the image file generated.

Storing Images in The Cloud:

All the images in your NFT collection will have to be stored somewhere. You can choose to store it anywhere you want but keep in mind you have to make sure that it‚Äôs reliable storage so that your pictures are accessible at any time. A popular option is Pinata. Pinata stores your data in a peer-to-peer file system known as Inter-Planetary File System. Pinata is pretty straightforward. You can register for free storage for up to 1 GB. Once you are logged in, upload a folder. Any folder with a test file would do. The point at this stage is to get a URL address that you can use in your metadata file. Once you have uploaded the folder, go back to the home page, you will see your folder name there. Next to it, you will see it‚Äôs CID, which is a long sequence of alphabets and numbers. Copy that and save it at a location you can access easily as we will need it for our code.

Setting Parameters:

Let‚Äôs define some parameters.

#Name of your project, using test for now.

project = ‚Äòtest‚Äô #The CID of the folder on Pinata.

url = ‚ÄòQtgdsX3fsfT45fsggrd‚Äô #The local folder which will have the layers' subfolders.

folder = ‚Äòlayers‚Äô #The number of images you want to generate.

count = ‚Äò100‚Äô #List containing the names of the layers, in the sequence you want

#the layers to be picked by the code and merged. layers_names = [‚Äúbackground‚Äù, ‚Äúface‚Äù, ‚Äúshirt‚Äù, ‚Äúaccessory‚Äù]

The total count of the images that could possibly be generated can be calculated by multiplying the number of files in each layer‚Äôs subfolder. Let‚Äôs say we have 4 layers and each layer has 4 variations represented by files, the total number of possible unique images would be:

4x4x4x4=256

Adding more layers would increase the count exponentially. However, for testing, you may not want to generate that many images as it will take a lot of time so can set it to 100 or even 10.

Importing Necessary Libraries:

import random

import os

from itertools import product

from PIL import Image

Generating all possible combinations of the variation files:

Now we will load a list of files in each subfolder in our folder specified by the folder parameter. We will then combine them in all possible combinations to generate a list of tuples, each tuple containing a possible combination of a variation of each layer. This can be accomplished by one line of code.

combinations = list(product(*[os.listdir(f'{folder}/{x}') for x in os.listdir(folder)]))

Each item in this list represents a possible combination of variations in each layer. We will use it to load the files based on their filenames and merge them. In case you don‚Äôt want to go all the way and have limited the number of images to a smaller number it might be a good idea to shuffle this list.

random.shuffle(combinations)

Generating The Images and Metadata:

The following code iterates through each combination in the combinations list, loads an image from each layer folder and merges them into one image, then saves it and also generates the metadata for that image and saves that too.

c=0

metadata={} for combination in combinations:

if c != count:

if len(combination)>2:

comp = image.alpha_composite(image.open(f'{folder}/1/{combination[1]}').convert('RGBA'),

image.open(f'{folder}/2/{combination[2]}').convert('RGBA'))

n=3

for item in combination[2:]:

if combination.index(item)!=-1:

comp = Image.alpha_composite(comp,

image.open(f'{folder}/{n}/{item}').convert('RGBA'))

n+=1

rgb_im = comp.convert('RGB')

file_name = str(combinations.index(combination)) + ".png"

rgb_im.save("./images/" + file_name)

metadata['image']=f'{image_url}/{file_name}'

metadata['tokenId']=str(combinations.index(combination))

metadata['name']=project+' '+str(combinations.index(combination))

metadata['attributes']=[]

for item in layers_names:

metadata['attributes'].append({item:combination[layers_names.index(item)][:-4]})

with open(f"./metadata/{str(combinations.index(combination))}.json", "w") as outfile:

json.dump(metadata, outfile, indent=4)

c+=1

else:

break

The variable ‚Äúc‚Äù keeps a count of how many files have been generated and is updated at the end of each iteration. For each item in the ‚Äúcombinations‚Äù list, the code first checks the value of ‚Äúc‚Äù, if it is not equal to the ‚Äúcount‚Äù variable, it will proceed otherwise it will break the loop.

For the first two layers, I had to hard code their paths, I am sure there is a better way of doing this, but I could not figure it out. Beyond the first two layers, other layers are loaded one by one and merged with the previously merged layers.

The index of each item in the ‚Äúcombinations‚Äù list is used as a file name for both the image file and the json file. We need the ‚Äúlayers_names‚Äù list for the metadata. Each item in that list represents the attribute of the image, the value of which is the filename of the file representing that variation in its respective layer. Therefore, each variation in every layer‚Äôs folder should be named appropriately as it will go on the metadata. Images are saved in the ‚Äúimages‚Äù folder and metadata files are saved in the ‚Äúmetadata‚Äù folder.

The code will likely not be displayed with the appropriate indentation therefore feel free to check out the Jupyter notebook. As stated earlier, my code may be juvenile but I am here to learn and your feedback will certainly help me improve. Thank you for reading this far! As I go through my project, I will share what I learn.

More content at plainenglish.io. Sign up for our free weekly newsletter. Get exclusive access to writing opportunities and advice in our community Discord.

title: How NFTs became a $40bn market in 2021
text:
At the beginning of 2021, only a niche group of crypto enthusiasts knew what non-fungible tokens (NFT) were.

But by the end of the year nearly $41bn had been spent on NFTs, according to the latest data, making the market for digital artwork and collectibles almost as valuable as the global art market.

‚ÄúThis year witnessed the NFT market explode from a sub-billion-dollar market to a multi-decabillion industry,‚Äù said Mason Nystrom, research analyst at crypto data group Messari, adding that buyers were rushing to uncover art that aligns with their ‚Äúdigital identities‚Äù.

NFTs are essentially digital ownership certificates registered on a blockchain ‚Äî an immutable record that cannot be changed or tampered with.

The tokens are typically created or minted using smart contracts ‚Äî self-executing contracts written into the code of a blockchain ‚Äî and can be traded on the secondary market in exchange for cryptocurrency.

NFT mania hit the mainstream in March, when a collage by the artist Beeple sold for $69.3m at Christie‚Äôs, in the first sale of its kind at the auction house. The artist, whose given name is Mike Winkelmann, reacted with a tweet: ‚Äúholy fuck‚Äù.

Recommended

Though first popularised in the art world, corporate players from sports and music ‚Äî even former US first lady Melania Trump ‚Äî have also embraced the concept to cash in on the hype and find new ways to engage with fans.

The NBA, the US basketball league, created its own NFT marketplace for buying, selling and trading video highlights of its players called NBA Top Shot.

Other hits included numbered collections of NFTs that went viral, including CryptoPunks and Bored Ape Yacht Club, and which denoted the clubby status of their owners and are used as avatars on social media profiles.

‚ÄúThe core value is still exclusivity,‚Äù said Nystrom, noting that expensive collections also offer purchasers access to gated channels on chat platform Discord, and to meetups and parties.

‚ÄúThey are country club-esque: there is a high barrier to entry ‚Äî a capital cost ‚Äî and you are around high net worth and other individuals,‚Äù he added.

In total, $40.9bn was poured into the ethereum blockchain contracts that are typically used to create NFTs in the year to December 15, according to Chainalysis, a crypto analytics group. The total would even be higher if it included NFTs minted on other blockchains, such as solana.

By comparison, last year the global art market was worth $50.1bn, according to figures from UBS and Art Basel.

Chainalysis found that NFTs have introduced a huge number of retail investors to the crypto world, with small transactions of under $10,000 accounting for more than 75 per cent of the market.

But much like the market for cryptocurrencies, it remains dominated by a few large players, or ‚Äúwhales‚Äù.

Between late February and November, there were 360,000 NFT owners holding 2.7m NFTs between them. Of those, about 9 per cent ‚Äî or 32,400 wallets ‚Äî held 80 per cent of the value of the market, Chainalysis found.

Stephen Diehl, a crypto-sceptic software engineer, said many whales are ‚Äúsitting on hundreds of millions of dollars of crypto‚Äù from the boom in crypto prices, ‚Äúlooking to turn their crypto into more crypto‚Äù.

Others say they approach the market as professional traders-cum-collectors. One well-known NFT investor, known as Pranksy on Twitter, who started out with an initial investment of $600 in 2017 now has an NFT portfolio worth more than $20m, they said.

They told the Financial Times that they invest in a mix of projects, ‚Äúsome of which have a higher daily trading volume and others that have a more niche appeal‚Äù. Aside from ‚Äúflipping‚Äù lucrative projects, Pranksy said they had ‚Äúspecific pieces I plan to keep as long term investments‚Äù.

So far, most new NFT collectors on the secondary market have yet to recoup the costs of their purchases, according to an analysis for the FT by blockchain analysis platform Nansen, where early collectors have benefited from a rise in the price of the NFTs as well as in the cryptocurrency used to trade in them.

The unregulated space is also plagued by fraud, scams and market manipulation, especially because the real-world identities of buyers and sellers is difficult, if not impossible, to discover.

Analysis by Nansen found $2m of suspect activity across the CryptoPunk and Bored Ape collections in the 30 days to mid-December. Some NFTs, for example, were sold at a 95 per cent discount to the average sale price, either because of mistakes by buyers and sellers, tax write-offs or some other scam exploiting unskilled users.

Researchers have also warned that the market is likely being inflated by wash trading ‚Äî when a trader takes both sides of a trade in order to give the false impression of demand.

‚ÄúYou can buy and sell an NFT on a public platform and make it look like there is plenty of interest in the piece when it‚Äôs just you pushing up the price,‚Äù said R√ºdiger K Weng, chief executive of Germany-based Weng Fine Art.

‚ÄúThis happens in the traditional art world too‚Äù, he said, but added that if a manipulator consigns an artwork to Sotheby‚Äôs and attempts wash trading, they will have to pay the auction house 25 per cent of the sale, making it a costly enterprise.

Weekly newsletter

For the latest news and views on fintech from the FT‚Äôs network of correspondents around the world, sign up to our weekly newsletter #fintechFT

Sign up here with one click

‚ÄúWith NFTs the costs are a fraction of that,‚Äù he said, referencing the transaction fees, known as gas fees, required to mint or purchase an NFT, which can fluctuate depending on demand.

Nevertheless, there are plenty of supporters who believe that the market is maturing and will eventually offer a host of features, such as allowing artists to collect royalties in perpetuity.

‚ÄúWhat can you do because it‚Äôs software?‚Äù asked Benedict Evans, an independent technology analyst and a former venture capitalist. ‚ÄúThat might be things like the artist gets a share and subsequent secondary sales,‚Äù he said, pointing to early innovations in the space around music rights in particular.

Already, the so-called financialisation of NFTs is taking place in some communities ‚Äî for example, using NFTs as collateral for loans, or breaking down ownership of a single piece into smaller parts, known as fractionalisation.

In the longer term, enthusiasts hope tokens will one day power ecommerce in any metaverse or metaverses, futuristic digital avatar-filled virtual worlds. Here, NFTs could designate ownership of virtual goods, be that clothing for digital avatars or art for the walls of their digital houses. Nike recently announced that it had bought a virtual shoe company to mint virtual sneakers.

Either way, the future of the NFTs market will also depend on the stance that regulators take as the freewheeling market develops.

There are concerns, even among corporate issuers, that NFTs share characteristics with certain digital investment vehicles and therefore may be considered securities by regulators.

Devika Kornbacher, partner at Vinson and Elkins, said companies looking to issue NFTs regularly ask: ‚ÄúIs this NFT going to be viewed as a financial instrument? Will it be considered a security from our company?‚Äù

Meanwhile, tax agencies such as the Internal Revenue Service are yet to address NFTs directly, but some experts argue that they could be deemed ‚Äúcollectibles‚Äù, meaning they would be subject to capital gains taxes.

‚ÄúIt is a looming existential issue for the whole industry,‚Äù said Pratin Vallabhaneni, partner at White & Case, of impending regulation.

Additional reporting by Eva Szalay and Siddharth Venkataramakrishnan

title: NFT-YAY OR NAY?
text:
NFT-YAY OR NAY?

NFTs are becoming everyone‚Äôs favorite topic to discuss in the current times. It is not common knowledge, but NFTs have been around since 2014, and only now they are gaining immense popularity because they are a convenient alternative to buying and selling digital artwork. NFT or Non- Fungible Token is a digital, non-interchangeable token.

They are forever linked and encrypted with the creators‚Äô signature. There is a significant rise in the number of NFT stores, applications, and businesses. It's a type of a digital resource that can represent real art, music, video, and in-game data.

Non-Fungible Tokens are generally encrypted with the same software as other cryptos and traded on the market online, often with bitcoin. The biggest advantage of NFT is the fact that they are unique. The NFT market has become extremely competitive. One must devote time to conducting thorough research of their niche and then determine what problems their technique can solve.

There are several ways that you can earn through NFT. Let's take a look at the top 5 business ideas for entrepreneurs.

NFT Artist

If you have a creative mind and always wanted to shift your focus to digital art, now is a perfect time. NFTs were created in part to help artists make more money in a digital market that hasn't always treated them fairly. Bear in mind that you will have to face a strong competition though, so make sure that your work stands out.

Alas, there is just no single source of truth on how to create revenue-generating content. Our major piece of advice enjoy.

NFT Cryptocurrency

Crypto protocols concentrating on NFT shopping, interactive media, art, and other similar fields are becoming increasingly popular. Our advice to you is that understanding the niche, providing value, and engaging consumers are the most difficult aspects of this platform.

If your cryptocurrency doesn't have a meaning, a simple "NFT" prefix won't guarantee rapid success.

In less than a year, AXS coins went from zero to $70. In Axie Infinite, an NFT-based online game, the AXS currency is utilized to swap, in-game creatures. Even though video games are the primary motivator for AXS coins, the cryptocurrency has proven to be a consistent source of income for the protocol's creators.

NFT Online Course

As you learn more and more about NFT, you will see that even though everyone is talking about it, there are only a few who actually understand it fully. If you think you have gained enough knowledge about its services, and how to produce and sell them, you can also create a channel and dedicate your time to creating and uploading training sessions and creating your own brand. You can charge them according to your desire.

NFT Marketplace

Do you want to stumble into an NFT goldmine? Start NFT auctions. NFT marketplaces use the standard auction method. You will notice that their business strategies are also built on traditional markets. Each and every sale that is made through the NFT shop is subject to a predetermined fee deducted by these platforms. Given the rapid development of NFT art, starting your own NFT marketplace is one of the most promising business ideas for the coming days.

NFT Collectibles

Your innovations are only limited by your creativity when it comes to NFT collectibles. It goes without saying that the more creative you are, the more money you will make. Action figures, collector cards, comic books, paintings, and whatever else limited edition item you can think of, bring them to the NFT platform and start distributing. Bring fresh ideas to the marketplace and gain popularity.

Non-fungible tokens(NFT) have been around for a while, and the trend does not seem to be going away anytime soon. You will notice that the big sellers on the NFT right now are images(digital), GIFs, videos, and songs. And just like everything else, supply and demand are driving the price.

Since NFTs are scarce, and collectors want them all, they‚Äôre willing to pay a lot of money for them. Some people are also seeing them as an investment at the moment because they have the option to resell the NFT for a higher price later on. If you have a unique skill set and you still haven‚Äôt put that to use, don‚Äôt waste any more time.

title: Top 5 Play To Earn Crypto NFT Games List - 2022
text:
Top 5 Play To Earn Crypto NFT Games List - 2022

As long as the concept of NFT is rising, the concept of play to earn NFT projects is expected to reach astounding heights in the near future. Kathryn Mitchell Follow Dec 31, 2021 ¬∑ 7 min read

Top 5 Play To Earn Crypto NFT Games

There are numerous ways to earn money in the digital space but nothing has been more entertaining and easier than blockchain-based NFT games. In NFT Revolution, Everyone can earn an enormous amount of money by just playing their favorite games by implementing the core of NFTs to it. Non-fungible tokens, as we know, are digital assets that are built on a blockchain network. Since it is on a blockchain, the ownership of the NFT is stored securely on the digital ledger. Thus, it eliminates middlemen and the threat that comes along with them, such as costly transaction fee, data manipulation, and data theft.

By adding this incredible technology to the gaming domain paved the way for the concept of play to earn NFT crypto games.

How Do NFT Games Make Money?

Top Play To Earn NFT Games List

NFTs are known for their ability to be unique and easily tradable. Thus, adding the NFTs to the gaming world opens the door for extensive monetization opportunities. The gaming platforms have been around for many decades and still have been following the same road in terms of monetization. The players never get the opportunity to earn by playing their favorite games, it has always been the developers who are making a fortune out of it. This has been a rising issue for a while and was rectified with the help of NFTs and opened the gates for upcoming play to earn NFT games.

These types of games are built with a blockchain network and the in-game assets of the game are represented as NFTs. The players play the game and complete levels or win battles, whatever achievements that are programmed for a game are completed, the players will receive NFTs or they can buy them in the game. These NFTs are traded over secondary marketplaces and are liquidated. This liquidation from games is possible because of NFTs and they are created a new term in the digital space known as ‚Äúplay to earn‚Äù.

What Are The Benefits Of NFT Games?

Transparency is the most important factor in NFT games. Transparency establishes trust among players. This quality is powered by the effectiveness of the blockchain. The purchases that are made on the game are recorded on the digital ledger. Since they recorded on the ledger, it is open for everyone in the game. Thus, when a player purchases an asset that is not supposed to be purchased, will be known to the players and the necessary actions will be taken.

Security is the most prioritized possession in any blockchain-based platform. The blockchain network takes care of the security aspect of any best play to earn NFT Blockchain games. The complete data of the game regarding each and every level of the game will be stored on the ledger in a very secure manner. Thus, it cannot be deleted or manipulated even if the game shuts down abruptly.

Ownership is the key for NFTs. This is one of the most treasured qualities of any NFT game. When an in-game collectible is bought, the ownership and the other details regarding the game are saved in the blockchain and thus it is extremely hard to crack and impose it with various cyber threats. Thus, it enables the players to purchase and trade the in-game NFTs without having to worry about cyber attacks.

Top 5 Play To Earn NFT Games:

Play To Earn Games Like Axie Infinity

Play To Earn Games Like Axie Infinity

Axie Infinity is a blockchain game that is inspired by the Pokemon game series. This game is regarded as one of the latest play to earn NFT Investment games in 2021. It has paved the way for numerous players to succeed in monetizing their knack for gaming effortlessly. Axie Infinity is a game where players get to train, breed, and buy monsters called Axies and allow them to battle with each other against various players.

Play To Earn Games Like Gods Unchained

Play To Earn Games Like Gods Unchained

Gods Unchained is a very popular trading cards game. This is an online strategy-based NFT game where the cards provided in the game are in the form of NFTs. The trading cards that are provided in the game possess real-world value based on a token called the GODS token.

Play To Earn Crypto Games Like Splinterlands

Play To Earn Crypto Games Like Splinterlands

Spliterlands is another type of NFT game that is famous for its innovative gameplay and incredible utilization of the play-to-earn ecosystem. This NFT game is built on the efficiency of a blockchain network called the HIVE. The core of this game is to battle against various monsters and win in-game assets and these NFT-based assets are traded over numerous secondary marketplaces.

Play To Earn Sandbox Games

Play To Earn Sandbox Games

The sandbox is the latest entry in the blockchain gaming sector. This game is widely known for its two hit mobile game variations; the Sandbox (2011) and the Sandbox Evolution (2016). This is one of the most popular games because of its high volume of downloads on iOS and Android devices.

Play To Earn Alien Worlds

Play To Earn Alien Worlds

Alien worlds is an impressive addition to the play-to-earn NFT games list. This is a play to earn metaverse-based game that has the ability to be built on numerous blockchains such as Ethereum, WAX, and Binance Smart Chain. The core of this game is based on the concept of exploration and mining. This leads to the discovery of in-game asset-based NFTs which are traded over secondary marketplaces.

Staking In NFT gaming

NFT games have been reaching great heights in a short period of time since their inception to the digital space. This is now certified as a great opportunity for players to experience an immense amount of profits and exciting rewards. But, it does not end there; there are impressive mechanisms for players to earn even more profits and rewards with NFT gaming.

The NFT staking mechanism is one of those latest mechanisms. This mechanism is used in NFT gaming for gaining futuristic rewards. The player can stake his/her NFT gaming assets in a staking platform that is in-built on the gaming platform or else on an external platform. The NFT gaming assets could be anything, ranging from a weapon to a gaming avatar, anything that is represented as an NFT can be staked seamlessly.

When the NFT gaming asset is staked on a staking pool, they remain there as long as the player gets it out of the pool. The profits and rewards generated by staking are completely dependent on the rarity and the value of the NFT. Thus, the rarer, the more profits. Hence, it is advisable for players to stake their assets for a long period of time and the expected profits are raised to great heights. Additionally, it is a perfect scenario where players can earn a huge amount of rewards and profits in a short period of time through staking.

NFT Marketplace For Trading Gaming Assets

NFT marketplace is a special platform that is used for trading NFTs on a blockchain network. This special platform trades anything that is represented as non-fungible tokens. The gaming assets that are represented as NFTs need to be monetized and the monetization activity is completely dependent on the players; if players want to monetize them, the NFT marketplace is the platform where they should visit.

When players get their NFT gaming assets from the game they are playing, they can monetize them by trading them on secondary marketplaces or marketplaces of the game which is possible in some of the NFT games. The trading of the NFT asset is dependent on the player. The player can trade it immediately or hold it for its value to rise and trade it in the future.

Conclusion

At present, the play-to-earn NFT games have submitted themselves as one of the most dominant forces in the crypto space. As long as the concept of NFT is rising, the concept of play to earn NFT projects is expected to trend astounding heights in the near future. Thus, taking advantage of this novel opportunity is the best possible way to enjoy greater rewards and prizes.

title: Jerome‚Äôs Journal: Pixie ‚Äî Page 23
text:
Jerome‚Äôs Journal: Pixie ‚Äî Page 23

Maurice Lamar had a friend named Paul. He was the owner of a small business, maybe you‚Äôve heard of it, Pixie Paul‚Äôs Packaging. I never liked Paul, but the guy sure knew how to promote his business in a fun way over time. I like to think I had a big part of his success, but I digress.

Pixies are small creatures, only a a couple of inches tall. They‚Äôre unable to speak, but can make sounds when they move. Incredibly animated creatures. Some can be super loyal, some can be super mischievous, but all have strong personalities.

Pixies run their own communities and have small cities scattered around the world. You‚Äôll never find them if they don‚Äôt want to be found.

I was invited to visit a large Pixie City, and frankly, the small architecture is amazing. I must have felt like a giant monster to the Pixies, but they brought me in. The large underground cave they lived in didn‚Äôt get much foot traffic, so they were completely hidden, and they had large pockets specifically made for larger beings like humans.

They‚Äôre able to harvest and create a special resource, known as Pixie Dust, of course. It‚Äôs a valuable dust with the ability to give levitational powers to Cryptids and Cryptid Hunters temporarily.

With the rise of Pixie Paul‚Äôs Packaging becoming the number 1 corporation in the world, Pixie‚Äôs have become prevalent, but it wasn‚Äôt always that way. Paul didn‚Äôt even know what a Pixie looked like before me, but did I get any credit? I don‚Äôt think so.

Paul sucks.

title: Zillaz: The Rise of the Bamilia (The Mafia Report)
text:
Introduction

Zillaz is a collection of 2,424 NFT‚Äôs on the Solana blockchain that have risen to notoriety within the last couple of weeks. Based on 4 different breeds of monsters, this collection has many key elements that have made it stand out amongst the crowd. The Bamilia, their term for ‚Äòfamily‚Äô, is one of the strongest communities in the space right now. Whether you‚Äôre meandering around Discord or scrolling through NFT Twitter, you are bound to see this word pop up.

4 Breeds Genesis Zillaz

The Story

The Zillaz NFT collection was created around the story of the Zillaz. There are 4 different breeds of Zillaz. These include the Zillaz, the Catzillaz, the Dogezillaz, and the Monkezillaz. Each breed emerged in 2031, one year after World War 3.

The Zillaz were the first breed to emerge after WW3. These are a type of lizard creature. The Catzillaz are a type of cat creature and are the meanest and most aggressive breed of Zillaz. They do not like humans. The Dogezillaz are modeled after man‚Äôs best friend; the dog. These are the only breed of Zillaz that are friendly with humans after WW3 and act as human protectors. The last breed of Zillaz, a type of monkey beast, is the Monkezillaz. These creatures have a much higher intelligence level than any of their counterpart breeds and have even developed their own economy.

Although not revealed yet, the Zillaz team plans to add 4 new breeds. These breeds will be attainable by breeding the existing Genesis Collection.

Utility

With the creation of a DAO, a storyline to fit the collection, $RAD (their utility token), and eventually breeding and merch, the roadmap for Zillaz has no shortage of exciting undertakings.

After mint, the Zillaz Team started by making a DAO. The creation of the DAO allows for private sections in the Discord for verified holders. These channels will allow holders to make decisions about Zilllaz future, which they will have a large role in creating. 100% of royalties go directly to the DAO which will give the DAO the funding to take part in the future of Zillaz, and make it what they want.

After the DAO was created, the wallets containing unlisted Zillaz were airdropped $RAD Token. This token is airdropped several times a week at random to wallets that contain delisted Zillaz. This is to discourage people from listing on secondary markets. With 2 Genesis Zillaz and 450 $RAD, holders will be able to breed their Zillaz and create one of four new breeds of Baby Zillaz. A total of 4848 Baby Zillaz will be created.

Along with all the benefits mentioned above, the Zillaz Team also plans to create holder-exclusive merch. According to their website, it will be things that holders want to buy and represent. Holders will also get the chance to claim 3D Voxel models of their Zillaz for later use in the metaverse.

The Zillaz team is also planning to release a game. It will be a fully immersive gaming experience where holders can use their Zillaz as avatars in the game. As it is mentioned several times on their website and in the founder‚Äôs Twitter bio, the Zillaz team is dead-set on bringing Zillaz into the metaverse in some form or fashion.

The Team

Although we could not find it directly mentioned, we believe there is only one creator and founder behind Zillaz. The creator is known as ToddlerNFT (sometimes called BriceVibes) on Discord and Twitter. Although we could not find a full name, his Twitter bio says that he is an orthodontist. He also mentions that he runs Zillaz like a business, which we believe is the correct approach to managing an NFT project.

We believe ToddlerNFT is the only creator and founder of Zillaz because he is the only person in the Zillaz discord with the founder‚Äôs role. There are also a few people with admin roles, such as NFTBricklayer. According to his Twitter bio, he is helping to build the project. We are not certain of his exact role, but we believe he is helping directly manage Zillaz in some way.

There are also several mods on the Zillaz Team that help run the discord such as Brice Lee, Rick Sanchez, and KNighT on Discord (could not find their Twitters). The mods are usually quite active in the Zillaz Discord.

Aside from their team, the Zillaz community has several well-known holders. Some of these include SolBigBrain, SolBuckets, IcedKnife, and a few other well-respected and OG members of the Solana NFT ecosystem. Although it is unclear if they help or advise behind the scenes, you can sometimes find these members hanging out in the Discord channels.

The Significance: What other projects(and buyers) can take away from Zillaz

Zillaz launched on December 15th with a mint price of 1 $Sol each. Currently sitting at a 12x from mint with a floor price of 12 $Sol (on December 30th), around 2 weeks after mint, it is obvious that Zillaz has been a huge success. Because of this, we wanted to determine what made them different.

The first major difference we have found is the Zillaz community. With only about 6k Twitter followers and 13k Discord members, the Zillaz have a relatively small following. Although they do not have the largest community, they do have one of the most devoted communities in Solana NFT‚Äôs. As mentioned earlier, they refer to themselves as the Bamilia or family. Members of the Zillaz community are constantly posting memes on Twitter and making words that shouldn‚Äôt start with a ‚Äúb‚Äù start with a ‚Äúb‚Äù. These memes and jokes have fostered a very interactive and joyful community.

The next major difference we see in the Zillaz is real utility. With the combination of a utility token, breeding, 3D models, merch, and the other things mentioned previously, they have created a real demand for their collection. Because breeding requires 2 Zillaz and 450 $RAD, many members have multiple Zillaz. Because the genesis collection is only 2,424 NFT‚Äôs total and there are incentives to buy more than one, less than 10% of the total supply is listed at the time of this article.

As mentioned earlier, ToddlerNFT runs Zillaz like a business. He has done a great job of making a fully immersive project. He has created a story around the collection that makes it incredibly entertaining and adds a plot for the videogame down the road, a utility token that provides real benefits to holders, and there will eventually be physical merch. Not only does ToddlerNFT have the technical aspects of the project covered, he also managed to excel in arguably the most necessary part of the project: building a community.

Closing Comments

Zillaz have already started checking things off their roadmap, and they are geared for long-term success. The Zillaz have already created their DAO, holders have already received the $RAD airdrop, and they have begun to put breeding into motion. Although the Zillaz team has been quick to begin completing the roadmap, they have a long-term vision that ToddlerNFT is determined to achieve.

Although there are no details yet, a second roadmap will eventually be released, according to their website. This will probably include details about how Zillaz plan to expand into the metaverse and crypto gaming.

Graph by bmirc

Time Sensitive Opinion

Although Zillaz have been on a steady climb upward, as shown on the graph above, they are sitting at a 12x from mint and it is unreasonable to be certain they will keep climbing in the near future. Although they could see a bit of a dip, with a competent founder, hardworking team, and big plans for the future, Zillaz has the potential to have a promising future. If the community stays as involved and excited about the project as they have been, it will not fail.

title: Update: Latest Lightstreams Wallet with Coming NFT-C support.
text:
We are pleased to officially announce the latest release of the Lightstreams Wallet 0.0.6. The wallet‚Äôs first release was announced in June, with the primary aim of helping users to easily get started using Lightstreams by not having to set up custom configurations as they would with other wallets such as MetaMask.

The first version supported the basic functionality of sending and receiving PHT coins. Now the latest version supports the connection of a web application (once approved) to the wallet with the following features:

- Reading account balances

- Deploying smart contracts

- Sending transactions to smart contracts

- Adding Tokens

- Interacting with Tokens

- Signing messages

With these latest features, developers can build web applications for their users who have the Lightstreams Wallet installed so that they can easily interact with the Lightstreams blockchain using a customised web interface.

In the video below you can see the new wallet in action with an example test web interface.

Lightstreams Wallet 0.0.6

What else have we been working on?

Many tasks happen behind the scenes in order to maintain the Lightstreams blockchain and infrastructure, many of which are very technical in nature or proprietary. A major task that can be mentioned was the successful upgrade of infrastructure that supports the Lightstreams blockchain that will allow for greater expansion in the near future.

This was quite an undertaking and involved upgrading validator and sentry nodes. The team did an excellent job and there was no network downtime. For a small project, the team is proud that the Lightstreams blockchain has been operating seamlessly for 2.5 years without any incidents.

What‚Äôs next?

The team has been working on a new NFT (Non Fungible Token) called an NFT-C (Non Fungible Token with Content), which we are aiming that the next release of the Lightstreams Wallet will support. Unlike standard NFTs, the owner of an NFT-C will be able to control who has access to the content attached to the token by sending transactions to the Lightstreams blockchain approving access permission.

Lightstreams wallet supporting an NFT-C transaction

The NFT-C standard will enable a new dimension beyond standard NFTs, giving the owner the ability to generate income by leasing or renting their digital art, video, or music to applications and their users.

We will be releasing more technical details soon for those that want to learn more about NFT-Cs and how they can start incorporating them into their projects.

With this upcoming release, we will be focussing on partnership deals with leading NFT exchanges and services to begin supporting of NFT-Cs by integrating Lightstreams into their ecosystems.

The team is very excited about 2022!
