title: Property‚Äôs ‚Äî The Whitepaper 1.0. A few words before we jump in‚Ä¶
text:
3. $BRIX: Utility Token, Distribution & Use Cases

Your NFTs accumulate a utility token (‚Äú$BRIX‚Äù) which holders can exclusively claim on our website ‚Äî https://propertys.xyz. The go-live will be announced at the end of 2021.

Every month holders can claim $BRIX for the NFT cards they own. $BRIX is built for one purpose and one purpose only: to enable you to exchange for more NFTs & metaverse objects and exclusive access to events within the Property‚Äôs ecosystem.

$BRIX has no other functionality other than within the Property‚Äôs ecosystem, and it cannot be purchased from Property‚Äôs developers. Property‚Äôs developers do not provide or intend to provide a secondary market for $BRIX.

Do not expect monetary gains from $BRIX. $BRIX is not intended to give you financial rewards ‚Äî it will not ‚Äúmake you money‚Äù. $BRIX is intended to be used as a means of exchange for our digital and physical products & events ‚Äî it may ‚Äúsave you money‚Äù that you would otherwise have to pay to acquire these assets.

Claiming $BRIX

Every building has a unique, randomized code that can only be claimed once per period ‚Äî this prevents double-claiming on an NFT and keeps the tokenomics intact. The $BRIX you can claim depend on your holdings. Every holder regardless of the amount they may own is entitled to $BRIX if they register their holdings for a given period. The period is always a month.

4. Collecting Game: The Mechanics

Before we dive into the mechanics ‚Äî which are fairly simple ‚Äî it‚Äôs important to understand the distinction between special cards and regular cards and the way these regular cards can combine into pure & impure streets.

Card Tiers Single Houses Forming Pure Combos Forming Impure Combos Special Buildings $BRIX Bonuses

Card Tiers

There are 7 cities and 120 special buildings. The 7 cities are separated into 3 tiers ‚Äî giving low-high amounts of $BRIX. The 120 special buildings are separated into 20 of 20, 5 of 5, and 1 of 1 cards. Again lower to higher amounts of $BRIX.

Single Houses

A single house ‚Äî 1 NFT, collects $BRIX as standalone, you do not need to complete any of the combos to collect $BRIX. These combos give bonuses, but should not be the reason anyone is excluded from the Property‚Äôs ecosystem.

title: Escaping to the Belgian coast: Suite 133
text:
Upon the Belgian coast is Knokke-Heist, where visitors swoon to for a fleeting escape. Charming seaside properties are aplenty. And under this category, there‚Äôs Suite 133, an apartment stay brought to you by local resident and arbiter of taste, Linda Dossin.

For as long as she can remember, Linda has been passionate about interiors and remodelling old buildings. It ultimately led her to create Escape the Ordinary, a family-run hospitality group, which became a way for Linda to share her proclivity for design with others.

Currently, Escape the Ordinary oversees two premium apartments in Belgium, including Suite 133 that‚Äôs ideal for weekenders. Here, the motto is simple: stay, enjoy and inspire. And inside bright and airy interiors, it‚Äôs entirely easy to drift from the humdrum of daily life.

I had the chance to speak to the wonderful Linda to find out more about Suite 133 and her enthusiasm for slow living.

You used to run a manor in the Ardennes. What was the story there?

As a young family, we would often escape to the Ardennes on the weekends. The area is fondly referred to as Belgium‚Äôs green lungs, and when you visit, you can see why. Nature takes centre stage; it‚Äôs so beautiful, making it the perfect place to slow down and relax.

We found a sizeable house here, and since it had more than enough room for the four of us, we thought of sharing it with others. And so Entre Ciel et Terre, which translates to ‚Äòbetween sky and earth‚Äô, was born. It was a luxury bed and breakfast, which we ran for several years.

What was that transition like to Knokke?

As my children grew up and left, it became difficult to maintain the B&B by myself, as my husband worked elsewhere. As a result, we looked towards Knokke, a seaside town in northern Belgium, about a half an hour drive from Bruges. People call Knokke the Monaco of the North, sans the Mediterranean sun. Besides the casino, Knokke has always been a hub for those in the creative fields, and you‚Äôll find plenty of galleries, exhibitions and museums. There‚Äôs also the Zoute Grand Prix, an annual art and lifestyle festival featuring luxury cars.

It simply felt like the best place to start our next chapter.

How did you choose a property in Knokke?

To continue offering our hospitality services, I envisioned a getaway that encompassed the luxury of a hotel but with the facilities and convenience of a small apartment. As such, it wouldn‚Äôt just be a standard hotel room.

We found the property, but it needed many renovations, which took longer than anticipated. By the time everything was done, it had brought us up to the end of January 2020. But soon after, the Covid-19 pandemic took full force, so we had to close for several months.

Where do you source your decor, and how do you decide what pieces to implement for the interiors?

I‚Äôm always on the hunt for tasteful objects. My children tease me, as I can never resist spending copious time inside antique shops or markets.

For Suite 133, I prioritised finding items that inspired mindfulness through simplicity. I like a more minimal style, and where the place is light-filled, I naturally gravitate towards raw, earthy materials and colours.

What do you hope your guests takeaway after a stay at Suite 133?

I always say that when you stay with us, you‚Äôre not merely booking a room. You‚Äôre booking a lifestyle. I consider Suite 133 as more than just a physical space because I want it to provoke a calm feeling where the guest experience is concerned.

Our goal is to foster the art of slow living, eliciting comfort and contentment. I hope our guests feel like they have managed to rest, create memories, and appreciate the beauty that lies in a muted, understated surrounding.

What are your favourite things to do in Knokke, and what are some points of interest that you would recommend to guests?

Knokke is a natural beauty, and I enjoy taking in the scenes, going on walks and hikes. Since it‚Äôs not too far away, many people cycle from here to the historic centre of Bruges, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It‚Äôs a great way to get outdoors and be active. For more sporty activities, there‚Äôs also the Royal Zoute Golf Club.

The town draws in many international artists, architects, sculptors and painters, and so the nearby galleries are a joy to visit as they hold exciting exhibitions throughout the year.

Indeed, you‚Äôll find plenty of luxe restaurants and high-end shops. And as mentioned earlier, a casino for anyone looking to try their luck.

Although international travel has been unsteady, where do your guests mainly come from?

Many of our guests are here for staycations, coming from all parts of Belgium. Recently, we also have had a lot of visitors from the Netherlands, Germany, Luxemburg, England and Russia.

What can we expect from your brand in the coming months?

As a family-owned hospitality group, we try to offer a unique, personable hospitality experience through all our endeavours. We are constantly searching for exciting projects, but I consider ourselves a work-in-progress. I would say: stay tuned‚Ä¶

title: Village of Volvoi: The temples, the Zatra and the festivities
text:
With the winter setting in and the December nights becoming colder the Hindu community in Goa is busy celebrating the Zatras (annual temple festivals) in the temples of their Kul Devata (Family God), Gram Devata (ancestral village God) or the Gaonvchi Zatra (the festival of the temple in the town/village of their present residence). The end of the Diwali season in November heralds the beginning of the season of Zatras in all the temples across Goa.

All of us in Goa have heard of the well known Fatorpa Zatra and the Shirgaon Zatra, thanks to the Konkani song Jhila ani Lila (Jhila and Lila) by the renowned Goan actor and singer M. Boyer. In this song, Boyer and Sophiya croon to the melodious music by the world acclaimed musician Chris Perry, the beautiful lyrics about attending in unison the Zatras of Fatorpa and Shirgaon along with some other festivals in Goa.

For most of us, a Zatra means a temple festival when the Hindu devotees take darshan (paying obeisance) of the temple deity on that auspicious day, participate in the Rath (chariot) pulling ceremony or Palkhi (palanquin) ceremony of the deity. Besides this, the Zatra is also comprised of a feiri (village fair) in the temple premises with some stalls selling the tasty khaje (local sweet made from gram flour and sugarcane jaggery) and other stalls selling useful items and home appliances. But, recently I got to know, that in some specific village temples, for certain Hindu communities a Zatra is much more than what we all seem to know and there are many customs and traditions attached to the celebration.

Trupti Tari dressed in a kapod ( nine-yard saree) in the traditional style

On the 4th of December 2021, on my visit to our family friends Mr Tukaram Tari and his wife Trupti in Vasco, I saw Trupti dressed in a nine-yard saree, a kapod (cotton/ silk saree) in the age-old traditional way which is known as kashin nessop (the saree is draped like a dhoti). She had donned a fulanchi atti / fanthi (flowers plaited together) in her hair and was clad in jewellery. On asking Trupti the reason for being dressed up this way, I got to know from her about the Volvoi Zatra of Devi Gajant Laxmi (local village Goddess) and the various customs observed there. Volvoi is the ancestral village of Mr Tari and both of them had just arrived home after attending the Zatra of their Gram Devi (ancestral village Goddess). This Zatra was held on that very auspicious day of Kartiki Amavasya (the new moon night of the month of Kartika of the Hindu Shakya calendar). Mr Tukaram Tari told me that, on this Zatra day all the villagers of Volvoi not only take darshan (pay obeisance) of the Goddess Gajant Laxmi, but also pay a visit and respect to the local deities in the other temples of Goddess Sateri, Kulpurush Deol (temple of the ancestral head of each family) and Rampurush Deol (temple of the village Saviour).

The quaint village of Volvoi is close to the banks of the River Mandovi in Ponda taluka and about thirteen kilometres away from the main town of Ponda. Interesting folklore about this village is that it was created from separate regions of land which were getting flooded with the river water. These separate low lying regions were connected together by the building of bundhs (dams). This is locally known as vholl /vollh ghalop. Thus the village got the name Volvoi. Years later these bundhs developed khavte (cracks) and once again the village started getting flooded with water. At that time one of the Purvaj (ancestor) from the village approached a close relative in the neighbouring village of Betki for his advice to stop this problem. The said relative asked the Purvaj to offer human life as an offering/sacrifice (which was a practice of a traditional custom in that era) to the bundh to put a stop to the khavte (cracks). A local young lad was offered as a sacrifice to save the village and the problem is supposed to have got solved. Since then, this young Saviour of the village whose name was Ram began to be worshipped by the villagers. They built a small temple named Rampurush Deol (temple) in his memory close to the banks of the River Mandovi. During any of the religious festivals and on the day of the Volvoi Zatra, all the villagers pay their respect to this Rampurush as a form of gratitude.

The original natives of Volvoi belong to the Tari (boatmen) community. This Tari (boatmen) community, owned small boats and carried the trade of transporting logs of timber and other commodities and even people in their boats along the River Mandovi river to distant places. They would transport the commodities to places like Khandepar, Chodnem located on the river banks as well as to the various towns in the coastal areas in Goa which included Panaji and Vasco. Sometimes, two boats were tied together to form a sangodd in order to ferry more logs in a single trip. During the Portuguese regime (Goa was liberated from this regime in 1961) in Goa, a Tari Sociedad (society) was formed in Volvoi to carry out this business of timber transportation as it was the main source of income to the villagers.

Tukaram Tari narrated to me that it is believed that initially, only four main families of the Tari community resided in Volvoi. The heads of these four Tari families are the Kulpurush (main ancestors). These ancestral heads came to be known as Vhodlo (eldest one), Mhodlo (middle one), Dhaklo (youngest one) and the Bhandari Kulpurush. Four mini temples in the village have been dedicated to these Kulpurush. Tukaram Tari and his family members are the descendants of the Bhandari Kul and hence they pay obeisance in the temple of the Bhandari Kulpurush on various religious occasions which also includes the Volvoi Zatra.

[Note: This Bhandari Kulpurush is different from the Bhandari Samaj which is another special community amongst the Hindus in Goa.]

Just like most of the villages in Goa, Volvoi has a local ancient temple dedicated to Goddess Sateri. Sater means a roin (an anthill) which was worshipped by the early Goan ancestors and later on came to be known as Shantadurga in some places. It is this Goddess Sateri of Volvoi who gave shelter in her own vatar (area) to Goddess Gajant Laxmi who came to this village from some other distant land. The Goddess Gajant Laxmi is known by this name as the idol of Laxmi Devi is flanked by Gajas (elephants), one each on either side who are seen with raised trunks showering water on her.

The idol of the Goddess Gajant Laxmi is flanked by Elephants on either side. ( Copyright: The Facebook group of Shri Gajant Laxmi Saunsthan-Volvoi, Goa)

There are different folklore about the arrival of the Goddess Gajant Laxmi to this riverside village of Volvoi. Some folks believe that the original idol of this Goddess was found in one of the boats of a Tari, who came back to the village after delivering the timber to a neighbouring place. The villagers believed the idol to be of Goddess Kelbai and that she had come on her own to settle down in Volvoi. After noticing that the idol was not of Kelbai but was of Goddess Gajant Laxmi they built a temple for her in the village. Whereas Tukaram Tari has a different tale that has been narrated to him by his ancestors. According to his tale, Devi Gajant Laxmi was originally from a place named Unchgao in Kolhapur and is supposed to have been brought to Goa from that place. Initially, she was kept in a place named Rumad in Ponda taluka and later on brought to Volvoi. A temple was built for her by the Tari community of this village. The existing temple of the Goddess Gajant Laxmi is about 126 years old and since it was built by the Tari community, they are the Mahajans (owners) of it. Since then the Murthy Punarprathishthapan (ceremony of replacement of the idol of the Goddess) has been performed thrice. The last time this ceremony was performed was in May 1995 when the temple had completed a century.

Sticker issued by the temple committee dated 15th May 1995 commemorating the completion of 100 years of the temple and the third idol replacement ceremony ( Copyright: Shree Gajant Laxmi Saunsthan, Volvoi, Goa)

About a couple of years ago the existing original temple has been extended and a new Sabha Mandap (a meeting hall) and a grand entrance have been added to accommodate more people during the temple festivities. Also, the Kalash (dome) of the temple has been renovated.

The Gajant Laxmi temple in Volvoi with the extended Sabha Mandap on the left and the new Kalash (dome). (Copyright : Abhilash Halarnker )

Every year to honour and thank the Goddess Gajant Laxmi for having brought prosperity to the village on her arrival, the villagers of Volvoi celebrate the temple Zatra on the auspicious day of Kartiki Amavasya (full moon night in the month of Kartika). On this day, the Palkhi (palanquin) ceremony of the Goddess starts at seven-thirty in the morning. First, the aarti (religious ritual of worship) and the other rituals of the Goddess are performed and she is seated in the Palkhi which is carried by the Mahajans belonging to the Tari community. The Palkhi is taken out for paying respect to the other ancient temples located in the vicinity. This procession is accompanied by the Bhatt (temple priest), a Vajantri (band of local musical instruments) and hundreds of Savashins (married women) carrying a fully lit divaj. A divaj is a two-layered traditional tree lamp made from brass which used to be made from clay in the olden days.

[Note: Divaj is Goa‚Äôs official state symbol].

A brass divaj ( traditional two-layered tree lamp) with a handle for holding

For participating in the ritual of Divaja at the Zatra, all the Savashins (married women) are dressed in a kapad (a nine-yard saree) in the traditional kashin style. They are decked in gold jewellery and adorn their hair with a fulanchi fanthi (weaved flowers). Each of them comes with a divaj in the hand and oil to light it. This divaj is lit by a Mahajan and given to the Savashin. The Savashin first goes with the lighted divaj to her respective family Kulpurush (ancestor) temple to pay respect to him and comes back to join in the procession of the Palkhi going to the Sateri temple. On the way, all of them halt to pay respect at a Gram Purush (village ancestral head) temple. Then the Palkhi procession proceeds to the temple of Goddess Sateri to pay respect to her as a mark of gratitude for having given shelter to the Devi Gajant Laxmi. Near this temple, the newly married women join in the procession along with their husbands. These newlyweds are initiated by the Bhatt for the first time in the ritual of Divaja. Then the entire procession returns back to the temple of Gajant Laxmi where the Palkhi is kept in the temple hall for the rest of the devotees to pay obeisance while the Mahajans light the lamps on the Deepasthambha (tower for lamps) outside the temple. Each of the Savashins performs the aarti of the Goddess holding the divaj and takes five Pradakshina (circumvent) around the temple. After the Pradakshinas all of them go to pay their respect to the Rampurush temple which is located close to the banks of the river. They pluck small twigs of the Paripat (a small wild medicinal herb) shrubs growing there and adorn them in the hair as a symbolic token of completion of the annual Divaja ritual. After this, they all disburse to have their meals as they had been fasting and then indulge in some shopping in the mini feiri (fair) which is held in the area around temple premises.

Trupti Tari, who always attends the annual Zatra, says that all the Savashins have to observe an Upvas (a fast) right from the previous day (eve of Amavasya) in order to perform the ritual of Divjaa. They break the Upvas and have a proper meal only after the completion of the Divaja at the Zatra. Further, she explained the interesting initiation process of the newly married Savashin into this ritual of Divaja for whom it starts from the first Zatra soon after marriage. In the first year of marriage, the Savashin participates in the Divaja along with her husband and the couple is called Ghatval. The Ghatval couple joins the Palkhi procession at the Sateri temple only after the Bhatt performs some special initiation rituals and lights the divaj for them. The couple together holds the divaj and joins the Palkhi procession returning back to the temple of Gajant Laxmi where the husband moves out of the procession while the wife joins the rest of the Savashins in completing the Pradakshina and other rituals of Divaja. Subsequently, from the next year of marriage, the Savashin participates alone (not with the husband like the previous year) in the Divaja of the Zatra along with the other women.

The Savashins waiting in the temple of Devi Gajant Laxmi for participating in the Divaja ritual (Picture credit to Tejas Tukaram Tari)

This ritual of Divaja is performed by Savashins belonging to other Hindu communities too at some other temple Zatras across Goa celebrated on other auspicious days. The village temples of Amona, Alorna and Khandepar celebrate their annual Zatra with Divaja on the same day as the Volvoi Zatra. Trupti mentioned to me that all over Goa, twelve places including Volvoi celebrate their annual Zatra on this auspicious day of Kartiki Amavasya and it is known as the day of Bara Zatra(twelve Zatras).

On the night of the Volvoi Zatra, a Kalo festival is held near the Gajant Laxmi temple. The young men from the village along with the seniors participate in this Kalo, wherein a special stage is erected in the temple premises for conducting the same. At this stage, a scene known as Ganesh Vandana depicting Lord Ganesh with his two consorts Riddhi and Siddhi is enacted. This act is followed by the performance of a teen anki Pouranik Natak (a three-act play based on the Puranas which are the ancient scriptures of the Hindu religion). The entire village comes to see this Natak as it is a source of learning the Puranas and entertainment. The dramatists of Volvoi are well known far and wide for being good at performing on stage. Master Dattaram Walwaiker who belongs to the Tari community of Volvoi was well acclaimed in the theatre world in Mumbai. He was known for performing and directing plays in the Marathi language. Another dramatist named Narhari Volvoikar whose grandfather was a Tari from Volvoi also started his acting career over here before gaining fame far and wide. So one can conclude that the performance at the Natak (drama) in the Kalo at the Volvoi Zatra is a launchpad for the local dramatists to hone their acting skills.

Master Dinanath Walwaiker (Copyright: Akashwani Mumbai)

Besides having the honour of carrying the Palkhi of Devi Gajant Laxmi in the Volvoi Zatra, the men belonging to the Tari community in Volvoi enjoy the same honour in the Zatra of Devi Vijaya Durga at Keri, a village in the neighbourhood of Volvoi. A young and cheerful relative of mine named Geet Gaurish Naik, whose maternal Kuldevi (ancestral Goddess) is Vijay Durga in Keri, informed me about this Zatra held on the auspicious day of Dashmi, Shukla Paksha of Margashirsha month (tenth day of the waxing moon of the Margashirsha). On this day the Tari community from Volvoi has been bestowed the special honour of carrying the Palkhi of Devi Vijaya Durga and all of them are served special food by the temple priest himself. This respect is given to them as a form of gratitude for having done the favour of ferrying the Goddess Vijay Durga to Keri village in ancient times. This year, the Keri Zatra was celebrated on the 13th of December 2021.

After the celebration of the Zatra of Gajant Laxmi this year, the entire family of Tukaram Tari and all the descendants of the Bhandari Kulpurush got the opportunity to celebrate the Nutan Murthi Pratisthapana Sohala (function of installation of new idol) of the Bhandari Kulpurush. This was held on the 25th and the 26th of December 2020 and comprised of a grand function of performing the religious rituals and worshipping of the new idol.

Trupti and Tukaram Tari told me that December was a month of total enjoyment for them as they participated in the festivities of Volvoi Zatra as well as the function of the Bhandari Kulpurush temple. Now they are looking forward to the unique Volvoi Gondall which will be held in the month of March. Meanwhile, for the rest of the Goan Hindus, the Zatra season will continue as they celebrate the forthcoming Zatras of their own Kul devatas (family Gods) and Gram devatas (village Gods).

title: Stay in Touch with your Sales on the go with RT GSync
text:
All businesses rely heavily on the performance of their sales department. There are dedicated resources allocated to making sure the process of sales is not hindered in any way. Companies go above and beyond to make sure that their sales figures do not drop, and that their clients become repeat customers.

One of the ways the digital revolution has manifested itself in this environment is through CRM, or Customer Relationship Management software, which is a sales automation tool designed to help sales teams as well as the executive members in determining the status of their operations. It provides a birds eye view of all sales operations from opportunities to leads to actual sales made.The way this is accomplished is with the help of different modules such as contacts, documents and calendar, which all contribute to a sale one way or another.

The rapid growth of mobile communication has on the one hand given a boost to the number of ways that a business can conduct sales, but at the same time, the reconciliation of mobile activities with the CRM environment has emerged as a hurdle in keeping business streamlined, and making sure all data is available in one place.

Google‚Äôs services have made it possible for data to be synced across mobile devices, but third party applications like CRMs need special plug-ins to take advantage of these capabilities in their own environments.

You can use your Google account to sync contact information and Calendar events to the CRM.

RT GSync is a module designed to integrate Google‚Äôs core services with Sugar and Suite CRM. Just like you have access to Google contacts, calendar and drive documents anywhere you can sign in with your Google account, GSync takes it a step further and allows you to link it with your CRM instance.

Sales On the Go

It doesn‚Äôt matter if you are making connections, or creating opportunities outside of the workspace, you can use your Google account to sync contact information and Calendar events complete with all the different attributes (email addresses, notes, reminders etc.) to the CRM. You can even add a document to your drive, and it will appear in your CRM for future reference.

It works both ways. Consider that you have arranged a meeting with a lead on the CRM calendar, and sometime later you need to add some notes to that meeting for reference. Simply tap into your mobile Google Calendar app, and make the addition to the event that has been synced from your CRM. You can work from anywhere if need be. Similarly, if you meet a potential client while out of office, and you want to add them to your CRM contacts list, you can do so on your mobile.

Keep Your Backups Organized

What makes CRMs so great is the organization of records. Be it contacts, accounts, leads, opportunities or documents, you have the option to associate one with the other, meaning you have every related item close by when you are looking through any record.

RT GSync aims to keep this organizational aspect when backing up and syncing documents to your Google Drive. It creates folders in your drive named after each module. When you associate a document with a record in that module, it creates a subfolder within that folder which creates the document. This way you never lose track of which documents are related to which modules.

Getting RT GSync

If all the features mentioned above pique your interest, and you think you could enhance your business‚Äôs CRM experience by merging it with Google services, you will be happy to know that GSync is compatible with both Sugar and Suite CRM. To find out more about the plugin, visit the RT GSync website. If you want to purchase a plan, follow the links below:

For any queries, reach out to us at support@rolustech.com.

About Us

Rolustech is a certified CRM partner organization specializing in creating customized CRM solutions for businesses of all kinds. To learn more, visit our website www.rolustech.com.

title: HOW TO CONVERT MORE LEADS WITH SALES CALLS
text:
Assisting businesses with lead conversion is one of the most frequent requests we receive. In today‚Äôs digital world, converting leads is one of the most important milestones in the sales process. Changes in digital marketing strategies, competition and technology have made it important to make sales calls efficiently in order to build a lasting relationship with your customers.

A successful sales call is often the first step in building a lasting relationship with a prospective client.

Let‚Äôs take a look at how you can convert more leads by planning your sales calls more carefully.

Organize your agenda

You can only hold the customer‚Äôs attention for a limited time -make it count. Set up some basic talking points and keep the conversation organized and relevant. Don‚Äôt be afraid to get to the point!

Know your audience

It‚Äôs important to know your prospects before you talk to them in order to market your brand successfully. Databeys‚Äô sales CRM helps you learn about your audience at the click of a button. Use every key knowledge you can get and use it to sustain your customer relationships.

Make room for the client

We get it, time is short and you have to pitch your services, but making the call and starting a monologue is the kind of interaction that‚Äôs not going to get you a customer. Ask your prospect what they‚Äôre looking for and then pitch your product accordingly. Let the customer steer the conversion!

With the help of our sales CRM, Databeys can help you figure out what your audience wants from you and what will turn potential clients to paying customers!

title: HOW TO OPTIMIZE YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE WITH CRM
text:
The quality of customer service you provide affects the customer experience and ultimately your brand. Poor customer service can lead the customers to believe that the brand is lazy and doesn‚Äôt care about them. So how exactly can you improve your customer experience? That‚Äôs where CRM comes into play.

CRM provides a technological foundation for great customer service

Here are a few ways you can get your salespeople to fall in love with CRM

Real time data sharing across teams

When customers have to repeat their problems to every support person, they can get annoyed and give up on your product. CRM systems eliminate this problem by giving customer data and history access to the entire team no matter which platform the customer came from, making the customer service process seamless and efficient.

Knowledge Management

CRM systems provide knowledge management portals that enable customer self-service. Customers can access the FAQ and troubleshooting articles and solve basic problems without needing to talk to a representative. CRM systems also help set up online forums where customers can interact with each other and ask questions. Convenient, isn‚Äôt it?

Consistent Customer Experience

Getting feedback from customers is also a form of customer service, one where you show them you care about their experience!

CRM allows you to automate surveys and schedule follow ups to gather customer feedback about how you can improve your service for them.

With Databeys sales CRM, you can provide attentive customer support and increase your response time, hence improving your relationship with your customers and increasing customer satisfaction rate.

title: HOW TO MAKE SALESPEOPLE FALL IN LOVE WITH CRM?
text:
Salespeople and CRM are known to have a love-hate relationship. Businesses suffer because the salespeople don‚Äôt want to work with the CRM system, enter data, maintain records or simply want to learn how to use it. This can ultimately result in the failure of a business and financial loss. You don‚Äôt want that to happen to your business, do you? If your answer is no, then you need to figure out how to get your salespeople to love the CRM system and start using it to your brand‚Äôs advantage.

Salespeople and CRM system working together can create a strong customer base

Here are a few ways you can get your salespeople to fall in love with CRM

Teach them the importance of CRM

In order to fall in love with it, they need to understand it. Ultimately, you‚Äôre their boss. Help them understand what exactly CRM does and how it will be beneficial to them and not only to the business.

Provide Training

Once you have educated your salespeople about the importance of CRM, teach them how to use it. Arrange workshops or monthly training sessions to get them familiarized with software so they can start using it and save both your and their time.

Offer Incentives

Sales teams love incentives, and if you offer them incentives for accurate reports, clean records and successfully running campaigns using CRM, they will instantly fall in love with it and start using it more

With Databeys, you can easily manage your sales and run campaigns through CRM at the cost of one staff salary!

title: Get the best out of CRM with Google Integration
text:
Google services have increasingly become an essential part of everyday lives, be it for business or personal use. Multiple Google services such as Drive cloud storage, and synchronization of contacts and calendars across different platforms serve a key function in streamlining business activities.

Sync CRM and Google Services with GSync

CRM is a great sales automation tool used by businesses worldwide for simplification and visualization of their sales pipeline. It offers some useful features for daily sales activities, but one of the shortcomings for CRM platforms such as SugarCRM and SuiteCRM is their inability to streamline data across platforms.

Companies wanting to transfer data from a different platform will have to put in a significant amount of careful effort in simply populating their CRM with their previous data.

Each document is synced to its specific record‚Äôs folder on Drive, thus keeping the organizational aspect of Sugar intact.

With the help of RT GSync, this problem is taken care of. Companies who use Google services for streamlined functionality across platforms and devices can rest easy using CRMs, because RT GSync not only syncs your contacts and calendar from your Google account, it also syncs documents to and from your Drive, meaning you have access to all your material on the CRM platform. It seems like a no-brainer to have Google sync with CRM because in this mobile world, you can add contacts and useful notes on the go, and then have access to them when working on CRM.

Sync Calendars

It is important for any business to stay on top of the meetings and events that are scheduled with customers or leads, or otherwise. The calendars on Sugar as well as Suite are well designed to achieve the basic functionality of monitoring and creating events and schedules. RT GSync takes it up a notch by syncing the CRM calendar with your Google calendar which means you can stay updated on all events on the go via your mobile. You don‚Äôt have to work exclusively on the CRM, you can arrange a meeting at any time, and it will show up in the CRM when you log in.

Sync Contacts

Contacts are the most important asset of any sales team. Both Sugar and Suite provide a robust Contacts module that caters to your needs of storing all the vital information about a business contact be it an existing customer or a new lead. With RT GSync, not only are you able to sync contacts from CRM to Google, but any contacts you add on Google, will also sync directly to the CRM. You don‚Äôt have to worry about making sure your contacts are up to date between your phone and the CRM, because GSync is doing that for you.

Sync Documents

Documents serve an important purpose in the CRM system. Any kind of document, be it a contract, a proposal, or a report, can be stored alongside a contact to keep everything organized. With RT GSync, you can rest assured that each and every document that you upload to the CRM will be backed up to your Google Drive, ensuring that important data is not lost. One other neat feature is that each document is synced to its specific record‚Äôs folder on Drive, thus keeping the organizational aspect of Sugar intact.

How to get RT GSync

If you think your business can benefit from its features, you can get GSync for SugarCRM or for SuiteCRM. For assistance or any other queries, create a case on the store (Sugar or Suite). Otherwise you are welcome to contact support@rolustech.com. If you want to know more about our company and our other products, including customizable CRM solutions for different business needs, please visit the Rolustech website.

title: Why Are You Not Closing Enough Leads Despite Using SugarCRM?
text:
Your business may have a CRM put in place in order to visualise all aspects of the sales process, but what matters is how much you get out of it. If you are still not closing enough leads, you may need to look at the way you use CRM.

CRMs are all about pipelining the sales but SugarCRM‚Äôs default views and configurations struggle to provide helpful insights that prompt actual action; meaning oftentimes we end up using it merely as a contact directory. Looking at the list view of any module, say leads, you can‚Äôt figure out if a salesperson is overworked or if less valued opportunities are being given priority over the bigger ones. This is bound to happen when we don‚Äôt know what is being worked on in our sales department. The conventional layouts and useless reports in the default edition of CRM are to blame for all this.

Introducing Kanban Boards

Imagine a board with lanes, such that each lane represents a unique lead stage such as new, assigned, and in process. Now imagine a sticky note with a task written on it that you put in the lane representing the stage the task is in. That‚Äôs the idea of Kanban boards. With a Kanban board it is not only easy to see where everything is, but easy to shift it around so it is organized for maximum positive outcome. If any of the stages are clogged, you risk dropping the sales. With this insight, you now have the action-able information that can be used to avoid drop in sales. Simply divide the work better so every salesperson has enough to focus on without being overworked.

Break down your leads into columns with RT SugarBoards

Kanban gives a bird‚Äôs eye view of your sales pipeline. According to AllBusiness.com, ‚ÄùKanban Can Help Take the Stress Out of Sales‚Äù. Trello, which is based entirely on this concept, was acquired in 2017 for $425 million.

How do we use it in SugarCRM?

If you want your sales team to be more productive, close more leads, and drop fewer sales going forward, it‚Äôs a good idea to give Kanban boards on CRM a shot. For SugarCRM instances, RT SugarBoards offers what you need as a simple CRM plugin. It can convert every module of SugarCRM into boards like the one described above based on different criteria, which can be configured intuitively as per your preference.

SugarBoards offers more than just a categorized tile view of modules. It lets you perform actions from within the Kanban view, such as making a phone call, writing an email, or making notes and setting up a future meeting with a potential sale, all within a few clicks. It also allows you to see the details of the record, the existing status of a lead or sale and much more, without having to switch to and from each individual record‚Äôs detail view.

How SugarBoards can Help in Closing More Leads and Improving Business

Look at it this way, when you use Kanban boards instead of the default list view, you get more done in less time. By simply providing you more options on the main view, and by enabling simple drag and drop changes for assigning opportunities or qualifying a lead, whereby you can move a record in the pipeline much more quickly than you could without Kanban, Sugarboards allows your business to give more time to focus on each lead without being bogged down by the procedural issues of updating fields in CRM. All the technical details are taken care of, and the sales manager can focus on managing resources to get the best outcome for the company.

Getting RT SugarBoards for your CRM

If you are using SugarCRM in your business, simply get the RT Sugarboards plugin here, or contact support@rolustech.com if you want to know more.

title: What Is A CRM In Real Estate? | MYNPEC
text:
A Customer Relationship Management system is a software program used by businesses to manage customer contacts and interactions.

In the world of real estate, a CRM can be an invaluable tool for keeping track of your clients, their needs and wants, as well as past and potential transactions. Understanding what is a CRM in Real Estate for your business is important.

This will help you take it beyond what was possible before and make sure that everything runs smoothly in every aspect during this time.

The information in this article will show you how CRMs can make your business run smoother than ever before.

How Does CRM help Real Estate?

CRM software is designed to allow you to manage your real estate business from one platform, whether on the go or at the workplace.

The system stores all data in the cloud, making it easy for users across any device to keep track of leads and campaigns while staying up with the latest trends that will affect them as well.

You can expect features like managing contacts, easily uploaded documents & contracts, and calendar management tools.

CRM software has been proven to help real estate agents save time, increase productivity and personalize communications.

What does the CRM Software for real estate do?

The best CRM‚Äôs for real estate supports your real estate business in the following ways:

A great way to remember and organize all of your information, communications, and other details is by capturing them in one place

Centralize the way you manage your leads, buyers, and sellers. You can now link all of their profiles together with links to properties, so they are easier for everyone involved in real estate transactions

It can track marketing and interest in real estate sectors, property groups, or individual residential properties

Streamline buying, selling and rental processes with all parties interested and third-party stakeholders

Source: hubspot.net

Using a Property Management CRM by the real estate team:

Few of the central functions in a real estate businesses:

Realtors and real estate agents Administration teams Property and client marketing teams Sales and closing teams Customer service and support teams

1.Realtors and Real Estate Agents:

A CRM can help you be the public face of your property business. Realtors use it to:

The smart agent will know what information to share about their clients‚Äô property to be presented in the best possible light.

Get a clear picture of your potential buyers by learning about their needs, budgets, and preferences.

Remember to identify and build on previous interactions for specific properties, like the one you just visited or spoke with.

Closing rates are calculated by matching the right properties with people who need them. This maximizes profit and customer satisfaction, which means you‚Äôll be able to make more money.

2.Administration Teams:

The administrative team will use a CRM to keep track of all the important information, like:

Provide the latest real estate information to everyone to make informed decisions.

Be sure to follow the right real estate policies for setting appointments and interacting with clients. You‚Äôll also need a good grasp of managing properties through their process.

The metrics of your property business are important to keep an eye on. You should know what‚Äôs going on regarding leads, clients, and revenue.

3.Property and Client Marketing:

The marketing team will use a CRM to keep track of the below mentioned:

Find out which of your properties has the most potential for a successful marketing push.

The details must be clear and compelling. A professional voice is key in making these properties stand out from other homes, which will help them get into the front of qualified buyers quickly.

You can segment your audience into buyers, sellers, and renters to design effective marketing campaigns tailored specifically for each.

With marketing, it‚Äôs important to track the progress of your campaign so you can see when and where there are opportunities for improvement.

Helps in generating more leads for your realtors to grow their business.

Source : rehabfinancial.com

4.Real Estate Sales and Closing:

Closing the deal is a lot like getting ready for an important event. You need to gather all your info, manage it throughout and make sure everything goes well.

Communication with third parties is essential to providing the best customer experience. The company should work closely and creatively to create a unified transition for all those involved in this process.

It includes ensuring compliance with real estate law, contract signing and document management.

Representing your business and client‚Äôs best interests throughout any real estate transaction is important.

5.Customer Service and Support:

Give your customers the choice of contacting your firm in as many ways possible and create personalized best practices responses.

Keeping your clients informed throughout the process is essential.

Giving proper solutions for all the customer queries.

Dealing with issues and resolving them at the earliest.

Main Features of a Real Estate CRM:

CRMs are a necessary tool for any real estate agent. The right one can streamline your business and help you stay organized. Here‚Äôs are few important features in CRM systems:

1.Storing Property Information:

The CRM for real estate helps agents and brokers be more productive by providing information on properties in a concise, consistent way.

The user can filter through different criteria such as location or price range, allowing them to find the perfect match faster than ever before.

With this system, you‚Äôll never have an excuse not to show up when showing someone else‚Äôs home again because there is no need to search locally first ‚Äî everything has already been done right at your fingertips.

2.Storing Information about Interested Parties:

The modern real estate market is an established industry with strong connections to consumers and businesses.

Businesses thrive from connecting the right clients, who can be prospective customers or current homeowners looking for better options; while CRMs help you build a profile on each individual that will allow your maximum business success in capturing details about their needs, budgets, and other areas so they may find what‚Äôs required when searching through properties available today.

3.Managing Property Leads, Deals, and Sales:

With a CRM for real estate, you can manage and track the entire process from start to finish. You‚Äôll be able to gather leads with your marketing efforts as well as ensure that clients close in an effective way ‚Äî all while keeping up-to-date on what‚Äôs happening throughout each stage of this crucial business lifecycle.

4.Building Healthy Relationships and Communications:

When people make the biggest financial commitments of their lives, trust matters, a real estate CRM lets you manage all your client communications from one place so that no detail goes unnoticed and every team member has a clear picture for each interaction they have with clients or potential customers.

With this system in place, it‚Äôs easier than ever to tweak processes as needed until everything runs smoothly, ensuring high sales productivity levels, among other things.

5.Integrating with other systems, Stakeholders, and Third parties:

The real estate business can be intimidating and complex at times, but modern CRM systems put the process under control.

They integrate with software and information stored across multiple platforms to provide a central way for all stakeholders involved in buying or selling property to manage their relationships effectively ‚Äî from attorneys down through interested buyers.

The Cost of Real Estate CRM:

We all know that real estate can be quite expensive, and it‚Äôs important to make sure you‚Äôre getting your money‚Äôs worth.

When shopping around for CRM software, think about the features of each product or service before making any purchase decisions because they might not match up with everything else in terms of cost.

Main Takeaways for Real Estate CRM‚ÄôS:

CRM is the key to success in real estate. It builds your reputation, relationships, and business with clients by focusing all its attention on them.

A CRM is a great way to connect interested parties with the perfect property. As competition increases, you can make it easier for your potential customers and save time.

CRM will help you to track your successes and optimize real estate processes. You‚Äôll be able to see what works for an increased closing rate.

A CRM is like a bridge connecting your company with all its stakeholders. You‚Äôll see everything from one place and have the confidence that it‚Äôs running smoothly.

A CRM is an excellent way to streamline and maximize your company‚Äôs efficiency. It also increases revenue and profit for your company.

Conclusion:

CRM software in the real estate industry is a game-changer. It can help you target your prospects better by collecting more data on them and automating follow-up emails to always be in front of their buyers or sellers. Contact us at to find out how CRM can help you take your real estate business up a notch.

title: Important CRM Questions To Ask Before Buying It | MYNPEC
text:
CRM‚Äôs are an integral part of running a successful business, as it helps you connect with your current and prospective clients more effectively than ever before. They can improve marketing, sales, and customer service. But before you invest, there are some important questions to ask.

Source : hotelappz.com

What is CRM?

CRM software has gone beyond the traditional boundaries of sales to create deeper customer relationships.

Now, it is used to collect data from every interaction with your customers and turn that information into insights to provide better service than ever before.

Common CRM questions to consider before buying:

1.Is My Company Ready for CRM?

The decision to invest in a CRM should be made carefully. Company culture and technological skill levels are important considerations when choosing a CRM system. These factors will affect not only how employees perceive your company‚Äôs direction but also their productivity.

2.What is the difference between ERP and CRM?

ERP and CRM software can be very similar, as they both help your business become more efficient. However, each type has its unique approach to managing company data; this makes them different.

Marketing, sales, and customer service teams can use CRM software to manage customer relationships.

The goal is for more transactions at higher volumes of sales productively to generate leads or make purchases from your prospects regularly, which would then turn into long-term clients you‚Äôre billing monthly subscriptions.

The goal of ERP software is to make business operations more efficient and reduce costs. It‚Äôs typically used by finance, inventory, and procurement professionals who want a tool to help them with their day-to-day work.

What is Data Structure in CRM?

The world today is tech-driven. It is important to be very familiar with the concept of data structures.

A coder would likely give you a much more detailed definition. Still, from my perspective, your business relationships translate into the software.

Sometimes there are too many things to keep track. For example, insurance agencies have a thousand different relationships with their customers, managing all those details will be overwhelming.

A commercial account is just one example in an agency‚Äôs portfolio; they also need personal line clients and underwriters who may not even work at the same company, how do you get them organized? It seems impossible sometimes.

But luckily for these firms, we‚Äôve got CRMs that will take care of everything automatically, so your staff doesn‚Äôt miss anything important or forget any offers available out on the market today.

Grouping your data in a CRM is not as difficult or overwhelming once you know what to look for.

This article will give some idea about how best to group the different pieces of information and then provide an example structure that insurance agencies can use with commonalities between them.

Organize the contact details of each person.

Linking contacts to the respective organization

Tagging appropriate organization

For personal lines, implement a contact tagging structure (home, auto, life, etc.)

Configure Sales Pipelines and begin tracking opportunities

Implementing CRM can be daunting, but it is important to stay organized before starting.

What are the required CRM features?

There are innumerable CRM solutions in the market, each promising more advanced features than their competitors.

Although a jaw-dropping feature set can be invaluable to your company‚Äôs success in modern business trends-don‚Äôt overlook what you need the most.

The following is a list of the necessary CRM features that any company should have:

Contact, opportunity, and account management

Record linking tasks with reminders for each project or client in progress (to ensure completion)

Multi-user log-ins so you can manage your business‚Äôs online workspace as one centralized place through permissions settings like access rights between employees etc.,

Sales team member tracking- Who was working on what? What was their deadline?? There will never be any more confusion about who did this task when they return to duty after a break

Pipeline customization reporting gives real-time insights into how many customers are waiting at different points along our workflow process

It‚Äôs important to compare all plan levels when looking for a hosting company. Some may restrict features such as backup or provide limited bandwidth, which could make them inadequate in the long run and potentially cost you more money down the line with maintenance fees than necessary.

How to Import Existing Data in CRM?

The manual data entry process is time-consuming and tedious. With the right human resources, most companies will never put forth this effort to do it themselves, which means you may overlook something.

Most systems have a variety of import settings that will allow users easy access and flexibility when connecting with their contacts management system or CSV files; though before diving into this process, fully remember ‚Äî try loading small samples first.

Make sure to tag your data in case of a CSV import. This is because if you don‚Äôt, then hours‚Äô worth of labor will be spent on categorizing later down the road, and this time could‚Äôve been saved by doing it during stage one.

What is your required Integration in CRM?

Third-party integrations offer a great way for business requirements with diverse needs to connect their software platforms.

Initially, it might not seem to be such an advantage; most companies will find that these Add-ons provide more value as they continue integrating other applications and tools into the mix.

The importance of a CRM cannot be overstated. It will serve as the ‚Äúhub‚Äù for managing customer data and sales information and has other uses in some cases like project management or monitoring social media trends among employees.

By implementing this system correctly with automatic feedings from your team‚Äôs activities into it-you‚Äôll find significant efficiencies are achievable.

List of the best features to have in your CRM:

You can synchronize all email conversations into contact record histories

Importing quotes and proposals onto opportunity records

It integrates seamlessly with external document management sources

Sending new leads to your bulk email marketing systems

Mirroring tasks and events to smartphone calendars

Who Needs Access?

In addition to the benefits of accessibility, migrating your company‚Äôs sales information into a cloud service will also allow you more efficiency.

The main advantage is that users can simultaneously access important information from any web-enabled device.

The increased accessibility of your CRM means that you need to make decisions about who will access it, what privileges they have in the system, and whether assigning new leads.

An important feature to consider when looking into CRM plans is how much you‚Äôre spending per user. With a set number allocated for each employee, your costs will never increase unless you opt for more features.

Finally, it would be best to look at these questions from a data security perspective. Not all employees need administrative privileges to view sales records, and some companies restrict access only for those who have specific needs. Doing so can reduce risks associated with unwanted incidents.

What is the cost of a CRM?

Cloud-based customer relationship management solutions can cost a lot of money, especially when you factor in the monthly subscription fee.

Some vendors provide higher-priced packages with more features for those who sign up early versus what‚Äôs offered on lower-level plans; this could quickly add up.

The free CRM tools allow you to get a good idea of what they are capable of, but if your business has more than 100 employees or $500K in annual revenue, paid versions will work better.

Business owners should assess the TCO for CRM solutions and consider costs such as:

Total monthly or yearly subscription costs

One-time CRM implementation expenses

Data migration costs

Onboarding and training expenses

Customization and integration fees

Ongoing customer support charges

Volume discounts or fee reductions for annual payments

Make sure that you have all your queries covered before making a decision. There are many CRM features and benefits to consider, so take time for research that will let you get the most out of each CRM platform with its various layouts ‚Äî be it form-based or dashboard driven; easy integration options into existing systems like email campaigns (and more); limitless opportunities in terms of customization.

Conclusion:

The questions we‚Äôve outlined in this post should help you make a more informed decision about which CRM is best for your business. Reach out if we can help answer any of your remaining queries, and feel free to reach us back at anytime ‚Äî we‚Äôre always here.
