title: SingularityDAO: End of Year Update 2021
text:
Greetings Singularitarians,

Wow, what a year! As a team, we at SingularityDAO would like to take this opportunity to thank you for all your support during 2021 and wish you all a Happy New Year. It has been such an amazing year and we could not have done it without all of you. From those of you who have been with us since day one, to people who are just now discovering us, thank you for everything.

With 2021 drawing to a close it seemed like the perfect time to reflect on everything that has happened over the past 12 months and what a 12 months it has been!

What is SingularityDAO?

SingularityDAO is a DeFi Protocol designed to remove the stress, fear and hassle currently associated with Decentralized Finance and Cryptocurrency. Our team are at the forefront of DeFi 2.0 and are already pushing hard towards 3.0 ‚Äî The brain child of Ben Goertzel (CEO and Founder of SingularityNET) and Marcello Mari (CEO of SingularityDAO) SingularityDAO is taking the tools of traditional finance and rebuilding them for the blockchain. Using the Artificial Intelligence backbone that SingularityNET is building, we are creating advanced AI Algorithms capable of watching market sentiment, performing technical analysis, automatically rebalancing assets while also watching global economic events, politics, and many of factors to make well informed trading decisions in order to beat the market and generate profit. Our platform hosts a whole range of DeFi tools, but let‚Äôs begin by talking about our primary offering, non-custodial decentralized hedge funds, named DynaSets.

What are DynaSets?

A DynaSet is a dynamically managed set of assets. You can think of it somewhat like a basket of tokens automatically rebalanced by a combination of humans and AI, incredibly similar to a Hedge Fund in traditional finance.

For this example, let‚Äôs consider a DynaSet composed of USDC and BTC. If the indicators that our trading and AI team have set suggest to them that BTC is showing signs of a price increase, the trading team ‚ÄòDAM‚Äô (Dynamic Asset Manager) of Humans and/or Artificial Intelligences then exchanges USDC for BTC. They then wait for BTC to reach a target price point, before swapping it back into USDC thereby generating ‚ÄúAlpha‚Äù.

January to April

During these first few months of the year SingularityDAO was a team of just 5 people planning and making acquaintances. Marcello, Mario our CFO and Jerome, one of our lead Developers, along with Ben were busy brainstorming what has now become the SingularityDAO Platform and all things included.

While Jerome was hard at work laying the foundations for all that has since then been built and making sure we had a project to launch, Marcello and Mario were racing around meeting potential investors and partners to ensure that the launch happened.

May

All the hard work of the previous few months came to fruition in May when we held our Governance Generation Event and the SDAO token was released into the world. At that same time we began to Airdrop 5% of our total supply to SingularityNET‚Äôs AGIX holding community.

For a team of only 5 people it was a massive achievement to do all this, but also incredibly hard work so hiring went into overdrive and the team started to grow.

Around this time SingularityDAO also won ‚ÄúDeFi Project of the Year‚Äù at AIBC (Artificial Intelligence Blockchain Conference) in Dubai.

June

With our team expanding rapidly we were able to move forward with creation of the SingularityDAO Platform and in June invited volunteers from our community to beta test the platform.

A massive shout out to all our community beta testers for such helpful and well considered feedback regarding the platform beta and many more things since.

July

Beta testing was under way, the development team was hard at work preparing the platform and our CEO Marcello Mari was being interviewed by CNN! After only 3 months since the project launched we were featured in not one but two CNN pieces airing on global TV.

Alongside this we were fortunate enough to have caught the attention of Gate.io who decided to list the SDAO token on their platform and of course while all of this was going on, we were still hiring!

August

August was a huge month for us, it marked the end of our Airdrop which saw the last of 5 million SDAO tokens distributed to AGIX holders.

We launched the open beta of the SingularityDAO platform, which you are all currently using to swap, provide liquidity, yield farm, stake SDAO, stake NuNet and even watch your DynaSets trade!

Not only that but August was the month that Chris Poulin our CTO officially joined the team and all of this was topped off with an announcement of a partnership with NuNet.

September

Bonded Staking began in September and our TVL sky rocketed to over 50% of our circulating supply being locked within our platform. Since then it has never dropped below that number.

Thanks again to everyone for showing such confidence in what we are doing and supporting it from day 1.

Alongside the launch of Epoch 1 and Bonded Staking, we of course continued development and hiring. By this point that team of 5 from the start of the year was closer to 35!

October

October was a special month for the SingularityDAO team, almost every single team member made the trip from all corners of the world to meet up in France for 5 days. What was previously a group of strangers working on a DeFi project became a group of friends and colleagues working collaboratively to make a shared dream come to life. Work was done, presentations were made, projects were planned, workshops were held, food was eaten and wine was drunk! A true team was formed.

Of course that‚Äôs not all, we began our relationship with Hacken who now handle all of security and audits and have truly been a wonderful partner to us.

Epoch 1 also rolled over in Epoch 2 at this time and even more people placed their trust in SingularityDAO and staked their tokens.

November

Another special month, this time for both SingularityDAO and the SingularityNET Ecosystem as a whole. NuNet was launched from our freshly released Launchpad. 2 million dollars was contributed in just 90 seconds.

What an amazing result and with that, NuNet, the second spin-off and third member of the Ecosystem was born.

We didn‚Äôt stop there though, we also launched the SDAO token on Binance Smart Chain and opened SDAO/BNB and SDAO/BUSD pools on Pancake Swap.

December

It probably won‚Äôt surprise you to hear that December was a special month for SingularityDAO, the truth is, every month in 2021 was special for one reason or another, we have been truly blessed to have such a great project, team and community.

December really was extra special though and ended the year with a bang! We opened the month with our Advent Calendar and invited the whole community to apply to join the beta test of DynaSets. We onboarded a few very special influencers too, some of which have already begun putting out content with much more to follow.

We launched staking, yield farming and our own bridge for Binance Smart Chain. The DynaSet beta began with the launch of dynSING (SDAO/NTX/AGIX/USDC), dynBTC (BTC/USDC) and dynETH (ETH/USDC) and around 3 million dollars was contributed to aid in the testing. Once again thank you all for placing such faith in the products we are developing.

December really was a busy month though, because not only did we announce a partnership with SoftServe to assist us in refining and strengthening our platform ready for deep AI integration in the New Year, we also won the PancakeSwap auction which enabled people to stake SDAO and earn CAKE.

This barely scrapes the surface of all that happened in December, so let‚Äôs close this off with a quick list of cool reveals:

Closing thoughts from Marcello Mari, SingularityDAO CEO

2021 has been one of the most incredible years for me personally and professionally as a founder bringing to life the initial vision of SingularityDAO as imagined by Ben Goertzel and myself in the fall of 2020.

We achieved so much especially thanks to an outstanding team of talents that have joined the initial team of founders and, of course, you, our community!

A special thanks also goes to the SingularityNET Foundation for the consistent and ongoing support in all that we do.

Without all of you this would have not been possible.

With this in mind we look forward to 2022, the year in which we‚Äôll build and launch more DynaSets and more products. We‚Äôll build and train more machine learning, sign new partnerships, hire more people and bring SingularityDAO to the success it deserves!

Ad Astra, Per Aspera!

title: $Super explained ‚Äî The PaymentSplitter
text:
Super is a scam. Do not invest.

In a previous story I introduced you to the contract code of $Super, a relatively new contract on the binance smart chain. Today i want to have a look at the PaymentSplitter contract within the super contract.

Recap

$Super is a relatively new contract on the binance smart chain. It was created 14th December 2021. A first introduction into $Super can be found here and here. Be aware, especially the second story has the typical crypto marketing speech (‚Äúhidden gem‚Äù, ‚Äúgame-changing‚Äù, successive questions, ‚Ä¶), but I refer them nevertheless because you will not find $super like other defi projects in every other story.

So, you got first impressions, let us now go straight to the contract and have a look at the code. You can find the token here and the corresponding contract here. I will give a overview over the contract code in this story and will maybe dig deeper within a follow up story.

What does the PaymentSplitter do?

The PaymentSplitter is a contract which pays out the balance of the contract or token balance of the contract to defined payees depending on their internally managed shares.

Currently, the $Super token contracts is holder of 237.645459642783184903 BNB (At the moment $124,248.18 (@ $522.83/BNB), 30 December 2021).

At creation time 2 payees (payee zero and payee one) where defined. Each of them are holding 50 shares (total shares are 100). No payee received any payment yet. Payee zero is also the address of the distribution pool and its balance is 153.975 BNB ($80,296.40 (@ $521.49/BNB), 30 December 2021). Until a few days ago this adress received its BNB from the super contract itself. Now it receives it from the 2 contracts you approve within the super web application (Heroes tier and villians tier) to create nodes.

The values are stored in BNB (Not in $Super). So, the developers have made $204,927.18 ($80,296.40 + $124,630.78) within 2 weeks which is a nice revenue. I guess I should playing with the idea to create a similar contract by myself. By the way, there is also a futurUsePool (sic!) with around 42.14 BNB ($21,886.94 (@ $519.36/BNB), 30.12.2021).

Should the developers ‚Äî if they are scammers ‚Äî withdraw it?

Simple no. It is stored in BNB and therefore it does not depends on the value of the token itself. If they withdraw it, user could get anxious. Just doing nothing is the best options for scammers. Once super does not earn any money anymore, they can come and get it.

Should the developers ‚Äî if they are not scammers ‚Äî withdraw it?

Maybe. But they have to communicate. They need to explain to its users what this money is for and what are they planning to do with it. In my opinion they have to find a valid use case for $Super. At the moment it is just a stock market game with one stock and extra rules. With no valid use case and if the developers are not scammers themself it stays a scam for every user who is not net positive ‚Äî for every new user or for a user who bought in high. Until then, the net positve users are stealing the new ones merciless (especially if they advertise it)

How does the PaymentSplitter work?

So, you know already the developers have made around $200,000 within a little bit more than 2 weeks. Just out of curiosity lets have finally a look at the contract.

The code of the PaymentSplitter is from OpenZeppelin Contracts v4.3.2

The contract PaymentSplitter extends from the contract Context, which just provides the basic functions _msgSender and _msgData to access msg.sender and msg.data indirectly.

On creation (which happened during the creation of the Super contract) it receives payees and its corresponding shares calls the private function _addPayee which adds the payee with its share to the contract.

There are a few public read functions to get information about the total shares and total released, about the payees, and to get the shares and the released of a specific account (payee) and the coin BNB or a specific token.

The central write function is release, which sends BNB or a any other token to the provided address, if it is a payee. This function is not protected by any modifier to protect it from a call which is not the payee itself or the owner. Anyone can execute it (But it gets payed to one of the payee, not to your own address). By the developers of OpenZeppelin it is marked as virtual, so it can (and in my opinion should) be overwritten to by the inheriting contract to protect it from misuse. I do not think that the payees wants that anyone can trigger the release of the contract balance or the tokens within the contract.

Next Time

Next time I will have a look at the $Super contract itself and the contract NODERewardManagement.

Until then,

all the best to you.

Philipp

title: Distribution of your coin (part 2)
text:
So you‚Äôve made your own cryptocurrency and created a faucet that gives a small amount of currency to anyone who claims it. Let‚Äôs give people an opportunity to buy larger quantities of your coin.

Can‚Äôt read the full article? Become a member of Medium here

There are many ways to let others purchase your coin, the easiest way is to simply put it up for sale at a DEX such as PancakeSwap. The downside with using a DEX service is that you have to put in as much liquidity as the total sum of all the coins you wish to sell.

For example, lets assume you wish to sell 10 000 of your coins and you set the price at 0.001 BNB per coin. You will have to list the 10 000 of your coins together with 10 000 x 0.001 BNB in order to activate trading. That means you have to lock 10 BNB (roughly $5500 USD at the time of writing this), and you might not have that amount of money at the time.

Instead you can write a smart contract which allows people to purchase your coin directly from the contract itself. Contracts like these are often called crowdsale contract or selfdrop contract.

I‚Äôm not going to write all of the code here, but you can find it at github: https://github.com/Creepybits/BEP-20-contracts/blob/Master/selfdrop.sol

Open Remix and create a new file called selfdrop.sol. Copy the code from github, paste it in Remix and compile.

At the deploy screen chose ‚Äúinjected web3‚Äù, rate (price of the coin), wallet (the address of the wallet that you wish the BNB/ETH recieved from the sale should be sent to) and the contract address of your coin. Also make sure that the contract you are deploying is the correct one.

When you are happy with the settings, press ‚Äútransact‚Äù and confirm in Metamask. You will get some confirmation info at the bottom of the screen. Copy the hash and paste it in the blockchain explorer you used to deploy the contract.

When you check your contract and wish to verify it, as explained in previous posts, you will get a message saying that you need to change the constructor values.

The correct numbers will be found when you check the transaction of the deployment of the contract. Copy those numbers and replace the ones in the verifyingprocess.

After this there shouldn‚Äôt be a problem to verify the contract.

Now you have to transfer the coins you wish to sell to the contract. I sent 10 000 ZannoMoney that I wish to sell to the contract.

Next up we will try to buy some coins by sending BNB to the contract.

I sent 0.1 BNB from another address that I use for testing, and the contract sent me back 1000 ZannoMoney (ZMO) as well as forwarding the 0.1 BNB to the address I specified when deploying the contract.

The ‚ÄúRate‚Äù you put in when deploying the contract decides at which price people can buy your coin. A rate of 10000 means that one of your coin will cost 0.0001 BNB (or ETH if you deploy it at Ethereum blockchain).

Now you have created a cryptocurremcy of your own, written a faucet contract as a way of distribution and finally written a contract for crowdselling your coin.

I hope you have enjoyed these guides!

title: $100 to $5.5mil in 4 Years ‚Äî A Complete Beginners Guide to Crypto
text:
If it shows you only Fiat currencies and not crypto, select Withdraw Crypto on the right hand side. You can now select BNB as the coin you want to transfer, and then enter your address. Note that I can not enter the address directly (as shown below) as I have security settings to only allow whitelisted addresses from my address book. I recommend you enable this (via Binance account security settings) as it prevents someone who gains access to your account from easily withdrawing your money.

Withdrawing Crypto to Binance Smart Chain

After you enter your MetaMask BSC address (that we copied from MetaMask) the page will then it will realise it is a BSC address and Binance will ask you a couple of questions. It is important to note that:

Yes, the MetaMask address you have copied from MetaMask does support the Binance Smart Chain (as long as you followed the add BSC to MetaMask instructions above)

the MetaMask address you have copied from MetaMask does support the Binance Smart Chain (as long as you followed the add BSC to MetaMask instructions above) If you enter the wrong address your money will be lost. This goes for much in the cryptocurrency space, always check the address and network before committing to any transfer.

This goes for much in the cryptocurrency space, always check the address and network before committing to any transfer. Binance Smart Chain uses the BEP20 token standard, you don‚Äôt yet need to know what this means technically except that it is not directly compatible with other networks such as Ethereum ‚Äî hence the above warnings about the wrong network.

If you answer the above questions correctly, then Binance will allow you to transfer the funds. Enter your desired amount in the Withdraw Amount box (note that this is in BNB, not your native Fiat currency ‚Äî if you just want to transfer what you converted earlier, then select max). Depending on your security settings you may be asked some confirmation codes, I have two-factor authentication, and email codes turned on so I have to enter these every time I transfer ‚Äî it is annoying, but think of how much more annoying it is for someone trying to steal your money.

You can track the progress of the transfer, and once it appears in your MetaMask wallet you are ready to proceed to the next phase. You can see in my screenshot below I now have the 0.28 BNB (approx $200 AUD) that we began with but in our crypto DeFi wallet.

BNB in MetaMask Ready to DeFi

Gas Fees

You will see and hear the term gas fees, while the background behind these can be complex depending on the network protocol in use you can simply think of them as bank transfer fees. Any time you move crypto around you need to pay a transfer fee, and the fee currency for BSC is the BNB coin ‚Äî hence we used our initial transfer as BNB so we had gas fees immediately. If you happened to use another currency or an exchange that did not support BNB then you will not have any BNB to cover gas to accomplish anything. The crypto world did think of this and provides faucets which you can get a tiny amount of the relevant gas currency for free to get you started. The BNB faucet is at this link, note that you can only use this function every 24hrs, so make sure your first transfer is into more BNB, if you need to transfer between currencies use pancakeswap.finance, they are the primary exchange on BSC.

Binance Smart Chain Faucet

Phase 4 ‚Äî Dripping Crypto

Now that you are ready to explore the world of DeFi, it can become easy to forget where you put money (yep, I‚Äôm serious) and also to find your way onto scam or poorly run sites. I recommend Apeboard.finance to track your accounts, but also I tend to use sites that are on their protocol list as they have at least seen some moderate trading volume and have some level of legitimacy. When you enter their site you can input your MetaMask address and then it will search the public blockchains and tell you what currencies you have (as shown below, with their Christmas theme active, note the AUD amount varies slightly based on currency rate changes between the screenshots ‚Äî change the currency to your native currency in their settings).

Apeboard.finance ‚Äî DeFi Dashboard showing our Example $200 AUD

We are about to get into investing our crypto, it is important to note that the demonstrated investment I provide below is just and example of what is possible in DeFi; you can do other amazing things such as coin farming or invest in stablecoins at interest rates like 20% per year (think of how that compares to your normal bank account). You are obviously free to jump into the deep end and find further opportunities, and again what I provide here is not financial advice, its just a guide. I recommend sticking to the Binance Smart Chain initially, as Ethereum gas fees are ridiculous at the moment. There are also many other networks to explore (which can be seen in the above screenshot), but that is well outside the scope of this article.

Drip Network

The recommended example is the Drip Network which is a project offering a 1% return on investments, daily, up to a maximum of 365%. The details behind Drip are detailed in their whitepaper, but I will attempt to cover the highlights here.

Drip utilises what is referred to as tokenomics, which means that the developer has aimed to design factors into the token to ensure longevity and price stability based on their token goals. While the tokenomics term does get thrown around a bit in the DeFi space it at least indicates an attempt to maintain the project as a long term investment.

In the case of Drip, the tokenomics include a 10% tax on every transaction, and these funds are fed into the Drip contract (think Drip money bucket) to pay investors. The caveat here is that if you compound your investment (or hydrate in drip terminology) then there is only a 5% fee.

What the Drip tokenomics does is embrace the power of compound interest, and in the absence of fancy calculations and diagrams I present this link to a fantastic Drip Calculator by Kelly Snook, who also has an excellent article on the details behind Drip strategy which I highly recommend to select your preferred strategy. This compound interest calculating is where this article headline comes from, by entering 1 wallet with 1 drip (current price approx $100 AUD), then we get $5.5 million dollars in 4 years and more if the price of drip increases. That is the power of daily compound interest.

Note I only put $100 in so we have spare BNB for future transaction gas fees, and if you run low in the future, sell some drip into BNB which we will detail soon. The amount you enter into your Drip initially does not significantly affect the amount you earn overall, it just means if you put in more you get more out sooner.

Example Drip Calculation for 1 Drip wallet with 1 Drip

Now, it is important to mention that some people consider Drip to be a ponzi scheme since you need to be invited to join the network. Dr. Chris does a great job at dispelling this concern in this article and while Drip is not without risk, it is indeed (at least in my experience) well worth the investment. Additionally, the liquidity of Drip is being supported by The Manor Farm, a project created by Drip‚Äôs founder, which is further supporting the Drip ecosystem.

Depositing Drip

We now have the what covered so lets move on to the how; using the browser you have MetaMask installed go to the Drip website, and select Swap at the top of the page and then Connect Wallet at the top right corner.

title: Create Your Own Mintable Token
text:
Besides making a regular coin as we went through in an earlier post, there‚Äôs also the possibility to create a coin which doesn‚Äôt have a set supply. A mintable token is just a token that you can create more of, either as the owner of the contract or in an automated manner.

Can‚Äôt read the full article? Become a member of Medium here

The coin we are creating is going to be mintable by the person or the persons who have been assigned the minter role. The contract will leave the ownership to whichever address deploys it, and from there the owner can assign or revoke minter roles to other people.

As usual, you can copy the code directly from github.

At the deployment screen insert the name, symbol and initial supply for the token (remember that we have 18 decimals, so you need to put in your supply followed by 18 zeros). When you are satisfied, press ‚Äútransact‚Äù and confirm in metamask.

Check the bottom of the screen for information related to the deployment, copy the hash and search for it in whichever blockchain you deployed the contract on.

When you check the contract in the blockchain explorer, you will once again have to verify the contract before you can interact with it. Press ‚Äúverify and publish‚Äù.

The verification of the contract works as with the previous contracts. Put the correct compiler and license information when promted, and at the next page paste the source code in the designated area and finally copy the highlighted code and paste it in the field for constructor argument.

If you did everything correctly the contract will be verified and you can connect your metamask. Once you have connected with metamask (using the same address as you deployed the contract with), you have the option to add more minters.

This new minter (as well as the owner) can now create coins which will be sent to the specified address. And again, you have to add as many zeros as there is decimals. So when I mint 10 000 coins to an address, I have to write ‚Äú10000000000000000000000‚Äù for it to be correct.

Once you have minted coins, the coin and its ticker will show up at the contract address.

Link to the verified and published contract: https://testnet.bscscan.com/address/0x4a99e4bf10a483bc642260bb1952d97fcabb0159#code

That‚Äôs it! Now you have created a coin with unlimited supply.

title: RisingSun Is Becoming Samurai Legends!
text:
RisingSun ($RSUN) launched in July 2021 as a community-focused buyback token. Since then, we‚Äôve grown tremendously as a project and a community. The release of Samurai Rising and Samurai Lands cemented our transformation into a fully-fledged GameFi ecosystem. We‚Äôve had our ups and downs, yet have loved every moment and can‚Äôt wait for what the future holds.

To come through on our December promise to take our project to the next level, we‚Äôre relaunching as Samurai Legends! Crypto Gaming United (CGU) has recently committed to onboarding 25,000 players and funding our project significantly! We believe this fresh image and significant backing will bring us to new heights. None of our products or goals are going anywhere, and neither are we.

It‚Äôs easy to forget that $RSUN didn‚Äôt launch as a play-to-earn token. As a result, $RSUN‚Äôs current tokenomics pose significant risks and challenges for the sustainability of our ecosystem. For example, most GameFi projects launch with approximately 50% of the supply allocated to rewards, while RisingSun launched with 0%. For this reason, we‚Äôre migrating $RSUN to a new primary token called Samurai Legends ($SMG). This migration ensures that our project can support a massive player base and thrive for years to come.

You can deposit your $RSUN and $INF tokens to withdraw $SMG later via the migration dashboard: https://migrate.risingsun.finance/

We‚Äôve planned the migration for weeks to prepare for a smooth and successful transition. Exchange rates have been fixed at 1 $SMG for 100 $RSUN and 1 $SMG for 12.5 $INF (8 $RSUN =1 $INF). It is no longer be possible to buy or sell $RSUN. Migration will remain possible at any time.

January will see an extensive marketing campaign for the launch of Samurai Legends. In late January, we will launch on multiple IDOs with full backing from CGU. It is worth reiterating that we truly believe this relaunch will take our project to new heights. We want to thank everyone who stuck with us and believed in us as a team. We can‚Äôt wait for the good times ahead! Please refer to the FAQ below for any unanswered questions.

Frequently Asked Questions

What happens to my $RSUN and $INF tokens?

You can deposit your $RSUN and $INF in the migration dashboard. When Samurai Legends launches, you will receive $SMG equivalent to your deposited amount +10%. The USD value of 1 $SMG will be determined when $RSUN buys are blocked. Thus, your $RSUN value will be set at that time +10%.

Are my tokens ($RSUN, $INF) and NFTs safe?

Yes. All assets will retain their value throughout the migration process. $RSUN and $INF are the only assets that require user attention via the migration dashboard.

How do I receive my $SMG tokens?

You can receive your $SMG tokens using the migration dashboard. $SMG has a vesting period of 1 month, with more tokens becoming available to claim every hour. This means that you will be able to claim your total amount one month after relaunch.

Why are $RSUN buys & sells blocked?

We have blocked $RSUN buys & sells to avoid confusion and ensure the best relaunch possible.

Can I still earn $INF playing SamuraiRising?

Yes, although the ability to swap $INF to $RSUN will be disabled. This means that players cannot cash out $INF from December 31st until the launch of Samurai Legends. $INF earnings can be deposited in the migration dashboard to receive $SMG at any time.

Can I still purchase land NFTs and recruit samurai?

Yes. We will temporarily remove the $RSUN cost for land NFTs and samurai recruitment. The additional costs will be temporarily increased to account for the removed $RSUN.

What happens to my staked $RSUN/$INF tokens?

$RSUN energy staking and $INF reward multiplier staking have its one-week withdrawal period set to 0. $RSUN solo staking cannot be unlocked until the original period ends but can be swapped for $SMG once unlocked on the migration dashboard.

Can I still earn while waiting for the relaunch?

Yes. You can still play SamuraiRising and earn $INF during the relaunch process.

What does this mean for managers and scholars?

Samurai Rising players won‚Äôt be able to sell their $INF earnings from December 31st until the Samurai Legends relaunch in late January. Instead, players can deposit their earnings into the migration dashboard and receive $SMG tokens. See this article for full instructions for managers.

When is the relaunch?

We are aiming to relaunch at the end of January on multiple IDOs. Stay tuned for more information on how to participate in the pre-sale.

What are the tokenomics for $SMG?

You can read a complete overview of $SMG‚Äôs tokenomics and distribution here.

What will happen to NFT reflections for generals?

With no buy or sell taxes, generals will lose $BUSD reflections. Instead, we‚Äôre committing to making generals a prominent part of Samurai Lands. They‚Äôll receive a significant bump in governance voting power in the short term.

Will Samurai Legends have a dual-token economy?

Yes. Like RisingSun, Samurai Legends will have a dual-token economy with $SMG and a new side token called $KOKU. It will launch alongside $SMG and will be revealed in future posts.

Is the project staying on Binance Smart Chain?

Yes. We have considered different chains but believe that GameFi projects have a bright future ahead on Binance Smart Chain.

What will happen to BananaKatana?

BananaKatana will remain playable, but rewards have ceased from today onward.

Will the roadmap change?

With the additional backing that this relaunch brings, we can fully commit to our ideal roadmap and double down on our goal to become a mainstay of the GameFi space.

Wen special crates?

We‚Äôve heard your cries! Special crate unboxing will be our top priority after a successful relaunch. In the meantime, special crates will contribute to energy as a tier 1 samurai card.

title: Danny Bibi of AdMedia Discusses Contextual Targeting Advertising
text:
Danny Bibi, head of AdMedia of Los Angeles, California, believes relevant advertising is important for business owners. It can be difficult to reach your target audience with the correct message, so contextual targeting advertising helps provide relevant ads specifically designed for you and your customers‚Äô needs.

Contextual targeting advertising allows advertisers to use data about an individual. Things like location, browsing habits, and other factors provide them with more targeted advertisements than ever before. The result? Relevant ads that are better suited for the customer instead of generic ones.

Contextual Targeting Advertising is a form of internet advertising that targets ads based on viewed content. It works by identifying the website someone is viewing and matching it to an advertiser who wants their ad displayed there. This type of advertising has grown in popularity because it provides relevant ads for consumers, which increases the effectiveness of advertisements.

Contextual targeting provides advertisers with more accurate data about their target market to reach out to them more effectively. The information gathered from contextual targeting also helps marketers learn what products or services are most popular among their customers to cater to future campaigns better to suit consumer tastes. Contextual targeting also allows advertisers to show ads before consumers even click on a link or visit a new website.

How does Contextual Technology Work

Contextual targeting technology is used to match ads with the content of a web page. It works by identifying the website someone is viewing and then looking for keywords or phrases related to an advertiser‚Äôs products or services. Once a match is found, the advertiser‚Äôs ad will be displayed on the relevant web page.

Danny Bibi, head of AdMedia, believes that contextual targeting has grown in popularity because it allows advertisers to place their ads in front of people interested in what they have to offer. It also helps ensure that ads are relevant to consumers‚Äô views online, increasing their effectiveness. Additionally, contextual targeting allows marketers to collect data about their target market to understand better what types of products or services interest them.

What Types of Data Does Conceptual Technology Look At

Contextual targeting uses data about an individual‚Äôs location, browsing habits, and other factors to provide them with relevant advertisements. It collects information like IP addresses, geographical locations, browser history, images, text, and audio to piece together a general idea of the most relevant ads for the consumer. Danny Bibi believes that this allows advertisers to create better-targeted campaigns that are more likely to generate interest among their target audience. Consumers often welcome relevant ads because they are tailored specifically for them; this makes contextual advertising effective overall.

What is Customer Match

Customer match is one of the many features marketers use to get the most out of their contextual targeting campaign. It allows businesses to upload a customer email list to target these individuals with relevant ads. With Customer Match, companies like AdMedia can upload lists of emails or phone numbers so you can target your ad to people who have already purchased with you.

Customer match is a valuable tool because it allows you to target people who are already interested in your product or service. It also helps build customer loyalty, as they are more likely to be receptive to your ads because they have already bought from you before.

How Does Contextual Targeting Advertising Help Provide Relevant Ads

Contextual targeting advertising helps provide relevant ads by using data about an individual‚Äôs location, browsing habits, and other factors. It collects information like IP addresses, geographical locations, browser history, images, text, and audio to piece together a general idea of the most relevant ads for the consumer. This allows advertisers to create better-targeted campaigns that are more likely to generate interest among their target audience. Consumers often welcome relevant ads because they are tailored specifically for them; this makes contextual advertising effective overall.

Customer match is one of the many features marketers use to get the most out of their contextual targeting campaign. With Customer Match, you can upload lists of emails or phone numbers so you can target your ad to people who have already purchased with you. If someone on your list makes an online search that matches one of the keywords or phrases you‚Äôve identified, they will be more likely to see your ad.

Contextual targeting also allows advertisers to show ads before consumers even click on a link or visit a new website. This helps ensure that ads are relevant to what consumers view online, increasing their effectiveness. Additionally, contextual targeting allows marketers to collect data about their target market to understand better what types of products or services interest them.

Final Thoughts

Using the features provided by the contextual advertising system, marketers can make a relevant ad much more likely to be seen and clicked. By collecting data about an individual‚Äôs location, browsing habits, and other factors, advertisers can create better-targeted campaigns that reach people interested in what they have to offer. This increases their potential for success as well as their return on investment.

title: Danny Bibi, Head of AdMedia, Discusses Contextual Targeting Advertising
text:
Most companies have data that they don‚Äôt use effectively. Danny Bibi of AdMedia in Los Angeles, California, believes that businesses are so focused on productivity, efficiency, and profit margins that they forget to invest in relationships with their customers.

This is a mistake for many reasons: you can‚Äôt grow your customer base or increase sales without this investment. It also means you are missing out on the opportunity to create lasting impressions of your brand through targeted offers and personalized messages sent at just the right time.

These investments bring in more revenue and keep customers coming

back again and again because they feel appreciated by your business. Contextual technology offers a solution to these issues by making it easier than ever before for businesses to communicate with their clients using personalized content delivered when and where it‚Äôs most relevant.

What is Contextual Technology

Contextual technology is a term used to describe the various methods of collecting and analyzing data to determine the most relevant context for delivering content or messaging. This can be done in several ways, but the goal is always to present information useful and engaging for the customer. Danny Bibi of AdMedia feels that if you know that a customer has just viewed a product on your website, AdMedia might send them an offer for that product or a related item as they leave your site.

Advantages

Danny Bibi of AdMedia believes that one of the biggest advantages of contextual technology is that businesses can target customers based on their location. This means you can send them messages when they are near your store, for example, or when they are looking for a specific product. It also makes it possible to personalize messages based on customer preferences, which helps to create a better customer experience.

Businesses can also use contextual technology to track customer behavior to make more informed decisions about what content to present. This helps businesses understand how customers interact with their brand and what content will likely result in a sale.

What Can Contextual Technology Be Used For

Businesses can use contextual technology in nearly every industry. For example, suppose you own a restaurant. In that case, you might use contextual technology to send someone who has viewed your menu on their mobile device an offer for a free appetizer when they visit your restaurant during off-peak hours. If you run a hotel, this type of technology might let you send someone who views the rates page on your website an offer for a lower price.

Contextual technology also provides B2B interactions, partnerships, and consumer interactions. You could use it to work with partners or clients who share similar client bases to create targeted promotions and maximize revenue.

Danny Bibi, head of AdMedia, feels that companies can use contextual technology to improve customer relationships. Ultimately, the goal is to create an immersive customer experience that results in more sales and a better reputation for your business.

Contextual Advertising

Contextual Targeting Advertising is a form of online advertising that uses contextual data to target ads specifically to that user. It is a type of targeted advertising, online advertising that allows advertisers to target their ads to specific users.

The purpose of contextual targeting advertising is to place relevant ads in front of the right people at the right time. For example, if you are a business that sells cars, you might use contextual advertising to show ads for your cars to people who have recently visited automotive websites.

The way contextual targeting advertising works is by using the contextual data of the user to decide which ads to show them. This data can come from many sources, such as the user‚Äôs location, interests, or activities.

Contextual targeting advertising is often used in combination with targeted advertising. Together, they make up a form of online advertising known as programmatic advertising.

How Does Contextual Advertising Work?

Contextual advertising works by using the contextual data of the user to target ads specifically to that user. It is a type of targeted advertising, online advertising that allows advertisers to target their ads to specific users.

The purpose of contextual advertising is to place relevant ads in front of the right people at the right time. For example, if you are a business that sells cars, AdMedia might use contextual advertising to show ads for your cars to people who have recently visited automotive websites.

The way contextual advertising works is by using the contextual data of the user to decide which ads to show them. This data can come from several sources, such as the user‚Äôs location, interests, or activities.

Final Thoughts

Contextual technology is a powerful tool businesses can use to improve customer relationships. It provides opportunities for businesses to create targeted promotions and maximize revenue. Contextual advertising is a form of online advertising that uses the contextual data of the user to target ads specifically to that user. Together, they make up a form of online advertising known as programmatic advertising.

If you are looking for ways to improve your customer relationships, contextual technology, and contextual advertising may be the answer. These technologies allow businesses to target their ads to specific groups of users and place relevant ads in front of the right people at the right time. If you are not currently using these technologies, it is worth considering how they could benefit your business.

title: Danny Bibi, AdMedia CEO, Discusses How Contextual Targeting Advertising Works
text:
At its core, contextual targeting matches things that are not explicitly stated to things that are. Using an example of ‚Äúshoes,‚Äù the outside viewer would see it as something people put on their feet. Danny Bibi, head of AdMedia of Los Angeles, California, understands that they might even assume there‚Äôs some additional context, like the color of the shoes or for whom they‚Äôre being bought.

But how do computers know so much? Well, it‚Äôs quite simple. You start with a word cloud of all the words associated with your business and then use statistical analysis to determine which ones are most likely to appear together in writing about your products or services. For example, if your company sells clothes, shoes might show up in informative articles about fashion trends along with other words like purses and makeup. It doesn‚Äôt stop there, though. Contextual targeting goes a step further to discover how these words are used together.

For example, if someone is interested in fashion, you want to find them wherever they‚Äôre looking for it online. They might be reading an article about the latest trends or watching a tutorial on applying different types of makeup. Either way, your ad could appear next to that content because the algorithms know this person is interested in fashion and makeup by matching their search or web history with patterns based on existing clients‚Äô interests.

What is Contextual Targeting Advertising

Danny Bibi understands that contextual targeting advertising is a form of online advertising that uses information about what a person is doing on the web to show them ads for products and services relevant to their current activity.

Contextual Targeting Vs. Behavioral Targeting

There‚Äôs a big difference between contextual targeting advertising and behavioral targeting. Behavioral targeting is all about tracking what people have done in the past to create targeted ads in the present. For example, if you‚Äôve recently visited a website about cars, you might start seeing car ads everywhere you go online. On the other hand, contextual targeting looks at what people are doing to show them related ads.

So which is better? Danny Bibi, head of AdMedia, believes that the answer is both! Contextual targeting advertising is great for showing people ads for products they might be interested in based on their current activity. Behavioral targeting is great for reminding people about products they‚Äôve shown an interest in before. Together, they can create powerful advertising that reaches more consumers and drives more conversions.

How does Contextual Targeting work?

Contextual targeting works by analyzing all the words associated with a business and then determining which ones are most likely to appear together in writing about that business‚Äôs products or services. AdMedia then uses this information to place ads next to content related to the business somehow.

Why is Contextual Targeting important?

Contextual targeting is important because it allows businesses to place their ads in front of people who are already interested in what they have to offer. This means that businesses can save money by not wasting ad dollars on people not interested in their products or services.

Exclusivity

Unlike other platforms like Facebook, where almost anyone can target ads at specific groups of people, contextual advertising targets individual consumers based on their specific interests. This makes it an extremely exclusive way to market products and services because it‚Äôs nearly impossible to find a list of all the interests of all the people who use the internet.

Personalized Ads

Because contextual targeting uses information about what a person is doing on the web, it can create personalized ads relevant to them. This means that people are more likely to click on ads that appeal to them, leading to more conversions and a higher ROI. This means that people are more likely to click on ads and ultimately buy the offered products or services.

Targeting Niche Markets

Contextual advertising also allows businesses to target niche markets that they wouldn‚Äôt be able to reach with other forms of advertising. By understanding the interests of their target market, businesses can place their ads in front of people who are already interested in what they have to offer. This means that businesses can save money by not wasting ad dollars on people interested in their products or services.

Localized Content

Content is often localized with contextual targeting. This means that businesses can reach people based on their location, especially local or small businesses.

Contextual targeting has a much higher Return On Investment than other platforms like Facebook, where almost anyone can target ads at specific groups of people. Since contextual advertising targets individual consumers based on their specific interests, it allows advertisers to create personalized ads that are more likely to get clicked and lead to conversions. This means they‚Äôre more likely to see a return on their advertising dollars.

More Control

Because contextual targeting allows advertisers to place ads next to content related to the business, they have more control over where and how often those ads appear.

Final Thoughts

Contextual targeting is a powerful way for businesses to connect with people already interested in what they offer. By knowing what someone is searching, reading, watching, or sharing online, contextual advertising makes it easy for marketers to place ads next to valuable content relevant to their business. This increases the likelihood of getting more clicks and ultimately drives more conversions than other forms of advertising.

title: Pub/Sub Messaging With Geo Data App Blueprint
text:
One of the many specialties of Backendless Database that other no-code solutions lack is the ability to work with location-based, or geospatial, data. With UI Builder, as in our GEO chat app template, you can easily implement location-based features, including your own Google Maps.

The GEO Chat App Blueprint is one of our earliest and simplest blueprints, but the functionality it showcases is extremely powerful. If you are looking to implement location-based or pub/sub messaging functions into your app, this template is great tool to learn how they work.

App Blueprints are more than just templates from which to build a specific type of application or website. We design all of our App Blueprints to provide one or more key functions that a developer would want to add to their application, regardless of the app‚Äôs business use.

The GEO Chat App Blueprint showcases how to acquire a user‚Äôs location (with their permission) and display that location on a Google Map component in UI Builder when the user posts a message. Users can see where other users posted their messages from as well.

As with all of our App Blueprints, the entirety of this app blueprint was built without code using Backendless‚Äô UI Builder.

Contents

1. What does the GEO Chat app do?

2. Location gathering and sending a message

3. Listening for and displaying messages on the Google Map component

4. Simple registration and sign in

What Does the GEO Chat App Do?

You can view the demo of the GEO Chat App Blueprint here.

The GEO Chat app is a basic group chat. Users can create an account simply by logging in. The app does not use a traditional signup page; rather, a user signs in with a username and password. If that username does not already exist, a new account is automatically created and the user is logged in.

When a user posts a message, the app places a pin on the map component showing where the message originated. Simultaneously, the app displays the message in the chat sidebar for all online users.

The app also users a real-time listener to display to other users that a message is being typed. On the Users list sidebar, a ... bubble will appear next to a user that is actively typing a message.

Next, we‚Äôll break down how these features are implemented.

Location Gathering and Sending a Message

When the chat page opens, the app collects the user‚Äôs location (with the user‚Äôs permission). This information is stored in app data, not the database, meaning that the app is not collecting user location data permanently. Of course, if you choose to use similar logic in your app, you can store that data, but you will need to comply with data privacy laws.

When a user submits a chat, this location information is used to pin their message on the map at their location.

The logic used to post the chat utilizes the Pub/Sub Messaging API Codeless block to share the message with all other users that are logged in.

Without adding additional parameters, such as repeatEvery and repeatExpiresAt , pub/sub messages automatically expire in Backendless after just a few minutes. Thus, if you want to store the messages, you will need to add additional parameters to the API service displayed above.

You can view non-expired messages by visiting the messaging console in the Backend portion of your Backendless Console.

You can also manually post messages using this console.

Listening for and Displaying Messages on the Google Map Component

The Workspace container block in UI Builder contains the logic for displaying published pub/sub messages on the map and side panel. To view the logic we'll be discussing, click on the puzzle icon.

The real-time message listener, below, is triggered when a new pub/sub message is posted. The listener takes the message‚Äôs JSON format and uses it to create a list. The data in this list are then used to populate the chat sidebar as well as the Google Map component on the page.

Simple Registration and Sign In

The GEO Chat app uses a simple mechanism to allow users to register or login on the same screen.

Rather than having separate login and registration pages, when a user submits their login credentials, the app checks if the user account exists before logging in. If no account exists, a new user is automatically created.

To do this, the app runs two functions concurrently.

The register function is attempted first:

If the username does not already exist, a new user is created with the user‚Äôs credentials. Those credentials are then used to login the user.

Finally, once the user is logged in, the app navigates to the chat page.

Closing

The GEO Chat App Blueprint showcases how to implement geospatial data and messaging in a UI Builder app. Most importantly, it provides you with a template to follow for a variety of key Backendless functions. Backendless offers tons of tutorials that you can access for free to learn how more about these powerful functions.

Happy Codeless Coding!

title: Instant Messaging And Chat App Blueprint
text:
Keep in touch with friends, coworkers, shared interest groups, customers, or whoever you want with the free chat app blueprint from Backendless.

Chatly is an App Blueprint that utilizes our pub/sub messaging feature to enable person-to-person and group chat functionality.

App Blueprints are more than just templates from which to build a specific type of application. We design all of our free App Blueprints to provide one or more key functions that a developer would want to add to their application, regardless of the app‚Äôs business use.

Chatly, our Chat App Blueprint, showcases how to build a sleek and simple chat app with variable appearance for users. You can use the functionality highlighted in this template to customize your own app or website, or modify the template to fit your needs.

As with all of our App Blueprints, the entirety of this app blueprint was built without code using Backendless‚Äô UI Builder.

The chat blueprint is particularly great because of its simplicity. If you‚Äôre looking to implement chat within your organization, just tweak a few visual elements and you‚Äôre good to go right out of the box.

On the other hand, if you want to add a chat function to your website or app, Chatly gives you all of the tools you need to replicate the functionality in your own UI Builder app.

In this article, we will explore the basics of this app‚Äôs functionality:

Person-to-person messaging

Group chat

Send file, video and image attachments via chat

Light mode/dark mode

Additionally, all App Blueprints include thorough instructions to guide you through how to make your own modifications and customizations.

The web app, which functions identically to a website, can be purchased for free when creating a new app in Backendless Console. It features a beautiful, responsive design that will look great on any size screen ‚Äî desktop, tablet, or mobile.

Click here to view the live demo and follow along.

Person-to-person messaging

The Chat App Blueprint has a sleek and simple chat app design. Users are able to create an account, search through contacts, send and receive messages, and toggle between light and dark mode.

Sending a chat message is using a single form built in UI Builder. In fact, the same form and logic is used for both 1-to-1 chat and group chat. The logic that processes the message determines whether the message is to a single user or to a group, and adjusts accordingly.

Let‚Äôs look at person-to-person, also known as peer-to-peer or P2P, chat first.

The app includes functionality that shows if a message is read or not by the recipient. As you can see in the screenshot, the viewed message gets a small checkmark next to the time sent indicating that it has been seen by the other part.

Additionally, users can delete messages if they make a typo or change their mind about what they sent.

Group chat

Chatly supports group chat in addition to person-to-person chat. As mentioned above, the logic used for sending messages is the same for both P2P and group messaging. Conditional statements are built in to ensure the proper format is used.

When a message is sent to a group, all members will receive an ! icon on the group chat menu item indicating that they have an unread message.

Send file, video and image attachments via chat

Just like you can with a text message (SMS), iMessage, Slack message, etc., Chatly enables users to send files, images, and videos. Before sending, the app opens a modal window allowing the user to confirm their selected item before sending.

Once the item is sent, it appears in the chat pane as well as the sender‚Äôs Files area under their Profile tab.

Light mode & Dark mode

An increasingly popular feature of chat apps is giving the users the ability to switch between a light mode and a dark mode. Some users prefer a dark background with light color text over the traditional light background with dark text.

The Chat App Blueprint comes with a toggle-able light mode and dark mode built in (demonstrated below). This functionality can easily be replicated in other applications that you build.

Light and dark mode are implemented using UI Themes. Three primary extensions are used to determine the colors based on the user‚Äôs mode selection: dark_theme , light_theme , and variables .

All extensions are built using CSS Less, giving you the ability to not only add different colors, but also add animations, Mixins, and lots of other cool visual effects.

Closing

Chatly, the Chat App Blueprint, showcases how to implement pub/sub messaging-based chat using UI Builder. The smooth responsive design can be modified to produce your chat app easily. Perhaps more importantly, it provides Backendless users with a template to follow for a variety of key Backendless functions for your own apps.

And did we mention it looks great on desktop and mobile? Check out Chatly on iPhone:

Using this template, you can see first-hand how to:

Person-to-person messaging

Group chat

Send file, video and image attachments via chat

Light mode/dark mode

Happy Codeless Coding!

title: Why Become A Healthcare Lawyer Has Been So Popular Till Now?
text:
Manziel Law Offices

Healthcare laws are used to regulate the healthcare system. The laws bridge the gap between medical practitioners and patients. The laws are intricately written to be understood by healthcare lawyers. If you need the services of healthcare lawyers, you need to go to law offices like Manziel Law Offices. There, you‚Äôll meet healthcare lawyers like Lisa Manziel. Lisa Manziel has worked as a healthcare lawyer for thirty years plus. She works at Manziel law offices where she attends to her various clients.

Why Do We Need Healthcare Lawyers?

Healthcare lawyers have the option of working in only one field or work in several fields.

Adherence to Healthcare Laws:

Some health care providers do not obey the law governing medicine. Hence, there is a need to have enforcers enforce the rules with penalties given to rule breakers. For example, medical workers need to follow the HIPAA or risk being punished. The rules are written to protect the rights of providers and patients.

Representation of Clients in Court:

Healthcare lawyers represent providers that are sued by patients or patients that are sued by providers in court. They have the legal responsibility to represent their clients to the best of their abilities.

Why You Should Choose Healthcare Law as A Career

If your future goal is to be a healthcare lawyer, then you‚Äôve chosen the right field. This profession is high in demand right now and requires competent workers due to its complex nature. You have to be hardworking, smart, think on your feet, and be devoted.

One of the duties of healthcare legal practitioners is to resolve any healthcare conflicts. They meet up with their clients and third-party. They make legal documentation and legal research when they want to handle cases.

Healthcare lawyers can work in private or government law offices and pharmacies. Some work with non-governmental organizations and healthcare policymakers.

Here are the reasons why you should consider healthcare lawyer as a career:

Work Independently:

As a healthcare lawyer, you won‚Äôt be restricted to one workplace. If you‚Äôve worked for a long time and have a good reputation, you can establish your firm. You can become a CEO, employ other lawyers and earn profits. You can follow the legal trends and integrate them into your firm and get more money.

You Can Practice Anywhere:

Unlike other professionals where you have limitations, lawyers can practice anywhere. You may be in the UK and still practice in Germany. The only thing is that you have to write the bar exams and other qualifications of those places. Then you‚Äôd be legally qualified to practice there. You can also take online classes designed by those places to familiarise yourself with their rules.

Increased Need for Healthcare Lawyers:

Many healthcare organizations, providers, and private individuals are soliciting the services of a healthcare lawyer. This may be because they want affordable and excellent healthcare services. It may also be because many people are going for medical treatments now that they can afford them. There is much respect and care given to these lawyers due to their competency.

Contribute to The Society:

The majority of health care lawyers are dedicated and enthusiastic about their works. They want to help those who have been treated unfairly in the medical community. In a nutshell, they use their skills to contribute positively to society. Some help poor people and minority groups who have suffered medical injustice. They help them get compensation for the unfair treatment.

Uphold Medical Ethics:

Lawyers in the healthcare system ensure that providers adhere strictly to the rules. They want healthcare services to be efficiently and fairly delivered. If patients or providers are being exploited, it‚Äôs the lawyers‚Äô job to use medical ethics to get justice. Illegal providers, bad healthcare facilities, and unprofessionalism are many issues healthcare lawyers deal with. Their influence can‚Äôt be overemphasized because of the positive changes they bring to the medical community.

The Job is Secured:

The profession is one of the highest-paying jobs with high demands out there. 80% of healthcare law graduates secured good jobs after graduation compared to other jobs. There are thousands of employment opportunities for medical law graduates. This is expected to increase by 7% in the next five years. As a lawyer, it‚Äôs better to specialize in the medical field and avail yourself of the numerous job openings.

High Income Rate:

As stated earlier, medical law practitioners are one of the highest-paid in the industry. The income is probably double the amount other professionals receive. The more work experience you have the more you get paid. Although, your wage is determined by the place or area you work.

Conclusion

Being a medical lawyer like Lisa Manziel is fulfilling especially if you work in reputable companies like Manziel Law offices. You get to do what you love, help out people, and earn money in the process.

title: A Science-Based Guide to Recovery for Gaining Muscle Mass
text:
Recovery Category 3: Nutrition

This wouldn‚Äôt be much of a fitness article if I didn‚Äôt tell you how I eat. The fact is, exercise alone will not create results. You‚Äôve got to be eating right to support your body in this process.

Now, this topic is both the most simple and the most complex. It‚Äôs simple in that I personally only followed one diet during this exercise program. It‚Äôs complex because I followed a modified version of the oft-misunderstood ketogenic diet.

I personally do a ketogenic diet with 200 grams of carbs in my evening meal. This diet takes advantage of the muscle-gain effects of ketosis while keeping my glycogen stores high from the nightly carbs.

I also ate carbs more freely on weekends.

Keto is a big subject, and there are many ways to do it wrong. Also, even though this is the diet I chose to adhere to during my training program, it may not be the best for you.

Because of that, instead of talking about keto, I‚Äôm going to instead discuss a set of guidelines I follow for any diet when trying to gain muscle:

1. I eat real food

I personally believe that 90% of the success of diets is not what they have you eat, but what they have you stop eating.

People love to bash the newly popular carnivore diet, whereby adherents eat only meat and animal products. But, though the research is sparse, many people notice incredible benefits from this all-meat diet. Tribes throughout history have subsisted on solely animal-based diets, so it‚Äôs not exactly a new thing, but I suspect there is another effect that is contributing to these benefits.

They stopped eating all the other crap.

Think about it: How often do you eat something that has 10 or more ingredients that sound like lab chemicals or construction materials?

This is why I think the best first step for anyone who is trying to improve their nutrition is to start eating real, whole foods.

Robb Wolf of The Paleo Podcast says it well: If it didn‚Äôt have a face, don‚Äôt eat it. Now, obviously plants don‚Äôt have faces, but the key to this phrase is to get you to think of eating only things that were recently alive.

Eat plants that look like they are still plants and eat meat.

Don‚Äôt eat partially hydrogenated packaged foods, filled with weird ingredients like ammonium sulfate or isinglass.

2. I eat a lot of food

One of the best nutrition tips I‚Äôve ever heard is the three-part mantra: Eat real food. Not too much. Mainly vegetables.

This mantra is great in that it promotes eating things that are natural and meant to go into your body from an evolutionary standpoint, while also getting the well-proven benefits of calorie restriction (eating not too much) and the nutritional power of many leafy green vegetables.

However, when you are trying to build muscle, you need to modify this mantra just a little bit. Instead of restricting your calories, you actually want to increase them.

Building muscle requires, to some extent, a calorie surplus, as well as adequate protein.

Now, personally, I don‚Äôt like counting calories, but for the duration of this exercise program, just try not to ever be hungry. If you feel hungry, you are not eating enough.

This is where a keto or low-carb diet can be beneficial, as fats are high-calorie food sources that will help you eat less often. If you go the other way and stick with a higher-carb diet, just try to stick with healthy sources of carbs.

It can be difficult to get high calories from carbs only eating whole vegetables as your food source, however, tubers can really change the game.

I recently discovered, and subsequently fell in love with the Japanese Sweet Potato. These things taste sweet like a yam, but have the texture and consistency of a flaky, chunky regular potato.

Bake ‚Äôem in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for an hour and a half, then drown ‚Äôem in coconut oil, and you‚Äôve got one of the most delicious sources of healthy carbs I have found to date.

3. I mainly eat lean meat and fats from vegetables

Most of the meat sold in stores here in the U.S. has poor fat composition. Due to the high-grain diet, which is often unnatural for these animals, their fat has high amounts of inflammatory Omega-6 fat and low amounts of Omega-3.

To avoid getting this same situation in my own body, even though I do the high-fat ketogenic diet, I only eat lean, low-fat meat cuts. Then I get my dietary fat from vegetable sources, especially from extra virgin olive oil and avocados.

This extends into simply eating a lot of vegetables in general. A very common day for me is to eat a large, fake ‚Äúchicken confit‚Äù meal consisting of a high amount of grapeseed oil, bok choy, which is a form of oriental cabbage that increases testosterone, and lean chicken breast.

At dinner, when I am restoring my muscle glycogen by adding carbs, I‚Äôll do a sous vide chicken dinner with dinosaur kale and a large Japanese sweet potato. I lather the chicken with Primal Kitchen Avocado Mayonnaise and douse the potato with coconut oil.

During the day I might throw in some snacks in the form of macadamia nuts, or Wild Planet Sardines.

If you can stomach it, grass-fed, grass-finished (do not get any other kind) beef liver is one of the most nutritionally dense foods on the planet, and I try to eat it at least once a week. If you can‚Äôt stand the taste, there are some great recipes for making it more palatable using apple cider vinegar or lemon.

Bonus: I do a modified ketogenic diet

The ketogenic diet has been shown in studies to spare the amino acid leucine, which leads to increased muscle gains during weight training compared to high carb diets.

As I mentioned earlier, keto is poorly understood by many people, so I really can‚Äôt give you enough info to start keto in this guide alone. However, you may know already that I have written an extensive article on the ketogenic diet already that is posted here on Better Humans.

To use keto for this purpose, and truly follow my personal training plan, go read my guide at: Myths and Mistakes of the Ketogenic Diet, but apply my rules here.

The only difference in what the keto guide suggests and what I do for muscle building is that I don‚Äôt restrict calories, and I eat 200 grams of carbs from Japanese sweet potatoes with dinner.

This is so I have enough calories to gain muscle without injury and so that I have enough muscle glycogen (which is just sugar stored in your muscles) for high-intensity exercise that cannot be supported by fat as a fuel source.

You don‚Äôt have to do keto as long as you follow the three tips I mentioned here, but I like it better personally.

title: A List Of The Best Keto-Friendly Alcohol Drinks
text:
There‚Äôs actually quite a variety to choose from‚Ä¶

Get your custom diet plan here

Tequila has various medical advantages (and contains low calories as compared to Smirnoff vodka). Agavins, the characteristic sugar found in tequila, are non-absorbable (which means they act like fiber) and won‚Äôt increase your blood glucose levels. Additionally, the sugar is appeared to help lower cholesterol and could assist you with getting more fit by cutting your weight. Yes, believe it or not, tequila can fit in consummately with a weight-reduction plan whenever taken with some restraint.

#Key Tip: The regular quantity of a glass of tequila is 1 ounce.

At last, all wine changes over into sugar, which isn‚Äôt beneficial for you. Even so, red wine specifically has some fabulous medical advantages. The dynamic substances in red wine (polyphenols, resveratrol, and quercetin) have been demonstrated to enhance in general your heart‚Äôs wellbeing. Besides, study carries out at the University of Massachusetts Amherst discovered that red wine hinders the procedure of glucose hitting the circulatory system, which prevents high spikes of insulin.

#Key Tip: The regular quantity of a glass of wine is 5 ounces.

Rum is definitely not a well known alcohol, however it ought to be (for its breathtaking medical advantages). Produced using molasses and other sugarcane side-products, rum has been demonstrated to improve psychological wellness from multiple points of view. With some restraint, a standard serving could help decrease tension, for instance.
