title: Social media isn‚Äôt killing as much as smoking
text:
Only if you know how to use and get the most of it.

This article is about how your online, mostly social media activities pay off from the perspective of content marketing.

A big alert: this article is about and dedicated to people who have professional, creative skills.

After using social media for more than 10 years at both personal and professional levels and roasting it enough, I‚Äôve realized that one‚Äôs online activities ‚Äî what content you produce, what you put out there bring lots of opportunities.

Having said that, I must say everyone should switch their social media usage from personal to professional, and actually show off their professions.

The first question is, why? Secondly, how?

PS: I‚Äôve posted examples more from TikTok, but it doesn‚Äôt mean this article is only about TikTok usage.

Now, hold my beer.

Opportunities come anywhere

You never know.

I know some people got jobs because of their Twitter and Facebook activities. One of them was famous on Twitter, had funny tweets full of puns, and had a good amount of followers. He became a copywriter, he‚Äôs now a creative director at a local advertising company.

The other one, my close friend, was writing his daily story-type posts on Facebook. He also got a job as a copywriter at a digital marketing company, without academic background or diploma. He told me that, as he was writing a lot, he realized that creative writing resonates with his interests; he worked on himself and earned Adobe certificates as well. I wrote about him here.

They were good at writing, and by intention or not, they got to show their skills on social media. Or, to put it another way, they were using social media with their creative writing skills, and got the attention.

Also, I observe and know for myself, the more you become active on social media, you get better at improving your skills (for the sake of improving your content continuously) and get new ideas from others.

Lots of people have skills, creative souls, some valuable information and skill to share on the Internet yet, they don‚Äôt. They act like consumers, not creators ‚Äî producers.

Millions of consumers ‚Äî any type, any age

This guy works on a pool cleaning service. He has 12M followers on TikTok.

He shares the process and gives tips with short TikTok clips.

So, WhAt??

The pool guy gets millions of views, recognition and finds new customers for his company.

Users love watching his clips, and learn tips and find the service they are looking for.

Not to mention people are falling for cleaning, organizing, ASMR, lifestyle, and these types of content.

Check out this lady, a full time artist ‚Äî Tahlia Stanton. She shares how to make a living from artwork, business tips for artists, and answers art-related questions with her TikTok clips. She has more than a million followers on TikTok, half a million on Instagram, and quite a huge fan base, including me.

Another example is what I just came across on TikTok. A forster family of 12 with 10 children; the mother shares how she prepares meals for them on this clip:

Simple, yet interesting. She shares her family, tips on how she manages everything, and gets the interest of millions of people.

The Dougherty Dozen family also has their single page site, where they‚Äôve put affiliate links, what products they‚Äôre using, wish lists, their Amazon store, and much more.

That is a win-win situation for both creators and consumers. Consumers are fed their hunger for entertainment and they learn something while creators get views, customers, and make money.

How did these people become successful? They‚Äôve found what they are capable of creating and producing, their content style, a fitting platform, and got a creative way to sell ‚Äî earn money.

Think of Carrie Bradshaw at the HBO‚Äôs TV series ‚ÄúSex And The City‚Äù. It‚Äôs said she knows fashion, relationships, and sex. She was good at observations, even if her opinions were wrong most of the time (for me). Carrie was good at converting her thinking into words ‚Äî that‚Äôs what she was doing ‚Äî writing a sex column in a newspaper and getting paid, not to mention later on she became a writer at VOGUE Magazine and published her books. This might not only be fiction.

As this lady ‚Äî she‚Äôs an astrologist, as she said, she HELPS PEOPLE FIGURE OUT THEMSELVES. She‚Äôs active on both Instagram and Twitter. She‚Äôs writing a column at magazines like Cosmopolitan, Vice, and Bustle.

As she said, she is internet popular. The companies she‚Äôs working with found out about her through her activities on Instagram and Twitter.

When TikTok came out, I was super skeptical, had a biased opinion; I was a total judgemental b*tch. I was like eww, screw them, I‚Äôd never register and use it.

Today I‚Äôm praising the content creators across all social media platforms (not the ones that share their sugar daddy issues).

For professional purposes only (I swear!) I started using TikTok, exploring what type of content is produced on the platform.

I‚Äôve been through every type of account, binge-watched thousands of clips. Lots of content was/is trash and nonsense. But, it was enlightening, I was like: ‚Äúyou guys are getting paid for that?‚Äù

Business owners, influencers, travelers, motivational speakers, psychologists, life coaches, astrologists, anyone with any profession is using TikTok for their own good. And people are falling for their content, not to mention the platform is addictive as well.

Content is the GOAT marketing

People like to search everything, find an answer to their questions online, or content to feed their boredom, entertainment, or curiosity.

Got a headache? Google it (it‚Äôll probably show the possibility of cancer, but still), just broke up with your BF/GF, or wonder why your cat keeps his tongue out? Ask Google why? Got bored? Ask Google top ten movies to watch. You‚Äôre sad? Search for funny animal videos. And more and forth.

These types of content get thousands of traffic on every platform.

Them ‚Äî you may have some great skills, but if no one knows about it, you‚Äôll not be able to benefit from it, and even worse, you may lose interest in improving yourself and the skills you now have.

Can you be one of these content producers?

Start blogging..

If you love writing and if you can deliver your value through it. I was thinking that reading blogs was dead since I hadn‚Äôt come across a blog that I could remember or visit the second time.

I was wrong. I found Harry Dry‚Äôs blog ‚Äî Marketing Examples. It‚Äôs one of the blogs that I‚Äôve subscribed to and read continuously, and somehow it happens I‚Äôm talking about his blog a lot and recommend it to everyone. Why? He delivers value, and his examples are applicable and straight to the point. Harry has his own style. He doesn‚Äôt write 3000-word long articles, he even has a short, 7-sentence long article. He got the point.

How to have a successful blog?

Write what you know and can;

Don‚Äôt copy what others do in your industry, it‚Äôs boring, and they may be wrong;

Get out of the box and forget about the writing rules, that‚Äôs your blog ‚Äî write whatever and however you want;

Make sure you help people and deliver value;

Don‚Äôt be shy to voice your style through your content.

And,

Don‚Äôt forget about SEO.

You can also post your content on related communities like Reddit, Indie Hackers, etc. to get started, improve your writing skills and get more experience.

On social media platforms..

Don‚Äôt interrupt the experience of users. Be their experience.

On Facebook, be a good storyteller for people that they‚Äôll love to share your story; on Instagram, be an artist; on TikTok, be a real TikToker, use those trendy songs on your clips; on Youtube, be a teacher/mentor/coach; on LinkedIn, act like professional.

Read my other article about social media for business.

Online communities. Share valuable information you‚Äôve got related to your interest and skills. Make e-friends, grow your social and business network from the communities you have an interest in (Quora, Reddit, Facebook groups, etc). This will help you later with publishing and/or promoting your content there. In general, grow your professional network, for it brings countless business opportunities.

About deciding on your content

Look closer at your lifestyle, what you‚Äôre good at or what you like doing the most. Watching movies? Painting? Traveling? Following fashion? Hiking? Cooking? Taking care of pets? I can ask more questions but you got the point.

Now, think of what people can learn from your profession, daily activities, or your skills (any).

This guy is a psychologist. Play, you‚Äôll see what I mean:

Produce your main content on the platform that works best for you ‚Äî represents your profession, and don‚Äôt stop being active on others too.

Disclaimer: I‚Äôm not promoting or praising the social media users that produce lip singing or mukbang types of sh!!ty content. I‚Äôm on the side of the ones that give real value and help others in any way.

Don‚Äôt just produce content that people will watch but don‚Äôt get value. Though you will make money somehow, you‚Äôll not deliver value. It‚Äôs just the ethics. Up to you. Otherwise, you‚Äôll have no difference from smoking companies that poison the consumers.

Don‚Äôt do this:

Or, this:

Do this:

And this:

About the ‚Äúdon‚Äôts‚Äù I mentioned above: they make social media entertaining, but they are also cause people being couch potatoes. Just a note.

What comes next?

You already know what having a huge followers list and fan base means.

https://media.giphy.com/media/1lDfEnjowuVcpMRozp/giphy.gif

If you‚Äôre your own product, you‚Äôll attract customers;

You can earn with referral and affiliate marketing;

You can get paid for views and likes on social media (like TikTok);

If you create your product, you‚Äôll promote it quickly at no cost.

Conclusion

We can all agree that social media offers a lot, and there‚Äôs a huge opportunity for everyone to get known, ‚Äúdiscovered‚Äù, and paid.

I can tell that social media is the easiest way to make a living from your side hustle, hobby, or interest ‚Äî whatever you name it.

It‚Äôs not rocket science.

If you scroll the content only and be that couch potato, you‚Äôll get consumed by social media. The key is ‚Äî create your own story, be an active and professional Internet user, and convert your creative skills into perfect content.

As it‚Äôs all in the essence of all business types ‚Äî you need to help, give value, and satisfy consumers, doesn‚Äôt matter what your ‚Äúproduct‚Äù is.

A big takeaway is: don‚Äôt be a content consumer, but a producer if you want to benefit from social media and don‚Äôt want to let it harm you.
tags: ['Content Creation', 'Social Media Marketing', 'Content Marketing', 'Internet Marketing', 'Social Media']

title: How to Climb Out of Poverty
text:
If we reason sensibly, how can an ordinary man born in a slum get rich? We will not consider the criminal way, nor will we consider beautiful stories about millionaires. So, reasoning based on common sense will get you nowhere. Then what good is common sense to you? Why settle for common sense? Just allow yourself to do what seems impossible.

By acting logically, people get the appropriate result. If one is born into poverty, one is surrounded by poverty, accustomed to it, and attuned to emitting energy at the frequency of one‚Äôs poverty line. It is very difficult to readjust to the line of one‚Äôs affluence if one has only hatred of one‚Äôs poverty, envy of the rich, and a desire to become affluent oneself. Or no, I would say that with only these three things in place, it is almost impossible to switch to the line of wealth.

Let‚Äôs look into why. Probably one of the first discoveries of all children entering life is this fact: Just because you don‚Äôt want something doesn‚Äôt mean you‚Äôll be spared it. Sometimes a cry of despair just bursts out of your soul: ‚ÄúBut I don‚Äôt want it! I just hate it! Why won‚Äôt it leave me alone? Why does this always happen to me?‚Äù Such a question in a fit of indignation ask themselves not only children, but adults as well. Indeed, it is difficult to accept the situation that if you do not want something, it still happens, and if you hate it, it just persists. You can hate your poverty, your job, your physical defects, your neighbors, vagrants in the street, alcoholics, drug addicts, dogs, thieves, bandits, insolent youths, the government‚Ä¶ The more you hate it, the more it comes across in life. It hurts you, you think about it, and so you continue to be in a line of poverty where the object of your discontent is present in abundance. And here it doesn‚Äôt matter what polarity this emission has: ‚Äúlike‚Äù or ‚Äúdislike. The second is even more effective, because negative emotions are stronger. Can you imagine how many harmful factors are inherent in a negative attitude toward life?

Let‚Äôs go back to the man born into poverty. He has a dream of becoming rich. But one wish, as you know, does not change anything. You can collapse on the couch and lazily pull: ‚ÄúIt would be nice to sunbathe on the beach right now, but it‚Äôs winter, and I don‚Äôt have money for a trip. This is roughly how a poor person dreams of becoming rich. If a person is not willing to act to get what he wants, he won‚Äôt get it. And he does not act because he is convinced that nothing will work out anyway. This is such a vicious circle. Desire has no power. It cannot even lift a finger. It is the intention, that is, the determination to act, that does it. Intention also includes a willingness to have. A person may say, ‚ÄúWell, you can‚Äôt take that away from me! It‚Äôs so easy, because I want to be rich!‚Äù No. Again, there is a deep gulf between ‚Äúwanting‚Äù and ‚Äúbeing willing to be.‚Äù For example, a poor person feels ‚Äúout of place‚Äù in a rich setting or in an expensive store, even if he tries hard to convince himself and others otherwise. Deep down, he believes that he is not worthy of it all. Wealth is not part of the poor man‚Äôs comfort zone, not because being rich is uncomfortable, but because he is far from it all. The new chair is more comfortable, but the old chair is more comfortable. The poor are only familiar with the outward side of wealth: luxurious houses, expensive cars, jewelry, travel‚Ä¶ If you put a poor person in such an environment, he will feel discomfort. And if you give him a suitcase of money, he will start to do all sorts of stupid things and lose everything in the end. The frequency of the energy he broadcasts is in sharp dissonance with such a life. And until the beggar lets the trappings of wealth into his comfort zone, until he learns to feel like a master of expensive things, he will remain poor, even if he finds the treasure.

One more obstacle on the way to wealth is envy. As we know, to envy means to be vexed by someone else‚Äôs good fortune. In this sense, there is nothing constructive about this feeling. But envy has a strong destructive element. Human psychology is organized in such a way: if he envies what he would like to have, he tries to depreciate it in every possible way. Here is the logic of ‚Äúblack envy: ‚ÄúI envy what he has. I do not have it, and I will hardly ever have it. But how am I worse than him? It means that the thing he possesses is bad, and I do not need it. This is how the desire to have turns into a psychological defense, and then develops into rejection. Rejection goes on a subtle level, because the subconscious mind takes everything literally. Consciousness depreciates the object of envy only for appearance, for self-assurance, whereas sub-consciousness takes everything seriously. And this is where it does a disservice, doing everything not to get what is devalued and rejected.

Thus you see what tenacious forces are holding a person to a poor life line. Events are even more dramatic when one moves from the affluent to the poor life line. There are times when a well-to-do person loses everything and ends up on the street. All the insidiousness of the transition to poverty is manifested in the fact that its spiral unfolds slowly, imperceptibly at first, and then more rapidly, so that it cannot be stopped. This spiral begins with temporary financial difficulties. Note that temporary financial difficulties can always happen to anyone. It is as common an inevitability as, say, rain on the day you are going on a picnic. If you don‚Äôt become enraged, depressed, anxious, or resentful of life about it without getting a boost, the situation will stabilize.

The real transition to the poor life line begins when you grasp the tip of the spiral and begin to unwind it. Your first reaction is dissatisfaction. This is still too little support for the difficult situation at hand, and if your emotions run out at this point, it will resolve. The other reaction is resentment, and this is already stronger, you begin to send information to your surroundings that someone is to blame for your financial difficulties. You respond to this second push with negative feedback or actions toward the perpetrators. At this point, the negative energy begins to fill you completely and a new spiral begins: you receive another paycheck even less, or prices jump, or you are required to pay a debt. Note, at this stage you are not yet aware of any process going on. It may just seem like an annoying nuisance. In reality, it is a directed process that you launched yourself, responding to the negativity with negativity. The frequency of your energy radiation is increasingly shifting from lines where you are successful to lines where you are deprived and resentful. So you transfer to the life lines corresponding to these new parameters. And so your situation becomes more and more aggravated. The bad news starts coming in from everywhere: prices are going up; things are not going well in your company. You begin to actively discuss this negative news with your acquaintances and relatives. The discussion, as a rule, is destructive, i.e. complaints, dissatisfaction and aggression against the alleged perpetrators. This is especially pronounced in companies where things are quite bad. There, the day begins with the postulate that ‚Äúthere is no money,‚Äù as with the morning prayer. In no case do not kill yourself over the lack or loss of money, otherwise there will be less and less. If a person earns little money, his typical mistake will be to whine about not having enough money forever. The parameters of such radiation correspond to poor life lines. It is especially dangerous to give in to anxiety that money is becoming less and less Fear is the most energetically saturated emotion, therefore by experiencing fear of losing or not making money you in the most effective way move yourself to the lines where money is really becoming less and less. At this stage you are already completely seized by the spiral, your radiation is tuned to a destructive frequency. As things are getting worse, you are gripped by anxiety. The energy of anxiety, in spite of its small value, is very well manifested in your actions. In this state, you will inevitably create an aura of negativity around you, increasingly experiencing discontent, aggression, depression, apathy, resentment, and so on. Thus the situation gets out of control and begins to develop in an avalanche-like manner. Fear takes hold of you completely, and you go on the rampage. It is as if you were taken by the arms and spun, spun, and then abruptly thrown. You flew aside, fell, and were left lying there in a state of shock. That‚Äôs a scary picture. And it all started with a little financial hardship. In the end, when the spiral unfolded, the unfortunate person lost a lot, at best, and at worst, everything. Further events could unfold in different ways: the unfortunate person would either remain lying on the unfortunate lifeline, or would begin to struggle to make it out. Such a transition can happen either to an individual or to a large group of people. In the second case, as you understand, it is not just a spiral, but a real whirlpool from which it is very difficult to get out.

The only remedy for this transition is not to grasp the tip of the spiral, not to succumb to emotion, and not to get involved in a destructive game. It is not enough to know how this mechanism works. It must always be kept in mind. Rebuff yourself whenever you habitually, as in a dream, accept this game, that is, express discontent, resentment, show concern, participate in destructive discussions, and so on. In dreams the same thing happens: until you realize that this is a dream, you are a puppet in someone else‚Äôs game and you may be haunted by nightmares. As soon as you wake up, shake off the vision, realize what the game is, that‚Äôs it, you are the master of the situation and will not become a victim of circumstances, while everyone around you is in a zombified state.

Let us summarize.

Each person chooses for himself or herself which life to be on, the line of poverty or the line of wealth. By emitting negative energy, a person‚Äôs own life line deteriorates. Aggression is mistaken for strength and dissatisfaction for a normal reaction. The more often a person responds to negative events, the worse for him/her, it leads him/her to the line of poverty.

Try to keep all negative information out of your life line. Not letting them in means not to avoid them, but intentionally to ignore them, not to be interested in them. Negative information, dissatisfaction and envy have not solved any problems yet, they add to them, so you need to concentrate on the good, and on the opportunities.

The world is like a mirror, reflecting your attitude toward it. When you are dissatisfied with the world, it turns away from you. When you fight the world, it fights you. When you stop your battle, the world comes to you.

title: The first step along the way: Self-Accountability
text:
As humans, we tend to get caught up in the little things. Unbeknownst to us, those little things can turn into some big shit, real fast. So, trust that while you‚Äôre unique, you‚Äôre also not one in a million; along the way we all encounter negatives. May it be through childhood trauma, a loss of a loved one, toxic relationships, or any other traumatic experience. The effects can be long-lasting causing mental illnesses like anxiety, depression, and PTSD to brew up, making it a difficult journey to good mental health. Now, harboring those deep feelings and emotions aren‚Äôt ‚Äúlittle things‚Äù by far, but in comparison to the bigger picture, it‚Äôs a speck in the universe of possibility. What if I told you that it‚Äôs not about what we encounter, but more to do with how we navigate through the experience?

Yes, that shitty experience may have torn you apart; left you alone in the woods where night was everlasting, and left you bleeding as bait for the wolves, but here you are. While you were torn apart, tools were left at your dispense to put yourself back together. It may have been everlasting darkness, but you were left with a light as bright as the sun; you. The snarls and growls of the wolves may have been terrifying, though you stood with immense courage and strength. We are equipped with the tools and the knowledge to overcome. It all boils down to whether we‚Äôre open and willing to use it. Why do we kick ourselves when we‚Äôre already down? Do we love being the victim? Do we love the attention that self-pity attracts? Stop acting like you‚Äôre not a god in training. There is always a choice and it‚Äôs yours to make. Create an exit plan out of the shit storm.

photography by Mary Alice Hammond

Amid cause and effect, we often confuse the hand that‚Äôs behind the negatives, as a force outside of ourselves and/or outside of our control. That is not true. Everything that we encounter along the way is a manifestation of what‚Äôs going on internally; how we view our image, our role in relationships, and our purpose. There comes a time when we have to stop placing blame on our negative experiences. We have to apologize to ourselves; the part we played in how we let our experience dictate our life. The decisions we made on our path and where it brought us are all on us.

You‚Äôll forever be stuck in the tar pit of blame if you can‚Äôt realize who the main character in your story is. You are not the damsel in distress, you‚Äôre not the throw away extra, but you do have the choice of being the protagonist or the antagonist in your life. Choose wisely.

May we all continue to grow and flourish, much love.

title: Journey in Masai School
text:
This is Snehil Gupta a commerce student and an average student with 6 years education gap and 2 times State Level Tables Tennis player,born in Jaunpur(Uttar Pradesh) and bought up in Renukoot(Uttar Pradesh). I traveled in different states for studies like Uttar Pradesh, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh. From childhood I was very much interested in computer when I was 12 years old my mom purchased me a computer.

In 2021 I decided to joined Masai School because I was keeping an eye on Masai from 2019. Then I discussed about Masai School with my parents, they supported me for my decision. I given MSAT-1 and MSAT-2 on same day. Luckily I got cleared MSAT exams in one attempt and got selected for upcoming batch and on 15-Nov-2021 I joined Masai School as a Full Stack Web Developer. Now it‚Äôs been a month and I feel happy with my decision, because this is the thing which I was searching whole life. After joining Masai School I learned a lot about web development, how whole system works. There is a lot of hard work, time and dedication includes for giving best user experience all time which was not visible to users. The teachers and whole team of Masai School is very cooperative and supportive. They always stand with us during our tough time during course. Everyday they motivate us and keep us energetic for whole day because it is Military Based System with 9‚Äì9‚Äì6 curriculum. Regular practice, doubt solving, Instructor Associate support system, Student Guide support. Time to time meet with Alumni and the students who completed the course from Masai and now at good position, created there own application/website and well settled in life which gives us motivation to reach our goal.

In Masai School we start our day with a scrum where we get routine of a day and motivational speech by Yogesh Bhat Sir and Nrupul Sir. In the first two week it was going very easy for us because we were new to this field. During a day we have srcum, coding class, Skillathon and Alumni meet. Daily we have assignments also of coding which need to be completed within a given time period. After two weeks routine got slightly changed because now we were ready to coupe up with Military Style System 9‚Äì9‚Äì6. In morning we have Scrum, after that we have another class Data Structure and Algorithm(DSA), then we have skillathon. After all these we have a break for lunch then we have Coding class(3 hrs). After that we have to complete our both the assignments of DSA and Coding within a given time period, and on every Monday there will be an Evaluation to test our knowledge whatever we have learnt in last week. Based on evaluation there will be a grading. If the student is weak in any part of the curriculum then they provide extra support. During this journey we find many difficulties in curriculum so, to solve these difficulties we have an Instructor Associate(IA) support who will be our senior or graduated from Masai School. There will be a Student Guide also who will be our current senior they will also help us during curriculum. In Masai School we will also get financial support to keep our studies continue that known as a GLIDE program.

At last I am happily to say being a part of Masai School is a best decision I have ever taken in my life.

title: Consumer Tech Roundup (Ep. 1)
text:
Story 1 ‚Äî No Immediate Plans to Accept Crypto, Apple‚Äôs CEO Says

Though he owns and believes it‚Äôs reasonable to own cryptocurrency as part of a diversified portfolio, Apple‚Äôs CEO Tim Cook, in a session at last month‚Äôs New York Times‚Äô DealBook Conference, said his company had no ‚Äúimmediate plans‚Äù to start accepting crypto.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think people buy Apple stock to get exposure to crypto,‚Äù Cook said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not something we have immediate plans to do.‚Äù

Story 2 ‚Äî Samsung Announces New Company Leaders; Merges Consumer Electronics and Mobile Divisions

Last week, Samsung Electronics announced some leadership and organizational modifications in the company.

The company, which previously had three subdivisions ‚Äî Consumer Electronics, Device Solutions, and Mobile & IT ‚Äî each headed by a separate CEO since 2017 ‚Äî will now have the Consumer Electronics and Mobile & IT divisions as a single division called SET.

The SET branch will comprise smartphones, TVs, and home appliances, and will be led by one CEO, now Jong-Hee Han.

Story 3 ‚Äî The iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max Rumored to Come Without the Notch

With some nine months to go before Apple releases the iPhone 14 lineup, rumors are rife that the iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max models will come ‚Äúnotch-less.‚Äù

Several reports speculate that the notch (an iPhone feature since 2017‚Äôs iPhone X ) will be replaced with a punch-hole design common on many Android phones.

Sources

#1: The New York Times

#2: SamMobile

#3: DigitalTrends, SamMobile

title: 21 Tips for Weight Loss That Actually Work
text:
Here‚Äôs expert advice for what really works when it comes to shedding unwanted pounds.

Research suggests that keeping a record of everything you put in your mouth really can help you meet your weight loss goals.Getty Images

Throughout the long term, youve presumably heard your reasonable part of strange weight reduction counsel, regardless of whether its to drink celery squeeze each day or supplant your dinners with weight reduction treats. What‚Äôs more, frequently, those tips are advanced by individuals with practically no wellbeing mastery. (Peruse: Proceed with alert.)

Be that as it may, similarly as theres a huge load of misinformed weight reduction guidance out there to be kept away from, there are additionally a great deal of authentic, research-upheld and master endorsed ideas.

One such tip: Pick a chance to exercise and adhere to it. A review distributed in July 2019 in the diary Obesity found that practicing reliably at a specific time every day might assist you with effectively keeping up with weight reduction.

Other solid counsel: Choose nuts over vigorously handled bites. An article distributed in December 2019 in BMJ Nutrition, Prevention and Health found that increasing the number of nuts you eat by a large portion of a serving (for instance from ounce to 1 ounce) every day is connected with less weight gain and lower chances of stoutness.

RELATED: 9 Hard Truths About Weight Loss That Can Help You Slim Down

An Easy Way To Reduce Fat While Cooking

Regular Health staff nutritionist Kelly Kennedy, RD, shows both of you various ways of cooking a pumpkin and how to broil the seeds. To find out with regards to the medical advantages of pumpkin, look at our pumpkin guide.

Theres likewise proof that a weight reduction instructor could assist you with managing your waistline. A review distributed in November 2019 in JAMA Internal Medicine viewed as that for individuals with type 2 diabetes, matching such directing meetings (for this situation, weight reduction by means of low-carb eating less junk food) with bunch clinical visits assisted them with getting more fit and lower their glucose levels. A mutual benefit! What doesnt work? Perpetual slimming down. Requiring a fourteen day diet break might help weight reduction, as indicated by a little report including corpulent men. Scientists distributed the discoveries in August 2017 in the International Journal of Obesity.

Follow such tips, and you very well could wind up shedding pounds and feeling more invigorated and sure. Whats not to like with regards to that?

What‚Äôs more, we know, shedding pounds might be overwhelming yet doing it is as yet great, particularly with regards to your wellbeing.

For instance, weight reduction might assist with bringing down your bosom malignant growth hazard. An enormous report distributed in December 2019 in the Journal of the National Cancer Institute found that overweight ladies who shed pounds in the wake of turning 50 years of age had lower chances of creating bosom disease than those whose weight remained about something very similar.

RELATED: 5 Reasons Its Harder to Lose Weight With Age

Likewise, getting thinner can possibly put type 2 diabetes into abatement. A review distributed in September 2019 in Diabetic Medicine viewed as that among individuals with type 2 diabetes, losing 10% or a greater amount of their body weight inside the initial five years of a determination was related with better chances of the infection going into abatement. As indicated by the American Heart Association, conveying additional weight can likewise up your chances of coronary illness and stroke.

Find these successful ways of shedding pounds whether you have a bit or a ton to lose directly from aware of everything specialists.

1. Eat Slowly

I have my customers figure out how to pick food varieties they like, genuinely taste every piece going into their mouths, and bite purposely. I encourage them to bite gradually, swallow just when the food is completely bitten up, and rehash. It requires some investment to know we‚Äôre full. Eating gradually permits us to partake in our food more, however gives us better signals of satiety. Janet Zinn, an authorized clinical social laborer and psychotherapist in private practice in New York City

RELATED: What Is Intuitive Eating? A Beginners Guide to the Anti-Diet

2. You Bite It, You Write It!

That is my standard, and various examinations have shown the viability of food journaling for weight reduction. One of my customers left town for multi week. She quit journaling and acquired 13 pounds. I guarantee that keeping a food diary makes a difference! Christine King, the author and CEO of the wellbeing and health organization YourBestFit in Boynton Beach, Florida

3. Practice Anything That Moves

That is my mantra and I began this after I crushed my spirit and was deadened starting from the waist. Do it in bed, while situated, standing, or strolling. Simply move. Individuals have a misinterpretation that five minutes doesnt have an effect, yet consistently has an effect. (Furthermore, research distributed in January 2014 in the diary Progress in Cardiovascular Diseasesshowed that active work is basic with regards to really keeping shed pounds off.) King

4. Keep a Daily Gratitude Journal

Our dietary patterns are typically associated with our feelings whether or not we understand it. At the point when we‚Äôre anxious, we will quite often go after desserts. I let customers know that by keeping an every day diary of things you‚Äôre thankful for, youre better ready to adapt to the pressure by recognizing it rather than going after dessert. Lauren Manganiello, RD, a nourishment instructor and wellness mentor in New York City

RELATED: Stress Hack: How Maintaining a Gratitude Journal for 1 Month Made Me Happier

5. Cluster Cook and Prep

Each Sunday I cluster cook sufficient chicken for the week. I remove the fat, heat it with preparing, measure 3.5 ounces (oz), and put that much into a compartment with some mustard and frozen veggies, so I can snatch one per day to bring to work. I likewise set aside the effort to evenly divide cup of moved oats, 1 tablespoon (tbsp) regular peanut butter, 1 tbsp ground flax, and a squeeze every one of protein powder and cinnamon to improve in individual holders. So when Im a zombie in the first part of the day, I should simply add water and microwave! Kyra Williams, a fitness coach in Boston

6. Get Enough Zs

An absence of rest builds your yearning chemical ghrelin and diminishes your fulfillment chemical, leptin, which can add to weight gain. At the point when we are sleepless, we ache for more pungent and sweet food varieties. Why? Since whenever you feel more exceptional yearning, your longings for higher energy also known as more unhealthy food sources strengthen. We additionally realize that the manner in which we think and interaction our feelings is impacted by insufficient rest, so its simple to associate this with a disabled capacity to use wise judgment in numerous everyday issues, incorporating with food. In case we flip the coin, we can securely expect that when we are all around rested, we will settle on better decisions. With regards to eating, that would imply that we would eat when we are genuinely eager, and eat just until fulfilled. Our chemicals are additionally going to be better adjusted on the grounds that our bodies got the time expected to rest, fix, and revive. Angela Lemond, RDN, an enrolled dietitian nutritionist in private practice in Texas

7. Dont Skip Meals

Keep in mind, our body‚Äôs definitive objective is to remain alive. When we are being kept from calories which are in a real sense the existence energy for our bodies it will get things done to get by. Our body knows what food varieties are higher in energy thickness, and we will long for those more. Honor your appetite and dont permit your body to believe it‚Äôs being famished. This conflicts with a large number of the abstaining from excessive food intake strategies, yet those strategies really don‚Äôt function admirably for individuals in the long haul. I by and large suggest eating like clockwork. Lemond

RELATED: 14 Diet and Weight Loss Mistakes and How to Avoid Them

8. Remain Hydrated

Research has found that individuals who drank two glasses of water before a dinner lost more weight than individuals who didnt drink water before suppers and they kept it off. This straightforward tip works in two ways. Thirst can cover itself as yearning, making you eat more. Also, water causes you to feel more full, making you eat less during a feast. Megan Casper, RDN, a sustenance guide and the author and CEO of Nourished Bite

9. Cut Calories, Not Flavor

By picking choices like sharp cheddar over gentle cheddar, you can utilize less, yet youll still get a ton of flavor without feeling like you‚Äôre on a careful nutritional plan. Casper

10. Gauge Yourself Once every Week

Same day, same time, same measure of apparel. Recall that your weight isnt a solitary number yet a five-pound range. Work to drop the reach down, not the specific number. Lainey Younkin, RD, a nourishment guide and specialist in Boston

11. Revamp Your Plate

Make a large portion of your plate vegetables, a fourth of your plate entire grains, and a fourth of your plate lean protein. At the point when you switch the parts of grains and vegetables on your plate, you‚Äôll see a distinction. The main admonition: Potatoes, corn, and peas are boring vegetables, so they go in the grains classification. Younkin

RELATED: How to Follow MyPlate (No Calorie-Counting Required!)

12. Keep the 80 Percent Guideline

Eat until you feel only 80% full. Pack any additional food away as opposed to feeling like you must be important for the perfect plate club. Helene Byrne, the originator of BeFit-Mom in Oakland, California

13. Skip the Liquid Calories

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a strong relationship between sugar-sweetened beverages and weight gain in adults. If you regularly have a sip of something sweet, consider this: Research has shown that reducing intake of sugar-sweetened beverages can result in meaningful weight loss, even if it‚Äôs the only change you make. Replacing a 20-ounce soda with sparkling water every day would save more than 20,000 calories over a few months, which could translate into more than five pounds of weight loss!‚Äù ‚Äî Brittany Markides, RDN, the founder of Choose Food in Austin, Texas

14. Be Choosy at Restaurants

‚ÄúThe foods we eat away from home tend to be higher in calories and lower in nutrients than the ones we make at home. A study published in April 2016 in the Journal of the Academy of Nutrition and Dieteticsfound that the average restaurant entr√©e contains more than 1,000 calories, and an entire day‚Äôs worth of sodium and fat. To save calories, split your entr√©e or ask the server to substitute extra green veggies or a salad for potato or rice.‚Äù ‚Äî Markides

15. Embrace Veggies

‚ÄúWhen in doubt, eat a vegetable. They‚Äôre low-calorie, high-fiber, and full of nutrition. Snack on kale, lettuce, carrots, or green beans. And finally: Skip the butter and oil, but do add herbs or garlic for a great taste.‚Äù ‚Äî Jamie Logie, a personal trainer, nutritionist, health coach, and wellness blogger in London, Ontario

RELATED: 14 Healthy Salad Greens Ranked From Best to Worst

16. In Fact, Make Vegetables the Stars

‚ÄúNext time you make pasta, make a very small portion of the pasta itself and toss the dish with roasted broccoli, shrimp, garlic, and lemon zest. You‚Äôll feel less deprived and you‚Äôll be able to still eat your favorite satisfying foods.‚Äù ‚Äî Kate Martino, a physician‚Äôs assistant and weight loss coach in private practice in Fair Lawn, New Jersey

17. Keep Unhealthy Foods out of the House

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty simple: If you don‚Äôt have it, you can‚Äôt eat it. Instead of chips and cookies, keep convenient and easy-to-prepare items at close reach. Such items include nuts and seeds, precut fruit and vegetables, string cheese, edamame, eggs, salmon, and yogurt. This doesn‚Äôt mean you can‚Äôt have treats. Just buy yourself one serving to enjoy at a time.‚Äù ‚Äî Rachel Goodman, RDN, a registered dietitian nutritionist in private practice in Brooklyn, New York

18. Use Portion-Controlled Dishes

‚ÄúWe eat with our eyes first and we like to see a full plate. Using smaller plates, bowls, and cups will reduce the amount of food you can serve yourself, while at the same time allow you to fill your dish up and keep you from feeling deprived. For example, an observational study showed that people who used a 9-inch plate versus a 10- or 12-inch plate ate up to 22 percent less!‚Äù ‚Äî Goodman

RELATED: 10 Essential Facts About Metabolism and Weight Loss

19. Start Where You Are and Do What You Can

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt feel like you need to overhaul your entire life starting immediately. Assess where you are currently and then figure out where you‚Äôd like to be in the future. A great starting point for mostly sedentary people is to get a step counter and see how much you walk on a normal day. Then set a step goal slightly higher than the norm and strive for that, working your way up slowly to a goal of 10,000 steps per day.‚Äù ‚Äî Esther Avant, an ACE-certified personal trainer in Kapolei, Hawaii

20. Salt Craving? Skip the Chips

‚ÄúWhen you need a salty fix, reach for popcorn, not chips. According to one study, those who munch on a cup of the air-popped treat are significantly more satisfied than their chip-loving friends. Popcorn is a whole grain, fiber-filled snack. A single serving of potato chips (for a typical 1-oz small bag) is a dense 149 calories, while the same amount of popcorn (air-popped) is only 108, meaning you can feel full and slim down with every delicious bite.‚Äù ‚Äî Rene Ficek, RD, CDE, with Seattle Sutton‚Äôs Healthy Eating

21. Eat Breakfast

‚ÄúTo combat the urge to overindulge in the evening, make sure to eat a protein- and fiber-filled breakfast in the morning. Healthy choices for protein include eggs, yogurt, and nuts or nut butters. Pair protein with a high-fiber food like a high-fiber cereal or fruit.‚Äù ‚Äî Ficek

title: How to lose weight for sure!
text:
DIET

Have a high protein breakfast, milk and eggs are recommended.Healthy protein sources include:

meat: beef, chicken, pork, and lamb

beef, chicken, pork, and lamb fish and seafood: salmon, trout, and shrimp

salmon, trout, and shrimp eggs: whole eggs with the yolk

whole eggs with the yolk plant-based proteins: beans, legumes, quinoa, tempeh, and tofu

2. Cut back on refined carbs, DO NOT eat sweets and sugary food they are bad for you, stay away from all types of soft drinks. This helps you lower your appetite.

3. Eat a lot of VEGETABLES, when ever you feel hungry or are craving for that fried snack go and grab a vegetable this will give you all the vitamins and fiber necessary for your metabolism. Vegetables to include for low carb or low calorie eating plans:

broccoli

cauliflower

spinach

tomatoes

kale

Brussels sprouts

cabbage

Swiss chard

lettuce

cucumber

4. Drink water before meals.

5. Eat healthy fats, don‚Äôt be afraid, your body still needs healthy fats, avocado oil and olive oil are great choices.

SUMMARY

Assemble each meal out of a protein source, healthy fat source, complex carb, and vegetables.

Leafy green vegetables are a great way to bulk up a meal with low calories and lots of nutrients.

WORKOUTS

Although working out isn‚Äôt necessary, it does fasten the process.

Lifting weights is a great start, it burns a lot of calories and keeps your metabolism from slowing down. 2 to 3 times a week to the gym is a great start and then you can move from there, if you‚Äôre new to the gym get yourself a trainer as that would be the best.

If gym and weight lifting is not an option for you then cardiovascular exercises like walking, jogging, running, swimming, cycling are really good for your health, not only does it help you shed some calories but it also improves the health of your heart and increases blood flow throughout the body. So regular cardio is very much recommended.

SUPPLEMENTS

There are great weight loss supplements out there, but you need to be very careful because many of them out there cause bad side effects and aren‚Äôt healthy. Here are some of the best working supplements for weight loss.

EXIPURE

So what is exipure?

Exipure is an all-natural supplement that helps you lose weight, reduce your cholesterol and blood pressure levels. The product contains a combination of natural ingredients, including green tea extract, guarana seed powder, chromium picolinate, L-carnitine fumarate, vitamin B6, magnesium oxide, Ginkgo Biloba leaf extract, yerba mate herb, alpha-lipoic acid, coenzyme Q10, and more.

The aim of this pill is to increase metabolism to burn fat faster. Exipure works by boosting your brown adipose tissue (BAT) levels to burn fat and increase metabolism. It is a natural supplement that helps you lose weight without any side effects or negative impacts on the body. The product contains no harmful chemicals, preservatives, or additives, and is FDA approved which make it safe for consumption.

But does it work for real?

Several types of research go a long way to back the effectiveness of Exipure. There is no argument, the blend of nutrients in this product works, and it has been proven by many studies that have gone on for years now.

For example, an Exipure study in 2017 on rats showed that there was an increase in fat burning after just two weeks of using the supplement. The same rat study also showed that the extract had anti-inflammatory properties, which helped reduce inflammation within the body.

REVIEWS FROM USERS

"I started taking ExiPure 2 months ago, and I am amazed at my progress so far. My husband lost 50 lbs over 6 months, and he feels amazing. He looks 10 years younger, and his skin glows. We both love our new bodies. it‚Äôs a great product i recommend you to buy now!"

‚ÄúThis stuff changed my life. I‚Äôve never felt healthier and happier. I‚Äôm down 20lbs since starting the program. I don‚Äôt think anything else compares to Exipure.‚Äù

DOSAGE

Start with one capsule once daily and gradually build up to two capsules twice daily over 7‚Äì14 days. For best results, continue to take two capsules twice daily for 6‚Äì12 months.

REVITAA PRO

What is revitaa pro?

Revitaa pro is a all natural nutritional supplement that helps reduce stress and lose weight! It is FDA approved, gluten free, non GMO and safe.

The formula comprises TBT(Tributyltin) and Resveratrol-rich Japanese Knotweed to help you reduce weight, stress, stay healthy and live longer.

Unlike other weight loss products on the market, this one has undergone significant investigations before being released.

But does it work for real?

DOSAGE

When consumed in the proper dosage, which is one capsule twice a day with meals, this single ingredient has been shown in studies to reduce cholesterol levels, regulate blood sugar and pressure, reduce cortisol levels, and speed fat-burning.

CONCLUSION

Having a low carb, high protein diet, exercising daily and using any one of these supplements will help you reduce weight pretty quickly, but all of these must be done consistently. If you‚Äôve made it till here, thanks for reading and please do share this to your family and friends as it‚Äôll make my day! thank you!
